event.name: AbusiveExperienceHeuristic
event.summary: Obsolete. Various metrics recording experiences which are commonly used for abusive purposes.

metric.name: DidTabUnder
metric.summary: True if the page attempted a tab-under navigation.

metric.name: DidWindowOpenFromAdScript
metric.summary: True if the page called window.open with an ad script in the stack.

metric.name: DidWindowOpenFromAdSubframe
metric.summary: True if the page called window.open() from an ad subframe.

metric.name: DismissalCause
metric.summary: An enum that specifies the dismissal reason for JavaScript popup dialog that can be triggered by window.alert(), window.confirm() or window.prompt(). See JavaScriptDialogTabHelper::DismissalCause for the enum elements.

metric.name: DidTabUnder
metric.summary: True if the page attempted a tab-under navigation.

event.name: AbusiveExperienceHeuristic.WindowOpen
event.summary: Recorded whenever window.open() is called when AdTagging is enabled.

metric.name: FromAdScript
metric.summary: True if the page called window.open() with an ad script in the stack.

metric.name: FromAdSubframe
metric.summary: True if the page called window.open() from an ad subframe.

event.name: AdFrameLoad
event.summary: Records metrics associated with a single ad frame for a page load. An ad frame includes itself and all of its child frames. Only recorded for frames with non-zero bytes. Recorded when a page is destroyed or when the app is backgrounded on mobile.

metric.name: CpuTime.PeakWindowedPercent
metric.summary: The peak percentage of CPU utilization attributed to the frame in any 30 second window prior to user activation. Frames that exist for less than 30 seconds still use 30 seconds as the denominator for the calculation.

metric.name: CpuTime.PreActivation
metric.summary: Wall time of tasks attributed to the frame after the frame recieved user activation. Measured in millseconds.

metric.name: CpuTime.Total
metric.summary: Total wall time of tasks attributed to the frame. Measured in milliseconds.

metric.name: FrameDepth
metric.summary: The depth of this frame's frame tree. There is no set limit on a frame's maximum depth.

metric.name: Loading.CacheBytes
metric.summary: Bytes loaded from the cache for all resources loaded within the frame. This is rounded down to the nearest exponential bucket (with a bucket ratio of 1.3).

metric.name: Loading.CacheBytes2
metric.summary: Bytes loaded from the cache for all resources loaded within the frame. This includes bytes loaded from both the HTTP cache and memory cache. This is rounded down to the nearest exponential bucket (with a bucket ratio of 1.3).

metric.name: Loading.ImageBytes
metric.summary: Network bytes loaded for resources with an image mime type within the frame. Includes header bytes. This is rounded down to the nearest exponential bucket (with a bucket ratio of 1.3).

metric.name: Loading.JavascriptBytes
metric.summary: Network bytes loaded for resources with a javascript mime type within the frame. Includes header bytes. This is rounded down to the nearest exponential bucket (with a bucket ratio of 1.3).

metric.name: Loading.NetworkBytes
metric.summary: Network bytes loaded for all resources within the frame. Includes header bytes. This is rounded down to the nearest exponential bucket (with a bucket ratio of 1.3).

metric.name: Loading.NumResources
metric.summary: Total number of resources loaded by the frame, including incomplete resources.

metric.name: Loading.VideoBytes
metric.summary: Network bytes loaded for resources with a video/ mime type within the frame. Includes header bytes. This is rounded down to the nearest exponential bucket (with a bucket ratio of 1.3).

metric.name: Status.CrossOrigin
metric.summary: An enum representing whether the frame was Cross-Origin or Same-Origin to it's parent frame. See FrameData::OriginStatus.

metric.name: Status.Media
metric.summary: An enum representing whether media was played in the frame. See FrameData::MediaStatus.

metric.name: Status.UserActivation
metric.summary: An enum representing whether the frame received user activation. See FrameData::UserActivationStatus.

metric.name: Timing.FirstContentfulPaint
metric.summary: Number of milliseconds before FirstContentfulpaint was reached in the frame. This is relative to subframe navigation start.

metric.name: Timing.Interactive
metric.summary: Number of millseconds before Time-To-Interactive was reached in the frame. This is relative to subframe navigation start.

metric.name: Timing.PreActivationForegroundDuration
metric.summary: Number of millseconds that the current web contents spent in the foreground prior to the frame receiving user activation.

metric.name: Visibility.FrameHeight
metric.summary: Last known height of the iframe in pixels. Not reported accurately when "Visiblity.Hidden" is true. This is rounded down to the nearest exponential bucket (with a bucket ratio of 1.15).

metric.name: Visibility.FrameWidth
metric.summary: Last known width of the iframe in pixels. Not reported accurately when "Visiblity.Hidden" is true. This is rounded down to the nearest exponential bucket (with a bucket ratio of 1.15).

metric.name: Visibility.Hidden
metric.summary: A 0 or 1 values representing whether the frame had a display=none styling set. Records the last known value.

event.name: AdPageLoad
event.summary: Recorded when a page has loadded non-zero ad bytes, and the page is being destroyed/navigated.

metric.name: AdBytes
metric.summary: Amount of network bytes used to load ad resource on the page. Includes resources that did not finish, and top-level ads. Measured in kilobytes.

metric.name: AdBytesPerSecond
metric.summary: Amount of network bytes used to load ad resources on the page, per second the page was alive after commit. Measured in kilobytes per second.

metric.name: AdBytesPerSecondAfterInteractive
metric.summary: Amount of network bytes used to load ad resources on the page per second after the page was interactive. Measured in kilobytes.

metric.name: AdCpuTime
metric.summary: Amount of CPU wall time inside of ad iframes over the duration of a page load, while the page is in the foreground. Measured in milliseconds.

metric.name: AdJavascriptBytes
metric.summary: Amount of network bytes used to load ad resources with a supported javascript mime type on the page. Measured in kilobytes.

metric.name: AdVideoBytes
metric.summary: Amount of network bytes used to load ad resources with a video mime type on the page. Measured in kilobytes.

metric.name: MainframeAdBytes
metric.summary: Amount of network bytes used to load ad resources in the main frame. Includes resources that did not finish but does not include resources in subframes. Measured in bytes. This is rounded to the nearest exponential bucket (with a bucket ratio of 1.3).

metric.name: TotalBytes
metric.summary: Amount of network bytes used to load resources on the page. Includes resources that did not finish. Measured in kilobytes.

metric.name: MainFrameAmpPageLoad
metric.summary: True if the page loaded in the main frame is an AMP document (has an amp attribute in the html element). Will not be recorded for non-AMP frames. Note that most AMP documents are loaded in a subframe from a reader like Google Search; this metric measures sites that are using AMP as a site-wide framework and not a reader experience.

metric.name: SubFrame.InteractiveTiming.FirstInputDelay3
metric.obsolete: Removed July 2019 in favor of FirstInputDelay4.
metric.summary: Measures First Input Delay, the duration between the hardware timestamp and the start of event processing on the main thread for the first meaningful input per navigation, in the AMP subframe. See https://goo.gl/tr1oTZ for a detailed explanation. In milliseconds.

metric.name: SubFrame.InteractiveTiming.FirstInputDelay4
metric.summary: Measures First Input Delay, the duration between the hardware timestamp and the start of event processing on the main thread for the first meaningful input per navigation, in the AMP subframe. See https://goo.gl/tr1oTZ for a detailed explanation. In milliseconds.

metric.name: SubFrame.LayoutInstability.CumulativeShiftScore
metric.summary: Measures the cumulative layout shift (bit.ly/lsm-explainer) that has occurred during the session, in the AMP subframe. This metric's integral value is 100x the fractional cumulative layout shift score described in the explainer.

metric.name: SubFrame.LayoutInstability.CumulativeShiftScore.BeforeInputOrScroll
metric.summary: Measures the cumulative layout shift (bit.ly/lsm-explainer) that has occurred in the AMP subframe, before any user input or document scroll. This metric's integral value is 100x the fractional cumulative layout shift score described in the explainer.

metric.name: SubFrame.LayoutStability.JankScore
metric.summary: Measures the amount of layout jank (bit.ly/lsm-explainer) that has occurred during the session, in the AMP subframe. This metric's integral value is 100x the fractional jank score described in the explainer.

metric.name: SubFrame.MainFrameToSubFrameNavigationDelta
metric.summary: Measures the time in milliseconds from the navigation in the main frame to the navigation in the AMP subframe. Will be negative in cases where the AMP subframe was prerendered. Will be positive in cases where the main frame was a non-same-document navigation. Should be near-zero when the main frame navigation is a same-document navigation and the AMP subframe was not prerendered.

metric.name: SubFrame.PaintTiming.NavigationToFirstContentfulPaint
metric.summary: Measures the time in milliseconds from navigation timing's navigation start to the time when the page first paints content, in the AMP subframe. A contentful paint includes a paint of text, image, SVG, or canvas.

metric.name: SubFrame.PaintTiming.NavigationToLargestContentfulPaint
metric.summary: Measures the time in milliseconds from navigation timing's navigation start to the time when the page first paints the largest content (text or image) within viewport, in the AMP subframe. See http://bit.ly/largest_contentful_paint_explainer for more details.

metric.name: SubFrame.PaintTiming.NavigationToLargestContentPaint
metric.summary: Measures the time in milliseconds from navigation timing's navigation start to the time when the page first paints the largest content (text or image) within viewport, in the AMP subframe. See http://bit.ly/largest_contentful_paint_explainer for more details.

metric.name: SubFrameAmpPageLoad
metric.summary: True if the page loaded in any subframe is an AMP document (has an amp attribute in the html element). Will not be recorded for non-AMP frames. Note that most AMP documents are loaded in a subframe from a reader like Google Search; this metric measures usage of such readers.

event.name: AppListAppClickData
event.summary: AppListAppClickData events contain click history metrics for an app. These events are recorded when an app is launched from the launcher on ChromeOS, but may be for an app different from the app launched. See event AppListAppLaunch for more detail on the keys used.

metric.name: AppLaunchId
metric.summary: The ID of the app launch event.

metric.name: AppType
metric.summary: The type of app. 1: CHROME, 2: PLAY, 3: PWA/Bookmark app.

metric.name: ClickRank
metric.summary: Rank apps by total number of clicks. The app with the most clicks has rank 1.

metric.name: ClicksEachHour00
metric.summary: The number of clicks on this app in the current session that occurred between 12:00am and 1:00am. Bucketing: values above 20 rounded down to the nearest 10. Maximum value of 200.

metric.name: ClicksEachHour01
metric.summary: The number of clicks on this app in the current session that occurred between 1:00am and 2:00am. Bucketing: values above 20 rounded down to the nearest 10. Maximum value of 200.

metric.name: ClicksEachHour02
metric.summary: The number of clicks on this app in the current session that occurred between 2:00am and 3:00am. Bucketing: values above 20 rounded down to the nearest 10. Maximum value of 200.

metric.name: ClicksEachHour03
metric.summary: The number of clicks on this app in the current session that occurred between 3:00am and 4:00am. Bucketing: values above 20 rounded down to the nearest 10. Maximum value of 200.

metric.name: ClicksEachHour04
metric.summary: The number of clicks on this app in the current session that occurred between 4:00am and 5:00am. Bucketing: values above 20 rounded down to the nearest 10. Maximum value of 200.

metric.name: ClicksEachHour05
metric.summary: The number of clicks on this app in the current session that occurred between 5:00am and 6:00am. Bucketing: values above 20 rounded down to the nearest 10. Maximum value of 200.

metric.name: ClicksEachHour06
metric.summary: The number of clicks on this app in the current session that occurred between 6:00am and 7:00am. Bucketing: values above 20 rounded down to the nearest 10. Maximum value of 200.

metric.name: ClicksEachHour07
metric.summary: The number of clicks on this app in the current session that occurred between 7:00am and 8:00am. Bucketing: values above 20 rounded down to the nearest 10. Maximum value of 200.

metric.name: ClicksEachHour08
metric.summary: The number of clicks on this app in the current session that occurred between 8:00am and 9:00am. Bucketing: values above 20 rounded down to the nearest 10. Maximum value of 200.

metric.name: ClicksEachHour09
metric.summary: The number of clicks on this app in the current session that occurred between 9:00am and 10:00am. Bucketing: values above 20 rounded down to the nearest 10. Maximum value of 200.

metric.name: ClicksEachHour10
metric.summary: The number of clicks on this app in the current session that occurred between 10:00am and 11:00am. Bucketing: values above 20 rounded down to the nearest 10. Maximum value of 200.

metric.name: ClicksEachHour11
metric.summary: The number of clicks on this app in the current session that occurred between 11:00am and 12:00pm. Bucketing: values above 20 rounded down to the nearest 10. Maximum value of 200.

metric.name: ClicksEachHour12
metric.summary: The number of clicks on this app in the current session that occurred between 12:00pm and 1:00pm. Bucketing: values above 20 rounded down to the nearest 10. Maximum value of 200.

metric.name: ClicksEachHour13
metric.summary: The number of clicks on this app in the current session that occurred between 1:00pm and 2:00pm. Bucketing: values above 20 rounded down to the nearest 10. Maximum value of 200.

metric.name: ClicksEachHour14
metric.summary: The number of clicks on this app in the current session that occurred between 2:00pm and 3:00pm. Bucketing: values above 20 rounded down to the nearest 10. Maximum value of 200.

metric.name: ClicksEachHour15
metric.summary: The number of clicks on this app in the current session that occurred between 3:00pm and 4:00pm. Bucketing: values above 20 rounded down to the nearest 10. Maximum value of 200.

metric.name: ClicksEachHour16
metric.summary: The number of clicks on this app in the current session that occurred between 4:00pm and 5:00pm. Bucketing: values above 20 rounded down to the nearest 10. Maximum value of 200.

metric.name: ClicksEachHour17
metric.summary: The number of clicks on this app in the current session that occurred between 5:00pm and 6:00pm. Bucketing: values above 20 rounded down to the nearest 10. Maximum value of 200.

metric.name: ClicksEachHour18
metric.summary: The number of clicks on this app in the current session that occurred between 6:00pm and 7:00pm. Bucketing: values above 20 rounded down to the nearest 10. Maximum value of 200.

metric.name: ClicksEachHour19
metric.summary: The number of clicks on this app in the current session that occurred between 7:00pm and 8:00pm. Bucketing: values above 20 rounded down to the nearest 10. Maximum value of 200.

metric.name: ClicksEachHour20
metric.summary: The number of clicks on this app in the current session that occurred between 8:00pm and 9:00pm. Bucketing: values above 20 rounded down to the nearest 10. Maximum value of 200.

metric.name: ClicksEachHour21
metric.summary: The number of clicks on this app in the current session that occurred between 9:00pm and 10:00pm. Bucketing: values above 20 rounded down to the nearest 10. Maximum value of 200.

metric.name: ClicksEachHour22
metric.summary: The number of clicks on this app in the current session that occurred between 10:00pm and 11:00pm. Bucketing: values above 20 rounded down to the nearest 10. Maximum value of 200.

metric.name: ClicksEachHour23
metric.summary: The number of clicks on this app in the current session that occurred between 11:00pm and 12:00am. Bucketing: values above 20 rounded down to the nearest 10. Maximum value of 200.

metric.name: ClicksLast24Hours
metric.summary: The number of clicks on this app in the last 24 hours. Accurate to 15 minutes. Bucketing: values above 20 rounded down to the nearest 10. Maximum value of 200.

metric.name: ClicksLastHour
metric.summary: The number of clicks on this app in the last hour. Accurate to one minute. Bucketing: values above 20 rounded down to the nearest 10. Maximum value of 200.

metric.name: LastLaunchedFrom
metric.summary: Where the app was last launched from. 1: GRID, 2: SUGGESTED, 3: SHELF.

metric.name: MostRecentlyUsedIndex
metric.summary: Index recording when in the sequence of app launch clicks the app was last clicked on. 0: most recent app clicked on, 1: app clicked immediately before the most recent, etc.

metric.name: SequenceNumber
metric.summary: The sequence number of the AppListAppLaunch event that corresponds to this AppListAppClickData event. There will be six AppListAppClickData events for each sequence number.

metric.name: TimeSinceLastClick
metric.summary: Time since this app was last clicked on to launch. In seconds, bucketed: [1, 59] to the nearest second, [60, 599] to the nearest minute, [600, 1199] to the nearest 5 minutes, [1200, 3599] to the nearest 10 minutes, [3600, 17999] to the nearest 30 minutes, [18000, 86400] to the nearest hour.

metric.name: TotalClicks
metric.summary: Total number of clicks launching this app in this sesion. Bucketing: values above 20 rounded down to the nearest 10. Maximum value of 200.

event.name: AppListAppLaunch
event.summary: Recorded when an app is launched from the launcher on ChromeOS. This can be from the suggestion chip, or from the grid of apps. The UKM metrics are not keyed by navigational urls. Instead, for Chrome apps the keys are based upon the app id, for Play apps the keys are based upon a hash of the package name and for PWAs and bookmark apps the keys are the urls associated with the PWA/bookmark.

metric.name: AllClicksLast24Hours
metric.summary: Total number of clicks launching logged apps in the last 24 hours. Accurate to the nearest 15 minutes. Bucketing: values above 20 rounded down to the nearest 10. Maximum value of 200.

metric.name: AllClicksLastHour
metric.summary: Total number of clicks launching logged apps in the last hour. Accurate to the nearest minute. Bucketing: values above 20 rounded down to the nearest 10. Maximum value of 200.

metric.name: AppType
metric.summary: The type of app. 1: CHROME, 2: PLAY, 3: PWA/Bookmark app.

metric.name: ClickMethod
metric.summary: Click method. 1: MOUSE, 2: TOUCH, 3: SYTLUS, 4: KEYBOARD.

metric.name: DayOfWeek
metric.summary: An enum representing the day of the week that the data was logged in the local time zone. Sunday = 0.

metric.name: DeviceMode
metric.summary: The mode of the device. 1: CLOSED_LID (Lid is closed), 2: LAPTOP (Lid is open, tablet mode off or unsupported) , 3: TABLET (Lid is open, tablet mode on or no lid at all).

metric.name: DeviceType
metric.summary: The type of the device. 1: TABLET, 2: LAPTOP.

metric.name: HourOfDay
metric.summary: The hour of the day when the data is logged. Hours since midnight in the local time zone.

metric.name: LaunchedFrom
metric.summary: Where the app was launched from. 1: GRID, 2: SUGGESTED, 3: SHELF.

metric.name: PositionIndex
metric.summary: The position of the app within the grid/suggested apps/shelf. 0 is the first position.

metric.name: TotalHours
metric.summary: Number of hours in the current session up to this event. Bucketing: exponential buckets, increasing in size by 25%, rounded to the nearest integer. i.e. 0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 9, 12, 15, 18, 23, 28, 36, 44...

event.name: AppListNonAppImpression
event.summary: Records details of impressions and launches of non-apps in the ChromeOS launcher, such as files, omnibox results, and answer cards.

metric.name: Category
metric.summary: The kind of launcher item. Corresponds to the value of ChromeSearchResult::result_[sub]type.

metric.name: DayOfWeek
metric.summary: The day of the week that the event was logged on, in the local time zone. Sunday is 0.

metric.name: DeviceMode
metric.summary: The mode of the device.

metric.name: EventId
metric.summary: An ID linking together events within a single set of launcher search results. One of these may be a launch, and the rest impressions.

metric.name: FileExtension
metric.summary: An enum representing the file extension if this event represents a local or DriveFS file.

metric.name: HourOfDay
metric.summary: The hour of the day that the event was logged in. Hours measured from midnight in the local timezone.

metric.name: IsLaunched
metric.summary: True if the item represented by this event was launched, false otherwise.

metric.name: LaunchesAtHour00
metric.summary: The number of launches within the last 24 hours at hour 0. Rounded down to the nearest exponential bucket, with a bucket ratio of 1.15.

metric.name: LaunchesAtHour01
metric.summary: The number of launches within the last 24 hours at hour 1. Rounded down to the nearest exponential bucket, with a bucket ratio of 1.15.

metric.name: LaunchesAtHour02
metric.summary: The number of launches within the last 24 hours at hour 2. Rounded down to the nearest exponential bucket, with a bucket ratio of 1.15.

metric.name: LaunchesAtHour03
metric.summary: The number of launches within the last 24 hours at hour 3. Rounded down to the nearest exponential bucket, with a bucket ratio of 1.15.

metric.name: LaunchesAtHour04
metric.summary: The number of launches within the last 24 hours at hour 4. Rounded down to the nearest exponential bucket, with a bucket ratio of 1.15.

metric.name: LaunchesAtHour05
metric.summary: The number of launches within the last 24 hours at hour 5. Rounded down to the nearest exponential bucket, with a bucket ratio of 1.15.

metric.name: LaunchesAtHour06
metric.summary: The number of launches within the last 24 hours at hour 6. Rounded down to the nearest exponential bucket, with a bucket ratio of 1.15.

metric.name: LaunchesAtHour07
metric.summary: The number of launches within the last 24 hours at hour 7. Rounded down to the nearest exponential bucket, with a bucket ratio of 1.15.

metric.name: LaunchesAtHour08
metric.summary: The number of launches within the last 24 hours at hour 8. Rounded down to the nearest exponential bucket, with a bucket ratio of 1.15.

metric.name: LaunchesAtHour09
metric.summary: The number of launches within the last 24 hours at hour 9. Rounded down to the nearest exponential bucket, with a bucket ratio of 1.15.

metric.name: LaunchesAtHour10
metric.summary: The number of launches within the last 24 hours at hour 10. Rounded down to the nearest exponential bucket, with a bucket ratio of 1.15.

metric.name: LaunchesAtHour11
metric.summary: The number of launches within the last 24 hours at hour 11. Rounded down to the nearest exponential bucket, with a bucket ratio of 1.15.

metric.name: LaunchesAtHour12
metric.summary: The number of launches within the last 24 hours at hour 12. Rounded down to the nearest exponential bucket, with a bucket ratio of 1.15.

metric.name: LaunchesAtHour13
metric.summary: The number of launches within the last 24 hours at hour 13. Rounded down to the nearest exponential bucket, with a bucket ratio of 1.15.

metric.name: LaunchesAtHour14
metric.summary: The number of launches within the last 24 hours at hour 14. Rounded down to the nearest exponential bucket, with a bucket ratio of 1.15.

metric.name: LaunchesAtHour15
metric.summary: The number of launches within the last 24 hours at hour 15. Rounded down to the nearest exponential bucket, with a bucket ratio of 1.15.

metric.name: LaunchesAtHour16
metric.summary: The number of launches within the last 24 hours at hour 16. Rounded down to the nearest exponential bucket, with a bucket ratio of 1.15.

metric.name: LaunchesAtHour17
metric.summary: The number of launches within the last 24 hours at hour 17. Rounded down to the nearest exponential bucket, with a bucket ratio of 1.15.

metric.name: LaunchesAtHour18
metric.summary: The number of launches within the last 24 hours at hour 18. Rounded down to the nearest exponential bucket, with a bucket ratio of 1.15.

metric.name: LaunchesAtHour19
metric.summary: The number of launches within the last 24 hours at hour 19. Rounded down to the nearest exponential bucket, with a bucket ratio of 1.15.

metric.name: LaunchesAtHour20
metric.summary: The number of launches within the last 24 hours at hour 20. Rounded down to the nearest exponential bucket, with a bucket ratio of 1.15.

metric.name: LaunchesAtHour21
metric.summary: The number of launches within the last 24 hours at hour 21. Rounded down to the nearest exponential bucket, with a bucket ratio of 1.15.

metric.name: LaunchesAtHour22
metric.summary: The number of launches within the last 24 hours at hour 22. Rounded down to the nearest exponential bucket, with a bucket ratio of 1.15.

metric.name: LaunchesAtHour23
metric.summary: The number of launches within the last 24 hours at hour 23. Rounded down to the nearest exponential bucket, with a bucket ratio of 1.15.

metric.name: LaunchesThisSession
metric.summary: How many times this item has been launched during this session. Rounded down to the nearest exponential bucket, with a bucket ratio of 1.15.

metric.name: Position
metric.summary: The index of this item in the search results list. Indices start at 0.

metric.name: QueryLength
metric.summary: The length of the raw search query with whitespace trimmed. Rounded down to the nearest exponential bucket, with a bucket ratio of 1.15.

metric.name: RelevanceScore
metric.summary: The raw relevance score returned by the relevant search provider for this item.

metric.name: TimeOfLastLaunch
metric.summary: The hour when the previous launch of this item occurred. Hours measured from midnight in the local timezone. This can be any value 0-23, as the last launch could have been on a previous day.

metric.name: TimeSinceLastLaunch
metric.summary: Seconds since this item was last launched in this session. Rounded down to the nearest exponential bucket, with a bucket ratio of 1.045. This makes the bucket at 24 hour mark approximately 1 hour long.

metric.name: UploadDecision
metric.summary: Whether the upload was proposed to the user or the reasons why it was not. The value is a bitmask of |CardUploadDecisionMetric|.

event.name: Autofill.DeveloperEngagement
event.summary: Recorded when we parse a form to log whether developer has used autocomplete markup or UPI-VPA hints. The value is a bitmask of |DeveloperEngagementMetric|.

metric.name: FormSignature
metric.summary: The signature of the form. This is the hash identifier used to denote this form for query and voting purposes. See components/autofill/core/common/signatures_util.cc for more details.

metric.name: FormTypes
metric.summary: Type of form. Stored as bitvector. A set ith bit implies enum FormType's ith type was detected. Multiple types are possible.

metric.name: IsForCreditCard
metric.summary: True for credit card forms, false for address/profile forms. See |FormStructure::IsCompleteCreditCardForm()|.

event.name: Autofill.FieldFillStatus
event.summary: Recorded when Chrome validates field type predictions (on submit, on leaving a form, on receiving a form with autocomplete attributes).

metric.name: FieldSignature
metric.summary: The signature of the field. This is the hash identifier used to denote this field for query and voting purposes. See components/autofill/core/common/signatures_util.cc for more details.

metric.name: FormSignature
metric.summary: The signature of the form. This is the hash identifier used to denote this form for query and voting purposes. See components/autofill/core/common/signatures_util.cc for more details.

metric.name: IsAutofilled
metric.summary: The field is currently autofilled.

metric.name: MillisecondsSinceFormParsed
metric.summary: Time since form parse.

metric.name: PredictionSource
metric.summary: The system which generated the prediction: heuristics, server, overall.

metric.name: ValidationEvent
metric.summary: The event which triggered the validation: Submission, Left Form, Form has Autocomplete attributes.

metric.name: WasPreviouslyAutofilled
metric.summary: The field was autofilled and subsequently edited.

event.name: Autofill.FieldTypeValidation
event.summary: Recorded when Chrome validates field type predictions (on submit, on leaving a form, on receiving a form with autocomplete attributes).

metric.name: ActualType
metric.summary: The observed type of the field. See: autofill::ServerFieldType

metric.name: FieldSignature
metric.summary: The signature of the field

metric.name: FormSignature
metric.summary: The signature of the form.

metric.name: MillisecondsSinceFormParsed
metric.summary: Time since form parse.

metric.name: PredictedType
metric.summary: The predicted type of the field. See: autofill::ServerFieldType

metric.name: PredictionSource
metric.summary: The system which generated the prediction: heuristics, server, overall.

metric.name: ValidationEvent
metric.summary: The event which triggered the validation: Submission, Left Form, Form has Autocomplete attributes.

event.name: Autofill.FormEvent
event.summary: Recorded when user interacted with autofill.

metric.name: AutofillFormEvent
metric.summary: Logs autofill form events funnel. See |FormEvent|.

metric.name: FormTypes
metric.summary: Type of form. Stored as bitvector. A set ith bit implies enum FormType's ith type was detected. Multiple types are possible.

metric.name: MillisecondsSinceFormParsed
metric.summary: Time since form parse.

event.name: Autofill.FormSubmitted
event.summary: Recorded when user submits a form.

metric.name: AutofillFormSubmittedState
metric.summary: Whether form's fields were all autofilled, some fields were autofilled, or none of the field were autofilled. See |AutofillFormSubmittedState|.

metric.name: FormSignature
metric.summary: FormSignature is approximately 10 bit hash of form structure.

metric.name: FormTypes
metric.summary: Type of form. Stored as bitvector. A set ith bit implies enum FormType's ith type was detected. Multiple types are possible.

metric.name: HasUpiVpaField
metric.summary: True for forms containing a UPI/VPA field.

metric.name: IsForCreditCard
metric.summary: True for credit card forms, false for address/profile forms. See |FormStructure::IsCompleteCreditCardForm()|.

metric.name: MillisecondsSinceFormParsed
metric.summary: Time since form parse.

event.name: Autofill.HiddenRepresentationalFieldSkipDecision
event.summary: Recorded while trying to fill or preview a hidden or a representational field.

metric.name: FieldOverallType
metric.summary: Field's overall |ServerFieldType|. See |AutofillField.GetStorableType()|.

metric.name: FieldSignature
metric.summary: The signature of the field. This is the hash identifier used to denote this field for query and voting purposes. See components/autofill/core/common/signatures_util.cc for more details.

metric.name: FieldTypeGroup
metric.summary: Field's |FieldTypeGroup|. See |AutofillType.group()|.

metric.name: FormSignature
metric.summary: The signature of the form. This is the hash identifier used to denote this form for query and voting purposes. See components/autofill/core/common/signatures_util.cc for more details.

metric.name: HeuristicType
metric.summary: Field's |ServerFieldType| based on heuristics. See |AutofillField.heuristic_type()|.

metric.name: HtmlFieldMode
metric.summary: Whether the field's autocomplete hint specified 'billing' or 'shipping'. See |AutofillField.html_mode()|.

metric.name: HtmlFieldType
metric.summary: Field's autocomplete field type hint. See |AutofillField.html_type()|.

metric.name: IsSkipped
metric.summary: True if the field was skipped while filling or previewing the form, because it was hidden or representational, but not a 'select' one.

metric.name: ServerType
metric.summary: Field's |ServerFieldType| returned by server. See |AutofillField.server_type()|.

event.name: Autofill.InteractedWithForm
event.summary: Recorded when we parse a form to log form metadata and autofill settings that apply to all subsequent events for this form.

metric.name: FormSignature
metric.summary: FormSignature is approximately 10 bit hash of form structure.

metric.name: FormTypes
metric.summary: Type of form. Stored as bitvector. A set ith bit implies enum FormType's ith type was detected. Multiple types are possible.

metric.name: IsForCreditCard
metric.summary: True for credit card forms, false for address/profile forms.

metric.name: LocalRecordTypeCount
metric.summary: Number of local credit cards or local autofill profiles.

metric.name: ServerRecordTypeCount
metric.summary: Number of masked and full server credit cards or server autofill profiles.

event.name: Autofill.RepeatedServerTypePredictionRationalized
event.summary: Recorded when a field type predicted by server is rationalized because of repetition.

metric.name: FieldNewOverallType
metric.summary: Field's overall |ServerFieldType| after rationalization. See |AutofillField.GetStorableType()|.

metric.name: FieldOldOverallType
metric.summary: Field's overall |ServerFieldType| before rationalization. See |AutofillField.GetStorableType()|.

metric.name: FieldSignature
metric.summary: The signature of the field. This is the hash identifier used to denote this field for query and voting purposes. See components/autofill/core/common/signatures_util.cc for more details.

metric.name: FieldTypeGroup
metric.summary: Field's |FieldTypeGroup|. See |AutofillType.group()|.

metric.name: FormSignature
metric.summary: The signature of the form. This is the hash identifier used to denote this form for query and voting purposes. See components/autofill/core/common/signatures_util.cc for more details.

metric.name: HeuristicType
metric.summary: Field's |ServerFieldType| based on heuristics. See |AutofillField.heuristic_type()|.

metric.name: HtmlFieldMode
metric.summary: Whether the field's autocomplete hint specified 'billing' or 'shipping'. See |AutofillField.html_mode()|.

metric.name: HtmlFieldType
metric.summary: Field's autocomplete field type hint. See |AutofillField.html_type()|.

metric.name: ServerType
metric.summary: Field's |ServerFieldType| returned by server. See |AutofillField.server_type()|.

metric.name: MillisecondsSinceFormParsed
metric.summary:
Obsolete.
Time since form parse.

event.name: Autofill.SuggestionFilled
event.summary: Recorded when user selects a suggestion and we fill the form with that suggestion.

metric.name: FieldSignature
metric.summary: The signature of the field

metric.name: FormSignature
metric.summary: The signature of the form.

metric.name: IsForCreditCard
metric.summary: True for credit card forms, false for address/profile forms.

metric.name: MillisecondsSinceFormParsed
metric.summary: Time since form parse.

metric.name: RecordType
metric.summary: Whether the suggestion was from a local card/autofill profile or from a server card/autofill profile.

event.name: Autofill.SuggestionsShown
event.summary: Recorded when a suggestion is shown to user.

metric.name: FieldSignature
metric.summary: The signature of the field

metric.name: FormSignature
metric.summary: The signature of the form.

metric.name: HeuristicType
metric.summary: Field's |ServerFieldType| based on heuristics. See |AutofillField.heuristic_type()|.

metric.name: HtmlFieldType
metric.summary: Field's autocomplete field type hint. See |AutofillField.html_type()|.

metric.name: MillisecondsSinceFormParsed
metric.summary: Time since form parse.

metric.name: ServerType
metric.summary: Field's |ServerFieldType| returned by server. See |AutofillField.server_type()|.

event.name: Autofill.TextFieldDidChange
event.summary: Recorded when user edits a text field. The text field may have been autofilled.

metric.name: FieldSignature
metric.summary: The signature of the field

metric.name: FieldTypeGroup
metric.summary: Field's |FieldTypeGroup|. See |AutofillType.group()|.

metric.name: FormSignature
metric.summary: The signature of the form.

metric.name: HeuristicType
metric.summary: Field's |ServerFieldType| based on heuristics. See |AutofillField.heuristic_type()|.

metric.name: HtmlFieldMode
metric.summary: Whether the field's autocomplete hint specified 'billing' or 'shipping'. See |AutofillField.html_mode()|.

metric.name: HtmlFieldType
metric.summary: Field's autocomplete field type hint. See |AutofillField.html_type()|.

metric.name: IsAutofilled
metric.summary: True if the field was autofilled. See |AutofillField.is_autofilled|.

metric.name: IsEmpty
metric.summary: True if the field was empty. See |AutofillField.IsEmpty()|.

metric.name: MillisecondsSinceFormParsed
metric.summary: Time since form parse.

metric.name: ServerType
metric.summary: Field's |ServerFieldType| returned by server. See |AutofillField.server_type()|.

event.name: BackgroundFetch
event.summary: A BackgroundFetch event is logged before a background fetch is started from a document context.

metric.name: DeniedDueToPermissions
metric.summary: Boolean for whether the background fetch was denied due to permission. This includes only the content setting permission.

metric.name: DownloadTotal
metric.summary: The value of downloadTotal provided with the background fetch. This is the number of bytes that the developer expects to be downloaded with the background fetch. This number is exponentially bucketed for privacy reasons, and uses the UKM GetExponentialBucketMin method with a value of 2.0 for spacing.

metric.name: HasTitle
metric.summary: Boolean for whether a title was provided with the background fetch.

metric.name: NumIcons
metric.summary: Count of icons provided with the background fetch.

metric.name: NumRequestsInFetch
metric.summary: Number of requests in the background fetch. This number is exponentially bucketed for privacy reasons, and uses the UKM GetExponentialBucketMin method with a value of 2.0 for spacing.

metric.name: RatioOfIdealToChosenIconSize
metric.summary: Ratio of the ideal icon to the chosen icon size, times hundred. This will be set to -1 if either ideal icon size is 0, or if none of the provided icons are suitable.

event.name: BackgroundFetchDeletingRegistration
event.summary: A BackgroundFetchDeletingRegistration event is logged when a background fetch job is being deleted.

metric.name: UserInitiatedAbort
metric.summary: Boolean for whether the background fetch job was cancelled from the UI.

event.name: BackgroundSyncCompleted
event.summary: Logged when a Background Sync one-shot registration is completed.

metric.name: MaxAttempts
metric.summary: Integer value of the maximum number of allowed retries.

metric.name: NumAttempts
metric.summary: Integer value of the number of retries / sync events dispatched.

metric.name: Status
metric.summary: The enum value of the completion status, defined in blink::ServiceWorkerStatusCode.

event.name: BackgroundSyncRegistered
event.summary: Logged when a one-shot Background Sync registration is created.

metric.name: CanFire
metric.summary: Boolean for whether a sync event can be immediately dispatched for this registration.

metric.name: IsReregistered
metric.summary: Boolean for whether this is a duplicate registration.

event.name: Badging
event.summary: Metrics that measure the use of Badging API

metric.name: UpdateAppBadge
metric.summary: Logged when navigator.setAppBadge or navigator.clearAppBadge is called.

event.name: Blink.FindInPage
event.summary: Logged once per page; indicates the type of find-in-page behaviors users utilizied.

metric.name: DidHaveRenderSubtreeMatch
metric.summary: Boolean indicating whether there was an active match in content-visibility unrendered elements.

metric.name: DidSearch
metric.summary: Boolean indicating that find-in-page happened.

event.name: Blink.HTMLParsing
event.summary:
Logged once per page load, to capture information about invocation of the HTMLDocumentParser for the initial document load. Does not include other aspects of document parsing, such as style sheet parsing or script execution during parsing. Also does not include innerText parsing.
This event is not recorded on machines with low-resolution clocks.

metric.name: ChunkCount
metric.summary: The number of chunks parsed while loading the page. Each chunk represents a piece of the HTML content that can be loaded without blocking or yielding.

metric.name: ParsingTimeMax
metric.summary: The maximum time used to parse a single chunk before being blocked, yielding or completing, in microseconds.

metric.name: ParsingTimeMin
metric.summary: The minimum time used to parse a single chunk before being blocked, yielding or completing, in microseconds.

metric.name: ParsingTimeTotal
metric.summary: The total amount of time spent in the HTMLDocumentParser parsing the page, in microseconds.

metric.name: TokensParsedAverage
metric.summary: The average number of tokens parsed across all chunks.

metric.name: TokensParsedMax
metric.summary: The maximum number of tokens parsed as a chunk.

metric.name: TokensParsedMin
metric.summary: The minimum number of tokens parsed as a chunk.

metric.name: YieldedTimeAverage
metric.summary: The average time between parsing of two chunks, in microseconds. Will be zero if only one chunk was parsed.

metric.name: YieldedTimeMax
metric.summary: The minimum time between parsing of two chunks, in microseconds. Will be zero if only one chunk was parsed.

metric.name: YieldedTimeMin
metric.summary: The maximum time between parsing of two chunks, in microseconds. Will be zero if only one chunk was parsed.

event.name: Blink.PageLoad
event.summary:
The aggregated time spent in each metric's component from creation of the local frame view to the First Contentful Paint signal. The event is reported once per page load when First Contentful Paint is signaled.
This event is not recorded on machines with low-resolution clocks.

metric.name: Animate
metric.summary: The time spent in main frame animation, between navigation and First Contentful Paint, in microseconds.

metric.name: Compositing
metric.summary: The time spent in main thread compositing, between navigation and First Contentful Paint, in microseconds.

metric.name: CompositingCommit
metric.summary: The time spent committing main thread compositing results, between navigation and First Contentful Paint, in microseconds.

metric.name: ForcedStyleAndLayout
metric.summary: The time spent in forced style recalc and layouts, between navigation and First Contentful Paint, in microseconds.

metric.name: HandleInputEvents
metric.summary: The time spent in processing rAF-aligned input for the main frame, between navigation and First Contentful Paint, in microseconds.

metric.name: HitTestDocumentUpdate
metric.summary: The time spent updating the document in preparation for a hit test for the main frame, between navigation and First Contentful Paint, in microseconds.

metric.name: ImplCompositorCommit
metric.summary: The time spent committing layer tree impl data in the compositor thread, between navigation and First Contentful Paint, in microseconds.

metric.name: IntersectionObservation
metric.summary: The time spent computing intersection observer state, between navigation and First Contentful Paint, in microseconds.

metric.name: Layout
metric.summary: The time spent in layout document lifecycle work, between navigation and First Contentful Paint, in microseconds.

metric.name: MainFrame
metric.summary: The time spent in ProxyMain::BeginMainFrame, between navigation and First Contentful Paint, in microseconds.

metric.name: Paint
metric.summary: The time spent in paint document lifecycle work, between navigation and First Contentful Paint, in microseconds.

metric.name: PrePaint
metric.summary: The time spent in pre-paint document lifecycle work, between navigation and First Contentful Paint, in microseconds.

metric.name: ProxyCommit
metric.summary: The time spent committing main thread to impl layer tree information, between navigation and First Contentful Paint, in microseconds. TODO(crbug.com/1058065): Should be obsolete. Removed February 2020 in favor of separate metrics for the wait time and the actual commit time.

metric.name: ScrollingCoordinator
metric.summary: The time spent in ScrollingCoordinator, between navigation and First Contentful Paint, in microseconds.

metric.name: Style
metric.summary: The time spent in style document lifecycle work, between navigation and First Contentful Paint, in microseconds.

metric.name: StyleAndLayout
metric.obsolete: Removed January 2020 in favor of separate Style and Layout metrics.
metric.summary: The time spent in layout and style document lifecycle work, between navigation and First Contentful Paint, in microseconds. Will be obsolete in M-82.

metric.name: UpdateLayers
metric.summary: The time spent in for LayerTreeHost::UpdateLayers, between navigation and First Contentful Paint, in microseconds.

metric.name: WaitForCommit
metric.summary: The time spent waiting for the compositor thread to begin processing a commit, between navigation and First Contentful Paint, in microseconds.

event.name: Blink.UpdateTime
event.summary:
Metrics that measure various update times in Blink. This includes paint, compositing, and layout update times. The metrics are recorded at first lifecycle update and then a random frame with mean interval of 2000 frames.
This event is not recorded on machines with low-resolution clocks.

metric.name: Animate
metric.summary: The time taken for main frame animation in microseconds during the sampled frame.

metric.name: Animate.Average
metric.summary: The average time taken for main frame animation in microseconds in the event period.

metric.name: Animate.AverageRatio
metric.summary: The average over frames within the sample window of the ratio of time taken for main frame animation to the total time for the main frame. An int in the range [0,100].

metric.name: Animate.WorstCase
metric.summary: The longest single time taken for main frame animation in microseconds in the event period.

metric.name: Animate.WorstCaseRatio
metric.summary: The highest proportion of a frame ever used for main frame animation within the sample window. An int in the range [0,100].

metric.name: AnimatePercentage
metric.summary: The percentage of the main frame time used by main thread animations. An int in the range [0,100].

metric.name: Compositing
metric.summary: The time taken by the compositing phase in microseconds during the sampled frame.

metric.name: Compositing.Average
metric.summary: The average time taken by the compositing phase in microseconds in the event period.

metric.name: Compositing.AverageRatio
metric.summary: The average over frames within the sample window of the ratio of time taken in the compositing phase to the total time for the main frame. An int in the range [0,100].

metric.name: Compositing.WorstCase
metric.summary: The longest single time taken by the compositing phase in microseconds in the event period.

metric.name: Compositing.WorstCaseRatio
metric.summary: The highest proportion of a frame ever used by the compositing phase within the sample window. An int in the range [0,100].

metric.name: CompositingCommit
metric.summary: The time taken by the compositing commit in microseconds during the sampled frame.

metric.name: CompositingCommit.Average
metric.summary: The average time taken by the compositing commit at the end of the blink lifecycle, in microseconds in the event period.

metric.name: CompositingCommit.AverageRatio
metric.summary: The average over frames within the sample window of the ratio of time taken by the compositing commit at the end of the blink lifecycle to the total time for the main frame. An int in the range [0,100].

metric.name: CompositingCommit.WorstCase
metric.summary: The longest single time taken by the compositing commit at the end of the blink lifecycle, in microseconds in the event period.

metric.name: CompositingCommit.WorstCaseRatio
metric.summary: The highest proportion of a frame ever taken by the compositing commit at the end of the blink lifecycle to the total time for the main frame. An int in the range [0,100].

metric.name: CompositingCommitPercentage
metric.summary: The percentage of the main frame time used by the compositing commit. An int in the range [0,100].

metric.name: CompositingPercentage
metric.summary: The percentage of the main frame time used by the compositing phase. An int in the range [0,100].

metric.name: ForcedStyleAndLayout
metric.summary: The time taken by forced style recalc and layouts in microseconds between the end of the last main frame update and the current sampled frame, in microseconds.

metric.name: ForcedStyleAndLayout.Average
metric.summary: The average time taken by all forced style recalcs and layouts in microseconds in the event period.

metric.name: ForcedStyleAndLayout.AverageRatio
metric.summary: The average over frames within the sample window of the ratio of time taken by forced style recalc and layouts at the end of the blink lifecycle to the total time for the main frame. An int in the range [0,100].

metric.name: ForcedStyleAndLayout.WorstCase
metric.summary: The longest single time taken by a forced style recalc and layout in microseconds in the event period.

metric.name: ForcedStyleAndLayout.WorstCaseRatio
metric.summary: The highest proportion of a frame ever taken by forced style recalc and layouts at the end of the blink lifecycle to the total time for the main frame. An int in the range [0,100].

metric.name: ForcedStyleAndLayoutPercentage
metric.summary: The percentage of the main frame time used by forced style updates and layouts during the main frame update (not including time outside of the frame update. This metric may include time that is also included in the AnimatePercentage metric. An int in the range [0,100].

metric.name: HandleInputEvents
metric.summary: The time taken to process rAF-aligned input for the main frame in microseconds during the sampled frame.

metric.name: HandleInputEvents.Average
metric.summary: The average time taken to process rAF-aligned input for the main frame in microseconds in the event period.

metric.name: HandleInputEvents.AverageRatio
metric.summary: The average over frames within the sample window of the ratio of time taken to process rAF-aligned input for the main frame to the total time for the main frame. An int in the range [0,100].

metric.name: HandleInputEvents.WorstCase
metric.summary: The longest single time taken to process rAF-aligned input for the main frame in microseconds in the event period.

metric.name: HandleInputEvents.WorstCaseRatio
metric.summary: The highest proportion of a frame ever taken to process rAF-aligned input for the main frame to the total time for the main frame. An int in the range [0,100].

metric.name: HandleInputEventsPercentage
metric.summary: The percentage of the main frame time used in processing rAF-aligned input. An int in the range [0,100].

metric.name: HitTestDocumentUpdate
metric.summary: The time taken to perform hit test document updates for the main frame in microseconds during the sampled frame. It does not compute the actual hit test time, rather the style, layout, compositing, etc time to prepare for the test.

metric.name: HitTestDocumentUpdatePercentage
metric.summary: The percentage of the main frame time used in performing hit test document updates. An int in the range [0,100].

metric.name: ImplCompositorCommit
metric.summary: The time spent committing layer tree impl data in the compositor thread, in microseconds.

metric.name: ImplCompositorCommitPercentage
metric.summary: The percentage of the main frame time spent committing layer tree impl data in the compositor thread. An int in the range [0,100].

metric.name: IntersectionObservation
metric.summary: The time taken to compute intersection observer state for the main frame in microseconds during the sampled frame.

metric.name: IntersectionObservation.Average
metric.summary: The average time taken to compute IntersectionObserver observations in microseconds in the event period.

metric.name: IntersectionObservation.AverageRatio
metric.summary: The average over frames within the sample window of the ratio of time taken compute IntersectionObserver observations to the total time for the main frame. An int in the range [0,100].

metric.name: IntersectionObservation.WorstCase
metric.summary: The longest single time taken to compute IntersectionObserver observations in microseconds in the event period.

metric.name: IntersectionObservation.WorstCaseRatio
metric.summary: The highest proportion of a frame ever taken to compute IntersectionObserver observations within the sample window. An int in the range [0,100].

metric.name: IntersectionObservationPercentage
metric.summary: The percentage of the main frame time used in computing intersection observer state. An int in the range [0,100].

metric.name: Layout
metric.summary: The time taken for layout for the main frame in microseconds during the sampled frame.

metric.name: LayoutPercentage
metric.summary: The percentage of the main frame time used in layout work. An int in the range [0,100].

metric.name: MainFrame
metric.summary: The time between a BeginMainFrame and the commit of paint results for the sampled frame, in microseconds.

metric.name: MainFrame.Average
metric.summary: The average time between a BeginMainFrame and the commit of paint results, in microseconds.

metric.name: MainFrame.WorstCase
metric.summary: The longest single time between a BeginMainFrame and the commit of paint results, in microseconds.

metric.name: MainFrameIsBeforeFCP
metric.summary: True if the lifecycle update in this event occurred before FCP (First Contentful Paint) was registered.

metric.name: MainFrameReasons
metric.summary: A bitfield representation of the reasons for a main frame update. The fields are based on the FrameSequenceTrackerType enum, so bitwise and with the following values to determine if a reason was present: CompositorAnimation: 1, MainThreadAnimation: 2, PinchZoom: 4, RAF: 8, TouchScroll: 16, Universal: 32, Video: 64 and WheelScroll: 128.

metric.name: Paint
metric.summary: The time taken to paint for the main frame in microseconds during the sampled frame.

metric.name: Paint.Average
metric.summary: The average time taken by the paint phase in microseconds in the event period.

metric.name: Paint.AverageRatio
metric.summary: The average over frames within the sample window of the ratio of time taken in the paint phase to the total time for the main frame. An int in the range [0,100].

metric.name: Paint.WorstCase
metric.summary: The longest single time taken by the paint phase in microseconds in the event period.

metric.name: Paint.WorstCaseRatio
metric.summary: The highest proportion of a frame ever used by the paint phase within the sample window. An int in the range [0,100].

metric.name: PaintPercentage
metric.summary: The percentage of the main frame time used in paint. An int in the range [0,100].

metric.name: PrePaint
metric.summary: The time taken for pre-paint for the main frame in microseconds during the sampled frame.

metric.name: PrePaint.Average
metric.summary: The average time taken by the pre-paint phase in microseconds in the event period.

metric.name: PrePaint.AverageRatio
metric.summary: The average over frames within the sample window of the ratio of time taken in the pre-paint phase to the total time for the main frame. An int in the range [0,100].

metric.name: PrePaint.WorstCase
metric.summary: The longest single time taken by the pre-paint phase in microseconds in the event period.

metric.name: PrePaint.WorstCaseRatio
metric.summary: The highest proportion of a frame ever used by the pre-paint phase within the sample window. An int in the range [0,100].

metric.name: PrePaintPercentage
metric.summary: The percentage of the main frame time used in pre-paint. An int in the range [0,100].

metric.name: ProxyCommit
metric.summary: The time taken for the proxy to commit to the impl thread in microseconds during the sampled frame. TODO(crbug.com/1058065): Should be obsolete. Removed February 2020 in favor of separate metrics for the wait time and the actual commit time.

metric.name: ProxyCommitPercentage
metric.summary: The percentage of the main frame time used to commit to the impl thread. An int in the range [0,100]. TODO(crbug.com/1058065): Should be obsolete. Removed February 2020 in favor of separate metrics for the wait time and the actual commit time.

metric.name: ScrollingCoordinator
metric.summary: The time taken for scrolling coordinator for the main frame in microseconds during the sampled frame.

metric.name: ScrollingCoordinator.Average
metric.summary: The average time taken by the style and layout phases in microseconds in the event period.

metric.name: ScrollingCoordinator.AverageRatio
metric.summary: The average over frames within the event period of the ratio of time taken to update the scrolling coordinator after painting to the total time for the main frame, expressed as a percentage. An int in the range [0,100].

metric.name: ScrollingCoordinator.WorstCase
metric.summary: The longest single time within the event period that was used to update the ScrollingCoordinator after painting (in microseconds).

metric.name: ScrollingCoordinator.WorstCaseRatio
metric.summary: The highest proportion of a frame within the event period that was used to update the ScrollingCoordinator after painting, expressed as a percentage. An int in the range [0,100].

metric.name: ScrollingCoordinatorPercentage
metric.summary: The percentage of the main frame time used in scrolling coordinator. An int in the range [0,100].

metric.name: Style
metric.summary: The time taken for style update for the main frame in microseconds during the sampled frame.

metric.name: StyleAndLayout
metric.obsolete: Removed January 2020 in favor of separate Style and Layout metrics.
metric.summary: The time taken for style and layout for the main frame in microseconds during the sampled frame.

metric.name: StyleAndLayout.Average
metric.summary: The average time taken by the style and layout phases in microseconds in the event period.

metric.name: StyleAndLayout.AverageRatio
metric.summary: The average over frames within the sample window of the ratio of time taken to update style and layout to the total time for the main frame. An int in the range [0,100].

metric.name: StyleAndLayout.WorstCase
metric.summary: The longest single time taken by the style and layout phases in microseconds in the event period.

metric.name: StyleAndLayout.WorstCaseRatio
metric.summary: The highest proportion of a frame ever used to compute style and layout within the sample window. An int in the range [0,100].

metric.name: StyleAndLayoutPercentage
metric.obsolete: Removed January 2020 in favor of separate Style and Layout metrics.
metric.summary: The percentage of the main frame time used in style and layout work. An int in the range [0,100].

metric.name: StylePercentage
metric.summary: The percentage of the main frame time used in style work. An int in the range [0,100].

metric.name: UpdateLayers
metric.summary: The time taken for LayerTreeHost::UpdateLayers in microseconds during the sampled frame

metric.name: UpdateLayersPercentage
metric.summary: The percentage of the main frame time used by LayerTreeHost::UpdateLayers. An int in the range [0,100].

metric.name: WaitForCommit
metric.summary: The time spent waiting for the compositor thread to begin processing a commit, in microseconds.

metric.name: WaitForCommitPercentage
metric.summary: The percentage of the main frame time spent waiting for the compositor thread to begin processing a commit. An int in the range [0,100].

event.name: Blink.UseCounter
event.summary: Collects data for a subset of UseCounter features. When UMA UseCounter data shows a behaviour that is rare but too common to blindly change. This metric should be used to reason about whether a breaking change is acceptable or not.

metric.name: Feature
metric.summary: Opt-in UseCounter feature.

metric.name: IsMainFrameFeature
metric.summary: Emits True(1) or False(0) to indicate whether the Feature recorded is in the main frame or not.

event.name: BloatedRenderer
event.summary: Metrics related to a bloated renderer that is close to out-of-memory. They are recorded only if the renderer process has a single page.

metric.name: V8.Heap
metric.summary: The total physical size of V8's heap in MB.

metric.name: V8.Heap.AllocatedObjects
metric.summary: The total size of allocated on V8's heap in MB.

metric.name: V8.Heap.Limit
metric.summary: The V8 heap limit in MB.

metric.name: V8.NearV8HeapLimitHandling
metric.summary: An enum that specifies how the near V8 heap limit event was handled. See blink::NearV8HeapLimitHandling for the enum elements.

event.name: ClickInput
event.summary: Metrics associated with user click input. In particular, captures when user has a burst of clicks at the same location which may be a signal of user unhappiness for an experiment if it differs from the baseline data for the site.

metric.name: Experimental.ClickInputBurst
metric.summary: The count of the largest burst of click inputs for a page load. Only recorded if it meets a minimum threshold to be considered a burst.

event.name: Compositor.Rendering
event.summary: Metrics related to rendering in the compositor.

metric.name: CheckerboardedImagesCount
metric.summary: The number of images checker-imaged and re-rasterized on this page.

event.name: Compositor.UserInteraction
event.summary: Metrics related to user interaction handled by the compositor. This includes user gestures like scrolling, pinch-zoom and page-scale animations triggered in response to a double-tap event. The length of the user interaction is defined as the time the compositor is running an animation resulting from user input.

metric.name: CheckerboardedContentArea
metric.summary: The number of visible pixels per frame checkerboarded during this interaction.

metric.name: CheckerboardedContentAreaRatio
metric.summary: The percentage of visible pixels per frame checkerboarded during this interaction. This value should be between [0, 100].

metric.name: CheckerboardedImagesCount
metric.summary: The number of images checker-imaged and re-rasterized during this interaction.

metric.name: NumMissingTiles
metric.summary: The number of visible tiles per frame checkerboarded during this interaction.

event.name: ContactsPicker.ShareStatistics
event.summary: Measures statistics about the contacts shared in the contacts picker (when the Contacts Picker dialog is dismissed.)

metric.name: PropertiesRequested
metric.summary: Measures the contact properties requested by the website (names, emails, telephone numbers). Bit 1 - telephone numbers, bit 2 - emails, bit 3 - names.

metric.name: SelectCount
metric.summary: Measures the total number of contacts selected in the contacts picker.

metric.name: SelectPercentage
metric.summary: Measures the percentage of contacts selected in the contacts picker.

event.name: ContentIndex.Added
event.summary: Collected when a new Content Index entry is registered.

metric.name: Category
metric.summary: The type of the content registered. Corresponds to blink.mojom.ContentCategory.

event.name: ContentIndex.DeletedByUser
event.summary: Collected when a Content Index entry is deleted by the user from the Downloads page.

metric.name: Deleted
metric.summary: Always true.

event.name: ContentIndex.Opened
event.summary: Collected when a Content Index entry is opened from the Downloads page.

metric.name: IsOffline
metric.summary: Whether the browser was offline when the content was opened.

metric.name: Action
metric.summary: Emits an integer id for a selection corresponding to the action enum defined in ChromeContextMenuPopulator.java (within the ContextMenuUma class).

metric.name: SearchByImage
metric.summary: Recorded when the context menu is constructed and logged if the search by image option was displayed.

metric.name: SearchWithGoogleLens
metric.summary: Recorded when the context menu is constructed and logged if the lens option was displayed.

event.name: ContextualSearch
event.summary: Metrics related to a Contextual Search Tap event on a page, for use with Ranker. These metrics are recorded each time the user triggers the Contextual Search UI via a tap gesture (when enabled).

metric.name: DidOptIn
metric.summary: Emits a 1 or 0 to indicate whether the user has Opted-in to the privacy conditions for Contextual Search or not.

metric.name: DurationAfterScrollMs
metric.summary: Duration in MS between showing the UI and a subsequent scroll event, or not recorded if there was no subsequent scroll.

metric.name: EntityImpressionsCount
metric.summary: Emits an integer in the range of 0 - N that represents the number of impressions of an Entity that were shown in the Bar, aggregated in Android device storage for this user, starting in M-69.

metric.name: EntityOpensCount
metric.summary: Emits an integer in the range of 0 - N that represents the number of times an Entity was shown in the Bar and the panel was opened, aggregated in Android device storage for this user, starting in M-69.

metric.name: FontSize
metric.summary: Emits a value from 0-10 representing the effective font size on the screen. A value of 0 means the font size cannot be obtained. A value of 1 represents a very small font and a value of 10 represents a large font.

metric.name: IsEntity
metric.summary: Emits a 1 or 0 to indicate whether the word tapped appears to be part of an entity, given simple English language rules that check capitalization and punctuation.

metric.name: IsEntityEligible
metric.summary: Emits a 1 or 0 to indicate whether the IsEntity boolean ever had a chance of being true or not. When we're dealing with languages other than ones where our simple entity-detection can work this signal is false.

metric.name: IsHttp
metric.summary: Emits a 1 or 0 to indicate whether the base page is HTTP (insecure).

metric.name: IsLanguageMismatch
metric.summary: Emits a 1 or 0 to indicate whether the language of the base page is a mismatch from the list of languages the user knows, so they might want translation.

metric.name: IsLongWord
metric.summary: Emits a 1 or 0 to indicate whether the word tapped was considered long (at least 10 chars in length).

metric.name: IsSecondTapOverride
metric.summary: Emits a 1 or 0 to indicate whether the tap was an override of normal tap suppression because it was considered a second tap on a word after the first tap was suppressed.

metric.name: IsShortWord
metric.summary: Emits a 1 or 0 to indicate whether the word tapped was considered short (less than 4 characters in length).

metric.name: IsWordEdge
metric.summary: Emits a 1 or 0 to indicate whether the tap gesture was on the edge of a word, rather than in the middle 50% of the word.

metric.name: OpenCount
metric.summary: Emits an integer in the range of 0 - N that represents the total number of times the user opened the panel, aggregated in Android device storage for this user since M-69.

metric.name: OutcomeRankerDidPredict
metric.summary: Emits a 1 or 0 to indicate whether Ranker was able to make a prediction.

metric.name: OutcomeRankerPrediction
metric.summary: Emits a 1 or 0 to indicate what Ranker's prediction was for this record. Recorded only when OutcomeRankerDidPredict is true.

metric.name: OutcomeRankerPredictionScore
metric.summary: Emits a single-precision float to indicate the score for the Ranker prediction for this record. Recorded only when OutcomeRankerDidPredict is true.

metric.name: OutcomeWasCardsDataShown
metric.summary: Emits a 1 or 0 to indicate whether any Contextual Cards data was shown in the Contextual Search Bar.

metric.name: OutcomeWasPanelOpened
metric.summary: Emits a 1 or 0 to indicate whether the user opened the overlay panel. This is the primary outcome metric.

metric.name: OutcomeWasQuickActionClicked
metric.summary: Emits a 1 or 0 to indicate whether the user clicked within the overlay panel when a Quick-Action was shown. This is a secondary outcome metric.

metric.name: OutcomeWasQuickAnswerSeen
metric.summary: Emits a 1 or 0 to indicate whether the user could see a Quick-Answer caption within the overlay panel. This is a tertiary outcome metric.

metric.name: PortionOfElement
metric.summary: Emits an integer in the range 0-10 inclusive that expresses the portion of the enclosing element that is the word tapped. A zero will be emitted if the ratio cannot be calculated. A value of 10 means the word spans the entire element, and a value of 1 means the word is 10% or less than the entire element.

metric.name: Previous28DayCtrPercent
metric.summary: The CTR of the overlay panel for this user, aggregated in Android device storage over a previous 28 day period, expressed as an integer between 0-99, since M-60.

metric.name: Previous28DayImpressionsCount
metric.summary: The count of views of the overlay panel for this user, aggregated in Android device storage over a previous 28 day period, since M-60.

metric.name: PreviousWeekCtrPercent
metric.summary: The CTR of the overlay panel for this user, aggregated in Android device storage over the previous week, expressed as an integer between 0-99, since M-60.

metric.name: PreviousWeekImpressionsCount
metric.summary: The count of views of the overlay panel for this user, aggregated in Android device storage over the previous week, since M-60.

metric.name: QuickActionImpressionsCount
metric.summary: Emits an integer in the range of 0 - N that represents the total number of times the user saw a quick action in the caption of the Bar, e.g. a phone number to dial. Aggregated in Android device storage since M-69 for this user.

metric.name: QuickActionsIgnored
metric.summary: Emits an integer in the range of 0 - N that represents the total number of times the user ignored a quick action but opened the Bar instead, e.g. a phone number was available but not dialed. Aggregated in Android device storage starting at M-69.

metric.name: QuickActionsTaken
metric.summary: Emits an integer in the range of 0 - N that represents the total number of times the user activated a quick action by tapping on a quick action shown in the Bar, e.g. dialed a phone number. Aggregated in Android device storage since M-69 for this user.

metric.name: QuickAnswerCount
metric.summary: Emits an integer in the range of 0 - N that represents the total number of times the user saw a quick answer in the caption of the Bar. Typically these quick answers represent an automatic translation of the selection. Aggregated in Android device storage for all time for this user, since M-57.

metric.name: ScreenTopDps
metric.summary: The location of the tap relative to the top of the screen, expressed in DPs.

metric.name: TapCount
metric.summary: Emits an integer in the range of 0 - N that represents the total number of taps that triggered the Bar, aggregated in Android device storage for this user, since M-43.

metric.name: TapDurationMs
metric.summary: The duration of the tap gesture expressed as an integer in milliseconds.

metric.name: WasScreenBottom
metric.summary: The location of the tap relative to the bottom of the screen, expressed as an integer with 0 meaning not at the bottom and 1 meaning at the bottom.

event.name: ContextualSuggestions
event.obsolete: This feature was deprecated in M74
event.summary: Metrics related to Contextual Suggestions shown in the Chrome Assistive Surface, aka EoC shown in CAS. These metrics are recorded each time the Contextual Suggestions UI is dismissed. Each record always contains a value for every metric known at the time of the implementation.

metric.name: AnyDownloaded
metric.summary: Emits an integer in the range 0-1 to indicate whether the user downloaded any suggestions.

metric.name: AnySuggestionTaken
metric.summary: Emits an integer in the range 0-1 to indicate whether any suggestion link was taken.

metric.name: ClosedFromPeek
metric.summary: Emits an integer in the range 0-1 to indicate whether the peeking sheet was closed by tapping on the close button.

metric.name: EverOpened
metric.summary: Emits an integer in the range 0-1 to indicate whether the sheet was ever opened.

metric.name: FetchState
metric.summary: Emits an integer in the range 0-7 to indicate the ending state of the data fetcher and results returned. A value of 0 indicates not-started, a 7 indicates fetch-completed with suggestions. See the code for details.

metric.name: ShowDurationBucketMin
metric.summary: Emits an integer in the range 0-N to indicate the duration that the sheet was shown before a positive or negative action was taken. A value of 0 indicates that the UI was never shown. A value greater than 0 indicates that some user interaction occurred taking at least the indicated number of milliseconds, but less than twice that amount. This exponential bucketing is done for privacy reasons, and uses the UKM GetExponentialBucketMin method with a value of 2.0 for spacing.

metric.name: TriggerEvent
metric.summary: Emits an integer in the range 0-2 to indicate whether the contextual suggestions UI was ever triggered and how it was triggered. A value of 0 indicates never-shown, a 1 indicates peeked in response to a reverse-scroll (deprecated), and 2 indicates that the toolbar button was shown (the only trigger currently supported).

event.name: CPUUsageMeasurement
event.summary: A CPU usage measurement that corresponds to a tick in a CPU usage time-series. There is also some metadata stored to determine how faithful the CPU usage measurement is (e.g. NumberOfCoresidentTabs).

metric.name: CPUUsage
metric.summary: CPU usage measurement. This is in units of clock-cycles. For example, 1.2 seconds of 100% CPU usage on a 2.5GHz CPU corresponds to a value of 1.2 x 1.0 x 2.5e9 = 3e6.

metric.name: EventType
metric.summary: The event associated with the measurement. This is an integer value corresponding to the enum defined in resource_coordinator::RenderProcessProbe.

metric.name: IsVisible
metric.summary: Indicates if any frame hosted in this tab is visible at the moment the measurement is taken.

metric.name: NumberOfCoresidentTabs
metric.summary: Number of co-resident tabs in all of the render processes a tab is associated with when the CPU usage measurement is taken.

metric.name: ObservationWindowSizeMs
metric.summary: The size of the observation window (time since last CPU measurement) in milliseconds.

metric.name: ProcessUptimeMs
metric.summary: The uptime of the process being measured, in milliseconds.

event.name: DataReductionProxy
event.summary: Data Reduction Proxy related metrics associated with a page load. See //components/data_reduction_proxy/.

metric.name: DataSaverPageUUID
metric.summary: A unique identifier of this page load to the proxy server. Recorded for each navigation that uses the proxy.

metric.name: EstimatedOriginalNetworkBytes
metric.summary: The estimated number of bytes that would have been used if that proxy was disabled on this page load. Recorded for each navigation that uses the proxy.

event.name: DetachedWindows.Experimental
event.summary: Metrics related to detached windows.

metric.name: NavigationSourceId
metric.summary: Contains the UKM source id of the navigation as an integer.

metric.name: NumberOfCallsInDetachedWindowByClosing
metric.summary: The number of function calls in a window detached by closing/removal.

metric.name: NumberOfCallsInDetachedWindowByClosing_After10sSinceDetaching
metric.summary: The number of function calls in a window detached by closing/removal, that happened at least 10 seconds after detaching.

metric.name: NumberOfCallsInDetachedWindowByClosing_After1minSinceDetaching
metric.summary: The number of function calls in a window detached by closing/removal, that happened at least 1 minute after detaching.

metric.name: NumberOfCallsInDetachedWindowByNavigation
metric.summary: The number of function calls in a window detached by navigating away.

metric.name: NumberOfCallsInDetachedWindowByNavigation_After10sSinceDetaching
metric.summary: The number of function calls in a window detached by navigating away, that happened at least 10 seconds after detaching.

metric.name: NumberOfCallsInDetachedWindowByNavigation_After1minSinceDetaching
metric.summary: The number of function calls in a window detached by navigating away, that happened at least 1 minute after detaching.

metric.name: NumberOfCallsInDetachedWindowByOtherReason
metric.summary: The number of function calls in a window detached by another reason.

metric.name: NumberOfCallsInDetachedWindowByOtherReason_After10sSinceDetaching
metric.summary: The number of function calls in a window detached by another reason, that happened at least 10 seconds after detaching.

metric.name: NumberOfCallsInDetachedWindowByOtherReason_After1minSinceDetaching
metric.summary: The number of function calls in a window detached by another reason, that happened at least 1 minute after detaching.

event.name: Document.OutliveTimeAfterShutdown
event.summary: Recorded when a Document object survives certain number of garbage collections after detached. It is expected that regular Document objects are destroyed soon after detached, and if a document outlives longer, probably this can be leaked.

metric.name: GCCount
metric.summary: Measures the numbers of garbarge collection after the document is detached. This is recorded when the number reached certain numbers like 5 or 10.

event.name: DocumentCreated
event.summary: Recorded when a Document object is created and records the source ID of the navigation and whether the document was in the main frame. This can be used to link subframe UKM events to the parent document.

metric.name: IsCrossOriginFrame
metric.summary: Whether the document was in a cross origin iframe. This can either be 0 or 1.

metric.name: IsMainFrame
metric.summary: Whether the document was in the main frame. This is can either be 0 or 1.

metric.name: NavigationSourceId
metric.summary: Contains the UKM source id of the navigation as an integer.

event.name: Download.Completed
event.summary: Metrics taken when a download completes. Its parent event is Download.Started.

metric.name: BytesWasted
metric.summary: The number of bytes that have been used in an excess (ie. download restarting the middle of a download).

metric.name: DownloadId
metric.summary: The id of the download that is used to associate separate events.

metric.name: ResultingFileSize
metric.summary: The size of the file that is downloaded, expressed in kilobytes with exponentially growing buckets.

metric.name: TimeSinceStart
metric.summary: The difference in the time between when the download finished and when it began, expressed in miliseconds.

event.name: Download.Interrupted
