event.summary: Metrics taken when a download is interrupted. Its parent event is Download.Started.

metric.name: BytesWasted
metric.summary: The number of bytes that have been used in an excess (ie. download restarting the middle of a download).

metric.name: ChangeInFileSize
metric.summary: The difference in the size of the file that is downloaded compared to the initial reported size, expressed in kilobytes with exponentially growing buckets.

metric.name: DownloadId
metric.summary: The id of the download that is used to associate separate events.

metric.name: Reason
metric.summary: The reason the download was interrupted, expressed as an enum defined in DownloadInterruptReason.

metric.name: ResultingFileSize
metric.summary: The size of the file that is downloaded, expressed in kilobytes with exponentially growing buckets.

metric.name: TimeSinceStart
metric.summary: The difference in the time between when the download interrupted and when it began, expressed in miliseconds.

event.name: Download.Resumed
event.summary: Metrics taken when a download is resumed. Its parent event is Download.Started.

metric.name: DownloadId
metric.summary: The id of the download that is used to associate separate events.

metric.name: Mode
metric.summary: The mode by which the download was resumed, expressed as an enum defined in ResumeMode.

metric.name: TimeSinceStart
metric.summary: The difference in the time between when the download resumed and when it began, expressed in miliseconds.

event.name: Download.Started
event.summary: Metrics taken when a download begins. It has one Download.Ended and none to multiple Download.Interrupted/Download.Resumed events associated with it.

metric.name: DownloadConnectionSecurity
metric.summary: The state of the security of the final download URL and all the redirects leading to it. Expressed as an enum defined in DownloadConnectionSecurity.

metric.name: DownloadId
metric.summary: The id of the download that is used to associate separate events.

metric.name: DownloadSource
metric.summary: The source of the download, expressed as an enum defined in DownloadEntry.

metric.name: FileType
metric.summary: The type of file that is downloaded, expressed as an enum defined in DownloadContentType.

metric.name: IsSameHostDownload
metric.summary: A boolean denoting if the final download URL is the same host as the initiating frame (i.e., whether the initiating site likely controls the download itself).

event.name: Event.ScrollBegin.Touch
event.summary: Metrics related to first scroll action caused by the generated ScrollUpdate gesture event.

metric.name: IsMainThread
metric.summary: Whether the event is handled on the main thread or not.

metric.name: TimeToHandled
metric.summary: The time in microseconds between initial creation of a touch event and the first generated ScrollUpdate gesture event in a given scroll gesture event sequence is handled on main/impl thread. If no swap was induced by the ScrollUpdate gesture event, no recording is made.

metric.name: TimeToScrollUpdateSwapBegin
metric.summary: The time in microseconds between initial creation of a touch event and the start of the frame swap on the GPU service caused by the generated ScrollUpdate gesture event if that ScrollUpdate is the first such event in a given scroll gesture event sequence. If no swap was induced by the event, no recording is made.

event.name: Event.ScrollBegin.Wheel
event.summary: Metrics related to first scroll action caused by the generated ScrollUpdate gesture event.

metric.name: IsMainThread
metric.summary: Whether the event is handled on the main thread or not.

metric.name: TimeToHandled
metric.summary: The time in microseconds between initial creation of a wheel event and the first generated ScrollUpdate gesture event in a given scroll gesture event sequence is handled on main/impl thread. If no swap was induced by the ScrollBegin gesture event, no recording is made.

metric.name: TimeToScrollUpdateSwapBegin
metric.summary: The time in microseconds between the initial creation of a wheel event and the start of the frame swap on the GPU service caused by the generated ScrollUpdate gesture event if that ScrollUpdate is the first such event in a given scroll gesture event sequence. If no swap was induced by the event, no recording is made.

event.name: Event.ScrollUpdate.Touch
event.summary: Metrics related to a scroll action caused by the generated ScrollUpdate gesture event.

metric.name: IsMainThread
metric.summary: Whether the event is handled on the main thread or not.

metric.name: TimeToHandled
metric.summary: The time in microseconds between initial creation of a touch event and the generated ScrollUpdate gesture event is handled on main/impl thread. If no swap was induced by the ScrollUpdate gesture event, no recording is made.

metric.name: TimeToScrollUpdateSwapBegin
metric.summary: The time in microseconds between the initial creation of a touch event and the start of the frame swap on the GPU service. If no swap was induced by the event, no recording is made. The first GSU of every scrolling sequence is excluded from this metric.

event.name: Event.ScrollUpdate.Wheel
event.summary: Metrics related to a scroll action caused by the generated ScrollUpdate gesture event.

metric.name: IsMainThread
metric.summary: Whether the event is handled on the main thread or not.

metric.name: TimeToHandled
metric.summary: The time in microseconds between initial creation of a wheel event and the generated ScrollUpdate gesture event is handled on main/impl thread. If no swap was induced by the ScrollUpdate gesture event, no recording is made. The first GSU of every scrolling sequence is excluded from this metric.

metric.name: TimeToScrollUpdateSwapBegin
metric.summary: The time in microseconds between the initial creation of a wheel event and the start of the frame swap on the GPU service. If no swap was induced by the event, no recording is made. The first GSU of every scrolling sequence is excluded from this metric.

event.name: Extensions.CrossOriginFetchFromContentScript3
event.summary:
This UKM event is logged when an extension which triggers a cross-origin CORS-mode request from a content script if such a request results would be allowed by CORB, but potentially blocked by CORS. The source-id URL associated with the UKM event identifies the extension initiating such request.
Note that this data is only gathered if the CorbAllowlistAlsoAppliesToOorCors feature is disabled. Also note that this data is not gathered for extensions that are already on the allowlist.

metric.name: EventHappened
metric.summary: Always true - introduced to have non-zero number of metrics which should make it easier to work with queries / dashboards for the overall CrossOriginFetchFromContentScript3 event.

event.name: FontMatchAttempts
event.summary: Records font family match attempts, broken down by system fonts and web fonts. Multiple match attempts using the same font family name are de-duplicated. Matching of @font-face src:local fonts isn't currently supported.

metric.name: LoadContext
metric.summary: If the font family name was matched in the top-level frame or a sub-frame.

metric.name: LocalFontFailures
metric.summary: The count of failed attempts to match @font-face src:local rules.

metric.name: LocalFontSuccesses
metric.summary: The count of successful attempts to match @font-face src:local rules.

metric.name: SystemFontFamilyFailures
metric.summary: The count of system font family match attempts that failed.

metric.name: SystemFontFamilySuccesses
metric.summary: The count of system font family match attempts that succeeded.

metric.name: WebFontFamilyFailures
metric.summary: The count of web font family match attempts that failed.

metric.name: WebFontFamilySuccesses
metric.summary: The count of web font family match attempts that succeeded.

event.name: GeneratedNavigation
event.summary: Logged when the user navigated to their home page or their default search engine. Recorded if the first URL or the final URL matches the pattern for Default Search or matches the user's home page URL. Recorded upon commit (even if the page was not foreground).

metric.name: FinalURLIsDefaultSearchEngine
metric.summary: If the navigation committed URL matches the template URL of the user's Default Search Engine.

metric.name: FinalURLIsHomePage
metric.summary: If the navigation committed URL matches the user's home page URL. Not recorded on Android because home page is managed outside of Chrome.

metric.name: FirstURLIsDefaultSearchEngine
metric.summary: If the navigation starting URL matches the template URL of the user's Default Search Engine.

metric.name: FirstURLIsHomePage
metric.summary: If the navigation starting URL (first URL in the redirect chain) matches the user's home page URL. Not recorded on Android because home page is managed outside of Chrome.

event.name: GoogleDocsOfflineExtension
event.summary: Logged when a website requests a shared resource from Google Docs Offline Extension. Note that this is double counted for imports since it is done once in preload and once in actual load.

metric.name: ResourceRequested
metric.summary: Marks a resource request from a website.

event.name: Graphics.Smoothness.Latency
event.summary: Tracks the duration of stages in the rendering pipeline while processing a single frame. All times are in microseconds.

metric.name: Activation
metric.summary: The duration of the activation stage.

metric.name: BeginImplFrameToSendBeginMainFrame
metric.summary: The time from when the Impl frame is started to when BeginMainFrame is sent.

metric.name: Commit
metric.summary: The duration of the commit stage."

metric.name: CompositorAnimation
metric.summary: True when a compositor-driven animation was active this frame.

metric.name: EndActivateToSubmitCompositorFrame
metric.summary: The time from when an activation is complete to the next SubmitCompositorFrame.

metric.name: EndCommitToActivation
metric.summary: The time from when a commit is complete to the beginning of the next activation.

metric.name: MainThreadAnimation
metric.summary: True when a main-thread-driven animation was active this frame.

metric.name: MissedFrame
metric.summary: True when the main frame missed its deadline for this frame.

metric.name: PinchZoom
metric.summary: True when a pinch-to-zoom interaction was active this frame.

metric.name: RAF
metric.summary: True when a rAF-driven animation was active this frame.

metric.name: SendBeginMainFrameToCommit
metric.summary: The time from when the BeginMainFrame is sent to the beginning of the commit.

metric.name: SubmitCompositorFrameToPresentationCompositorFrame
metric.summary: The time from when the a compositor frame is submitted to the display compositor to when it is presented.

metric.name: SubmitCompositorFrameToPresentationCompositorFrame.ReceivedCompositorFrameToStartDraw
metric.summary: The time from when a compositor frame is received to when it starts to draw.

metric.name: SubmitCompositorFrameToPresentationCompositorFrame.StartDrawToSwapEnd
metric.summary: The time from when the a compositor frame is started to draw to when it ends swap.

metric.name: SubmitCompositorFrameToPresentationCompositorFrame.StartDrawToSwapStart
metric.summary: The time from when a compositor frame is started to draw to when it starts swap.

metric.name: SubmitCompositorFrameToPresentationCompositorFrame.SubmitToReceiveCompositorFrame
metric.summary: The time from when the a compositor frame is submitted to when it is received.

metric.name: SubmitCompositorFrameToPresentationCompositorFrame.SwapEndToPresentationCompositorFrame
metric.summary: The time from when the a compositor frame ends swap to when it is presented.

metric.name: SubmitCompositorFrameToPresentationCompositorFrame.SwapStartToSwapEnd
metric.summary: The time from when a compositor frame starts swap to when it ends swap.

metric.name: TotalLatency
metric.summary: The total time starting from BeginImplFrame to when CompositorFramePresentation is done with updates from the MainThread (i.e. the time it takes for BeginImplFrame, BeginMainFrame, Commit, Activate, SubmitCompositorFrame and PresentCompositorFrame).

metric.name: TouchScroll
metric.summary: True when a touchscreen driven interaction was active this frame.

metric.name: Unknown
metric.summary: The time within a stage not attributed to any system.

metric.name: Video
metric.summary: True when video playback was active this frame.

metric.name: WheelScroll
metric.summary: True when a mouse driven scroll was active this frame.

event.name: Graphics.Smoothness.PercentDroppedFrames
event.summary: Tracks the percent of dropped frames for a particular sequence of frames such as during scroll or animation. PercentDroppedFrames is measured by tracking the number of frames the sequence was expected to produce, and the number of frames that were not displayed on screen (dropped). It is the ratio of dropped over expected, converted to a percentage.

metric.name: AllAnimations
metric.summary: Tracks the throughput of a particular sequence of frames for all animations. This metric is reported for all animations (e.g. comositor-driven animations, main-thread driven animations, and raf-driven animations).

metric.name: AllInteractions
metric.summary: Tracks the throughput of a particular sequence of frames where a user-input (e.g. scroll, pinch) is active. This metric is reported for all sources of user-input (i.e. both touchscreen and touchpad/mouse-wheel).

metric.name: AllSequences
metric.summary: Tracks the throughput of a particular sequence of frames. This metric is reported for all animations and all interactions.

metric.name: CompositorThread.CompositorAnimation
metric.summary: The throughput of the compositor thread during a compositor animation.

metric.name: CompositorThread.MainThreadAnimation
metric.summary: The throughput of the compositor thread during a main thread animation.

metric.name: CompositorThread.PinchZoom
metric.summary: The throughput of the compositor thread during pinch-zoom interactions.

metric.name: CompositorThread.RAF
metric.summary: The throughput of the compositor thread during rAF callback driven animation.

metric.name: CompositorThread.TouchScroll
metric.summary: The throughput of the compositor thread during touchscroll driven interactions.

metric.name: CompositorThread.Universal
metric.summary: The throughput of the compositor thread for all frame production.

metric.name: CompositorThread.Video
metric.summary: The throughput of the compositor thread during video play.

metric.name: CompositorThread.WheelScroll
metric.summary: The throughput of the compositor thread during mousewheel scroll driven interactions.

metric.name: MainThread.CompositorAnimation
metric.summary: The throughput of the main thread during a compositor animation.

metric.name: MainThread.MainThreadAnimation
metric.summary: The throughput of the main thread during a main thread animation.

metric.name: MainThread.PinchZoom
metric.summary: The throughput of the main thread during pinch-zoom interactions.

metric.name: MainThread.RAF
metric.summary: The throughput of the main thread during rAF callback driven animation.

metric.name: MainThread.TouchScroll
metric.summary: The throughput of the main thread during touchscroll driven interactions.

metric.name: MainThread.Universal
metric.summary: The throughput of the main thread for all frame production.

metric.name: MainThread.Video
metric.summary: The throughput of the main thread during video play.

metric.name: MainThread.WheelScroll
metric.summary: The throughput of the main thread during mousewheel scroll driven interactions.

metric.name: SlowerThread.CompositorAnimation
metric.summary: The worse throughput of the main and the compositor thread during a compositor animation.

metric.name: SlowerThread.MainThreadAnimation
metric.summary: The worse throughput of the main and the compositor thread during a main thread animation.

metric.name: SlowerThread.PinchZoom
metric.summary: The worse throughput of the main and the compositor thread during pinch-zoom interactions.

metric.name: SlowerThread.RAF
metric.summary: The worse throughput of the main and the compositor thread during rAF callback driven animation.

metric.name: SlowerThread.TouchScroll
metric.summary: The worse throughput of the main and the compositor thread during touchscroll driven interactions.

metric.name: SlowerThread.Universal
metric.summary: The worse throughput of the main and the compositor thread for all frame production.

metric.name: SlowerThread.Video
metric.summary: The worse throughput of the main and the compositor thread during video play.

metric.name: SlowerThread.WheelScroll
metric.summary: The worse throughput of the main and the compositor thread during mousewheel scroll driven interactions.

event.name: Graphics.Smoothness.Throughput
event.summary: As of 2020-02-12, this is deprecated in favor of Graphics.Smoothness.PercentDroppedFrames.

metric.name: CompositorThread.CompositorAnimation
metric.summary: The throughput of the compositor thread during a compositor animation.

metric.name: CompositorThread.MainThreadAnimation
metric.summary: The throughput of the compositor thread during a main thread animation.

metric.name: CompositorThread.PinchZoom
metric.summary: The throughput of the compositor thread during pinch-zoom interactions.

metric.name: CompositorThread.RAF
metric.summary: The throughput of the compositor thread during rAF callback driven animation.

metric.name: CompositorThread.TouchScroll
metric.summary: The throughput of the compositor thread during touchscroll driven interactions.

metric.name: CompositorThread.Universal
metric.summary: The throughput of the compositor thread for all frame production.

metric.name: CompositorThread.Video
metric.summary: The throughput of the compositor thread during video play.

metric.name: CompositorThread.WheelScroll
metric.summary: The throughput of the compositor thread during mousewheel scroll driven interactions.

metric.name: MainThread.CompositorAnimation
metric.summary: The throughput of the main thread during a compositor animation.

metric.name: MainThread.MainThreadAnimation
metric.summary: The throughput of the main thread during a main thread animation.

metric.name: MainThread.PinchZoom
metric.summary: The throughput of the main thread during pinch-zoom interactions.

metric.name: MainThread.RAF
metric.summary: The throughput of the main thread during rAF callback driven animation.

metric.name: MainThread.TouchScroll
metric.summary: The throughput of the main thread during touchscroll driven interactions.

metric.name: MainThread.Universal
metric.summary: The throughput of the main thread for all frame production.

metric.name: MainThread.Video
metric.summary: The throughput of the main thread during video play.

metric.name: MainThread.WheelScroll
metric.summary: The throughput of the main thread during mousewheel scroll driven interactions.

metric.name: SlowerThread.CompositorAnimation
metric.summary: The worse throughput of the main and the compositor thread during a compositor animation.

metric.name: SlowerThread.MainThreadAnimation
metric.summary: The worse throughput of the main and the compositor thread during a main thread animation.

metric.name: SlowerThread.PinchZoom
metric.summary: The worse throughput of the main and the compositor thread during pinch-zoom interactions.

metric.name: SlowerThread.RAF
metric.summary: The worse throughput of the main and the compositor thread during rAF callback driven animation.

metric.name: SlowerThread.TouchScroll
metric.summary: The worse throughput of the main and the compositor thread during touchscroll driven interactions.

metric.name: SlowerThread.Universal
metric.summary: The worse throughput of the main and the compositor thread for all frame production.

metric.name: SlowerThread.Video
metric.summary: The worse throughput of the main and the compositor thread during video play.

metric.name: SlowerThread.WheelScroll
metric.summary: The worse throughput of the main and the compositor thread during mousewheel scroll driven interactions.

event.name: HistoryManipulationIntervention
event.summary: Logged when an entry in the back-forward list is marked to be skipped on subsequent back/forward button clicks as part of the history manipulation intervention. This is logged when the entry is navigated away from.

event.name: HistoryNavigation
event.summary: Metrics recorded each time we commit a history navigation, which are needed to estimate benefits of back-forward cache. Except as otherwise noted, the metrics are recorded for history navigations, but not for same-document navigations.

metric.name: BackForwardCache.IsServedFromBackForwardCache
metric.summary: Boolean whether the page was restored from the back-forward cache or not.

metric.name: BackForwardCache.NotRestoredReasons
metric.summary: Bitmask of the reasons why the page was not restored from the back-forward cache. See contents::BackForwardCacheMetrics::NotRestoredReason for the meaning of the individual bits.

metric.name: CrossOriginSubframesFeatures
metric.summary: Bitmask of features used by the cross origin subframes of the previous page load. See blink::SchedulingPolicy::Feature for the meaning for the individual features.

metric.name: LastCommittedCrossDocumentNavigationSourceIdForTheSameDocument
metric.summary: For history navigations and reloads, the source id of the previous navigation which loaded the page we're trying to navigate back to.

metric.name: LastCommittedSourceIdForTheSameDocument
metric.summary: Deprecated as of 01/2019.

metric.name: MainFrameFeatures
metric.summary: Bitmask of features used by the main frames of the previous page load. See blink::SchedulingPolicy::Feature for the meaning for the individual features.

metric.name: NavigatedToTheMostRecentEntryForDocument
metric.summary:
Boolean for whether we navigated to the same navigation entry as the one which was last visible.
It can be false when subframes or same-document navigations are present. For example, after navigating from http://foo to http://foo#bar and then http://bar and then going back by 2 entries will mean we went to http://foo while the last committed entry from this document was http://foo#bar.
It's expected to be rare, but might be problematic for back-forward cache.

metric.name: SameOriginSubframesFeatures
metric.summary: Bitmask of features used by the same origin subframes of the previous page load. See blink::SchedulingPolicy::Feature for the meaning for the individual features.

metric.name: TimeSinceNavigatedAwayFromDocument
metric.summary:
Time in milliseconds from the moment the current navigation stopped being active to the start of the current navigation.
This is clamped to hours for values greater than 3 hours, to minutes for values greater than 3 minutes, to seconds for values greater than 5 seconds.

event.name: Identifiability
event.summary:
Identifiability metrics are used to measure the diversity of web clients as observed by individual web sites.
Browser or device fingerprinting uses differences in behaviors of web APIs as identifiers. The values collected under this event indicate the level of identifiability of these differences.
Metrics recorded under this event are keyed based on parameters determined at runtime. Hence the metrics described in this file are not exhaustive.
See //third_party/blink/public/common/privacy_budget/identifiability/identifiability_metric_builder.h for details on how the metrics hash is determined.

metric.name: StudyGeneration.626
metric.summary:
An integer identifying the study "generation." In case the study parameters need to be tweaked to the point where results cannot be aggregated across study parameter sets, this value can be changed to partition the results.
The name suffix (.626) was chosen so that the resulting metric hash as determined by base::DigestForMetrics() has all 8 LSBs set to 0. Such a metric hash does not collide with any other metric hash generated by blink::IdentifiabilityMetricBuilder().

event.name: InputEvent
event.summary: Metrics associated with user input events. This event is recorded in Blink and may not be recorded for the same page visits as events like PageLoad. Consumers of this event's metrics should be aware of this when making comparisons between InputEvent metrics and PageLoad metrics.

metric.name: InteractiveTiming.InputDelay
metric.summary: Measures Input Delay, the duration between the hardware timestamp and the start of event processing on the main thread for the meaningful input. In ms. (go/FirstInputDelay)

event.name: Intervention.DocumentWrite.ScriptBlock
event.summary: Recorded for page loads where the document.write script block intervention could apply.

metric.name: Disabled.Reload
metric.summary: Records '1' if the document.write script block intervention could have applied, but was disabled due to the page being reloaded.

metric.name: ParseTiming.ParseBlockedOnScriptExecutionFromDocumentWrite
metric.summary: Measures the time in milliseconds that the HTML parser spent blocked on the execution of scripts inserted from document.write, for main frame documents that finished parsing.

metric.name: ParseTiming.ParseBlockedOnScriptLoadFromDocumentWrite
metric.summary: Measures the time in milliseconds that the HTML parser spent blocked on the load of scripts inserted from document.write, for main frame documents that finished parsing.

event.name: IOS.FindInPageSearchMatches
event.summary: Logged when the FindInPage returns a user search request result.

metric.name: HasMatches
metric.summary: True if there were matches.

event.name: IOS.PageZoomChanged
event.summary: Logged when the user changes their zoom level on iOS.

metric.name: ContentSizeCategory
metric.summary: The content size category the user is currently using.

metric.name: OverallZoomLevel
metric.summary: The overall zoom level. This is based on a combination of the user zoom level and a multiplier from the user's content size category.

metric.name: UserZoomLevel
metric.summary: The current zoom multiplier (percentage-based, with 100 -> 100%) the user has chosen.

event.name: IOS.RendererGone
event.summary: Logged when WKWebView process is reported gone. Metrics will give information of the context in which some website present sad tabs. It will help debug some renderer issues either in Chrome or in WebKit.

metric.name: AliveRecentlyRendererCount
metric.summary: The number of WKWebView alive in the last 2 seconds.

metric.name: AliveRendererCount
metric.summary: The number of WKWebView alive at the moment this renderer is gone.

metric.name: InForeground
metric.summary: Whether the app/tab was in foregound or background. 0: tab in foreground, app in foreground, 1: tab in background, app in foreground, 2: tab in foreground, app in background, 3: tab in background, app in background.

metric.name: SawMemoryWarning
metric.summary: Whether a memory warning was received less than 5 seconds before the renderer process is gone.

event.name: IOS.URLMismatchInLegacyAndSlimNavigationManager
event.summary: Logged when LegacyNavigationManager and KWKBasedNavigationManager have different last committed URLs. This means that either old or new navigation system has a URL spoofing bug.

metric.name: HasMismatch
metric.summary: True if there was a mismatch.

event.name: Layout.DisplayCutout.StateChanged
event.summary: Recorded every time the ViewportFit that is supplied by a frame changes or the fullscreen state of a frame or its parent WebContents changes.

metric.name: IsMainFrame
metric.summary: Records '1' if the frame that triggered this event is the main frame.

metric.name: SafeAreasPresent
metric.summary: Records whether each safe area was present. It will contain the first flag (1) if the top safe area is present. Likewise the second for the left, the third for the bottom and the forth for the right. If the safe area is updated whilst we are allowed to extend into the cutout then we will use the newest safe area values.

metric.name: ViewportFit.Applied
metric.summary: Contains the ViewportFit value that was applied by the WebContents. The frame that is fullscreen will always propagate it's ViewportFit value. This is stored as a ViewportFit enum (see display_cutout.mojom).

metric.name: ViewportFit.IgnoredReason
metric.summary: Records the reason why the ViewportFit value of this frame was not the applied value. It will be '0' if the value was allowed. It will be '1' if the ViewportFit value from the frame was blocked because the WebContents was not fullscreen. It will be '2' flag if the ViewportFit value from the frame was blocked because another frame is fullscreen.

metric.name: ViewportFit.Supplied
metric.summary: Contains the ViewportFit value that was supplied by the frame that triggered the event. This is stored as a ViewportFit enum (see display_cutout.mojom). It can never be kAuto as we ignore events when the page is not trying to use the viewport fit API.

event.name: LoadingPredictor
event.summary: Metrics that reflect the accuracy of the predictions used by the Loading Predictor. This event will be recorded once per page load on DocumentOnLoadCompletedInMainFrame().

metric.name: LocalPredictionCorrectlyPredictedOrigins
metric.summary: The number of subresource origins that were correctly predicted by the local prediction database. This will be recorded if there is a prediction available in the local prediction database and does not necessarily mean that the prediction was used. If more than 100 subresource origins were correctly predicted, this will be capped at 100.

metric.name: LocalPredictionOrigins
metric.summary: The number of subresource origins that were predicted locally. This will be recorded if there is a prediction available in the local prediction database and does not necessarily mean that the prediction was used. If more than 100 subresource origins were predicted, this will be capped at 100.

metric.name: OptimizationGuidePredictionCorrectlyPredictedOrigins
metric.summary: The number of subresource origins that were correctly predicted by the Optimization Guide. This will be recorded if the Optimization Guide was consulted for the page load and the Optimization Guide had a prediction for it. If more than 100 subresource origins were correctly predicted, this will be capped at 100.

metric.name: OptimizationGuidePredictionCorrectlyPredictedSubresources
metric.summary: The number of subresources that were correctly predicted by the Optimization Guide. This will be recorded if the Optimization Guide was consulted for the page load and the Optimization Guide had a prediction for it. If more than 100 subresources were predicted, this will be capped at 100.

metric.name: OptimizationGuidePredictionDecision
metric.summary: The decision coming from the Optimization Guide for whether there was a prediction available for the Page Load. This will be recorded if the Optimization Guide was consulted for the page load.

metric.name: OptimizationGuidePredictionOrigins
metric.summary: The number of subresource origins that were predicted by the Optimization Guide. This will be recorded if the Optimization Guide was consulted for the page load and the Optimization Guide had a prediction for it. If more than 100 subresource origins were predicted, this will be capped at 100.

metric.name: OptimizationGuidePredictionSubresources
metric.summary: The number of subresources that were predicted by the Optimization Guide. This will be recorded if the Optimization Guide was consulted for the page load and the Optimization Guide had a prediction for it. If more than 100 subresources were predicted, this will be capped at 100.

event.name: LocalNetworkRequests
event.summary: Metrics that describe the resource request behavior of pages for which navigation successfully commits. A separate entry is generated for every unique IP address or localhost port number to which the loaded page makes a resource request.

metric.name: Count.Failed
metric.summary: The count of requests made by the page to the given resource for which a response is not received or a network error occurs (i.e. |net_error| != |net::OK|) between the time navigation to the page commits and the time it completes.

metric.name: Count.Successful
metric.summary: The count of requests made by the page to the given resource for which a successful response is received (i.e. |net_error| == |net::OK|) between the time navigation to the page commits and the time it completes.

metric.name: PortType
metric.summary: An enum value representing the type of port for requests to localhost. The enum is defined in |LocalNetworkRequestsPageLoadMetricsObserver|. Possible values are 1 for common web server ports, 2 for common database server ports, 4 for common print server ports, 8 for common development server ports, and 0 for all other ports.

metric.name: ResourceType
metric.summary: An enum value representing the type of resource requested. The enum is defined in |LocalNetworkRequestsPageLoadMetricsObserver|. Possible values are 0 for public resources requested by private pages, 1 for private resources requested by public pages, 2 for private resources within the same reserved IP space as the loaded private page, 4 for for private resources within a different reserved IP space than the loaded private page, 8 for resources requested by public pages that are suspected to be routers, and 16 for localhost resources.

event.name: LookalikeUrl.NavigationSuggestion
event.summary: Metrics recorded when a navigated URL's domain name is visually similar to a popular domain or a domain that the user engaged with.

metric.name: MatchType
metric.summary: An enum value representing the type of the match (popular domain, engaged domain, etc.). The enum is defined in |LookalikeUrlBlockingPage|.

metric.name: UserAction
metric.summary: An enum value representing the decision the user made when shown an interstitial (ignored, suggestion_accepted, etc.). The enum is defined in |LookalikeUrlBlockingPage|.

event.name: MainFrameDownload
event.summary: Measurement for top frame download. It is only recorded for downloads originated from navigations or from HTML anchor download attributes.

metric.name: HasGesture
metric.summary: A boolean denoting whether the download involves a transient user gesture.

metric.name: HasSandbox
metric.summary: A boolean denoting whether the download occurs in a sandboxed browsing context.

event.name: MainFrameNavigation
event.summary: Metric associated with a main frame navigation. Currently implemented only on iOS.

metric.name: DidCommit
metric.summary: Set to 1 if the navigation successfully commited.

event.name: Media.Autoplay.Attempt
event.summary: Event recorded when there is an attempt to autoplay (ie. no user gesture). It will be recorded regardless of the result of this attempt.

metric.name: AudioTrack
metric.summary: Whether the element had an audio track when autoplay was attempted.

metric.name: HighMediaEngagement
metric.summary: Whether the document has a high media engagement.

metric.name: Muted
metric.summary: Whether the element was muted when autoplay was attempted.

metric.name: Source
metric.summary: Source of the autoplay attempt: 0 for attribute; 1 for play().

metric.name: UserGestureRequired
metric.summary: Whether a user gesture was required per autoplay rules at the time of attempt. By definition there is no user gesture on the stack when the attempt is registered.

metric.name: UserGestureStatus
metric.summary: Reflects the current status of user gesture/activation. This is a bit field with the following values: - 0b0001 if there is a user gesture on the stack; - 0b0010 if there was a user gesture on the page (ie. was activated); - 0b0100 if there was a user gesture propogated after a navigation.

metric.name: VideoTrack
metric.summary: Whether the element had a video track when autoplay was attempted.

event.name: Media.Autoplay.AudioContext
event.summary: Records the AudioContext autoplay information.

metric.name: SourceNodeStarted
metric.summary: A boolean indicating if start() was called for any source node associated to the AudioContext.

metric.name: Status
metric.summary: Status of this AudioContext when the autoplay policy applies. It will match the values from AudioContext::AutoplayStatus.

metric.name: UnlockType
metric.summary: How the AudioContext was unlocked if it was. It will match the values from AudioContext::AutoplayUnlockType unless the AudioContext was never unlocked in which case it will be equal to -1.

event.name: Media.Autoplay.Muted.UnmuteAction
event.summary: Event recorded when there is an attempt to unmute an media that was autoplaying following the rules of autoplay muted.

metric.name: Result
metric.summary: 0 means that the unmute failed because it happened without a user gesture. 1 means that it succeeded because it had a user gesture.

metric.name: Source
metric.summary: Similar to "Source" in "Media.Autoplay.Attempt" with the addition of a value for both sources being used: 0 for attribute; 1 for play(); 2 for both attempted.

event.name: Media.BasicPlayback
event.summary: Core metrics associated with a media playback through WebMediaPlayerImpl. Reported at the time of WatchTimeRecorder destruction or render process termination; whichever comes first. There will be multiple entries for a given playback; one for every PlaybackProperties change as well as one for foreground and background. Records may be aggregated based on PlayerID and correlated with the Media.WebMediaPlayerState event.

metric.name: AudioCodec
metric.summary: media::AudioCodec enum value. Can be kUnknownAudioCodec even when HasAudio is true because we don't always know the codec.

metric.name: AudioCodecProfile
metric.summary: media::AudioCodecProfile enum value. Can be AudioCodecProfile::kUnknown even when HasAudio is true because we don't always know the codec profile.

metric.name: AudioDecoderName
metric.summary: Enumeration of audio decoder names, zero if none or unknown (Cast, HLS, etc). See WatchTimeRecorder::AudioDecoderName enum for expected values.

metric.name: AudioEncryptionScheme
metric.summary: media::EncryptionMode enum value. Can be kUnencrypted if IsEME is false or if the audio track is unencrypted.

metric.name: AutoplayInitiated
metric.summary: Boolean value indicating whether the initial playback was initiated via autoplay. Multilpe chunk records of the same player should have the same value. Autoplay is defined as a playback starting before there was a user activation on the page or without a user initiated same-domain navigation.

metric.name: CompletedRebuffersCount
metric.summary: Integer count of the number of times a previous rebuffer succeeded and playback continued.

metric.name: CompletedRebuffersDuration
metric.summary: Sum in milliseconds of all completed rebuffering events. Only reported if a rebuffering completion occurred.

metric.name: Duration
metric.summary: Duration in milliseconds, rounded to the most significant digit, of the media being played. May be missing if the duration is unknown or infinite.

metric.name: HasAudio
metric.summary: Boolean value indicating the presence of audio.

metric.name: HasVideo
metric.summary: Boolean value indicating the presence of video.

metric.name: IsBackground
metric.summary: Boolean value indicating if this event is for a background playback.

metric.name: IsEME
metric.summary: Boolean value indicating if this event is for an EME playback.

metric.name: IsMSE
metric.summary: Boolean value indicating if this event is for an MSE playback. If false it means this was a SRC playback.

metric.name: IsMuted
metric.summary: Boolean value indicating if this event is for a muted playback.

metric.name: IsTopFrame
metric.summary: Flag indicating whether the report comes from the top frame or some inner frame. For privacy, metrics from inner frames are recorded with the top frame's origin, so this flag helps separate top frame vs. embedded playbacks.

metric.name: LastPipelineStatus
metric.summary: media::PipelineStatus enum value. Always 0 if the playback succeeded; all other values indicate the playback ended in an error.

metric.name: MeanTimeBetweenRebuffers
metric.summary: Average number of milliseconds between rebuffering events. Only reported if a rebuffering event occurred. Computed by dividing total watch time by the number of rebuffering events.

metric.name: PlayerID
metric.summary: ID which corresponds to a given WebMediaPlayerImpl instance. May be linked with Media.WebMediaPlayerState events to understand playback more deeply.

metric.name: RebuffersCount
metric.summary: Integer count of the number of times playback experienced rebuffering.

metric.name: VideoCodec
metric.summary: media::VideoCodec enum value. Can be kUnknownVideoCodec even when HasVideo is true because we don't always know the codec.

metric.name: VideoCodecProfile
metric.summary: media::VideoCodecProfile enum value. Can be VIDEO_CODEC_PROFILE_UNKNOWN even when HasVideo is true because we don't always know the codec profile.

metric.name: VideoDecoderName
metric.summary: Enumeration of video decoder names, zero if none or unknown (Cast, HLS, etc). See WatchTimeRecorder::VideoDecoderName enum for expected values.

metric.name: VideoEncryptionScheme
metric.summary: media::EncryptionMode enum value. Can be kUnencrypted if IsEME is false or if the video track is unencrypted.

metric.name: VideoFramesDecoded
metric.summary: Integer count of the video frames decoded in this record.

metric.name: VideoFramesDropped
metric.summary: Integer count of the video frames dropped in this record. Should not exceed VideoFramesDecoded.

metric.name: VideoNaturalHeight
metric.summary: Integer value indicating the natural height of the playback.

metric.name: VideoNaturalWidth
metric.summary: Integer value indicating the natural width of the playback.

metric.name: WatchTime
metric.summary: Watch time in milliseconds for this playback. See Media.WatchTime UMA metrics.

metric.name: WatchTime.AC
metric.summary: Watch time on AC power in milliseconds for this playback. See Media.WatchTime UMA metrics.

metric.name: WatchTime.Battery
metric.summary: Watch time on battery power in milliseconds for this playback. See Media.WatchTime UMA metrics.

metric.name: WatchTime.DisplayFullscreen
metric.summary: Watch time for fullscreen in milliseconds for this playback. See Media.WatchTime UMA metrics. Only reported for foreground playbacks.

metric.name: WatchTime.DisplayInline
metric.summary: Watch time for inline display in milliseconds for this playback. See Media.WatchTime UMA metrics. Only reported for foreground playbacks.

metric.name: WatchTime.DisplayPictureInPicture
metric.summary: Watch time for picture in picture display in milliseconds for this playback. See Media.WatchTime UMA metrics. Only reported for foreground playbacks.

metric.name: WatchTime.NativeControlsOff
metric.summary: Watch time with no controls in milliseconds for this playback. See Media.WatchTime UMA metrics. Only reported for foreground playbacks.

metric.name: WatchTime.NativeControlsOn
metric.summary: Watch time with native controls in milliseconds for this playback. See Media.WatchTime UMA metrics. Only reported for foreground playbacks.

event.name: Media.EME.ApiPromiseRejection
event.summary: Event recorded when an Encrypted Media Extensions (EME) API promise is rejected. In most cases this indicates a failure.

metric.name: Api
metric.summary: The EME API for which the promise is rejected.

metric.name: SystemCode
metric.summary: A CDM specific code providing more details about the cause of rejection.

event.name: Media.EME.CreateMediaKeys
event.summary: Event recorded when createMediaKeys() is called as part of Encrypted Media Extensions (EME) API.

metric.name: IsAdFrame
metric.summary: Whether the frame is an ad frame.

metric.name: IsCrossOrigin
metric.summary: Whether the frame is Cross-Origin to the main frame.

metric.name: IsTopFrame
metric.summary: Whether the frame is the main frame.

metric.name: KeySystem
metric.summary: The key system associated with this call.

event.name: Media.EME.RequestMediaKeySystemAccess
event.summary: Event recorded when RequestMediaKeySystemAccess() is called as part of Encrypted Media Extensions (EME) API.

metric.name: IsAdFrame
metric.summary: Whether the frame is an ad frame.

metric.name: IsCrossOrigin
metric.summary: Whether the frame is Cross-Origin to the main frame.

metric.name: IsTopFrame
metric.summary: Whether the frame is the main frame.

metric.name: KeySystem
metric.summary: The key system passed in requestMediaKeySystemAccess() call.

metric.name: VideoCapabilities
metric.summary: Whether there are any "videoCapabilities".

metric.name: VideoCapabilities.HasEmptyRobustness
metric.summary: Whether there are any "videoCapabilities" with empty robustness.

metric.name: VideoCapabilities.HasHwSecureAllRobustness
metric.summary: Whether there are any "videoCapabilities" with robustness being "HW_SECURE_ALL".

event.name: Media.Engagement.SessionFinished
event.summary:
The Media Engagement index stores the number of significant media playbacks per origin and the number of visits. From that we calculate a Media Engagement Score.
To tweak the scoring function we are logging the total number of significant media playbacks, the total number of visits, the calculated engagement score and the new number of significant media playbacks that occured this visit.

metric.name: Engagement.IsHigh
metric.summary: Whether the Media Engagement Service considers the score to be high (we are using a two threshold approach so there is one threshold to be considered high and another one to lose that status to reduce jitter).

metric.name: Engagement.IsHigh.Changed
metric.summary: Whether the IsHigh bit changed during the current session.

metric.name: Engagement.IsHigh.Changes
metric.summary: Counts of IsHigh changing (from 0 to 1 or 1 to 0).

metric.name: Engagement.IsPreloaded
metric.summary: Whether the origin was preloaded (from the chrome://component) as a high engagement origin.

metric.name: Engagement.Score
metric.summary: The calculated Media Engagement score for the current origin. The score is calculated by dividing the number of significant media playbacks by the number of visits. If the number of visits is below 5 then the score will be zero. This score is taken from MediaEngagementService.

metric.name: Playbacks.AudioContextTotal
metric.summary: The total number of significant media playbacks on this origin that came from WebAudio / AudioContext.

metric.name: Playbacks.Delta
metric.summary: The number of significant media playbacks on this origin during this session (a visit to an origin on the same tab). A playback is determined significant if it meets certain criteria such as a video size of at least 200x140px, is not muted, is playing, etc.

metric.name: Playbacks.MediaElementTotal
metric.summary: The total number of significant media playbacks on this origin that came from media elements.

metric.name: Playbacks.SecondsSinceLast
metric.summary: The number of seconds between significant media playback on the last visit and significant media playback on the current visit. If there was no previous visit or significant media playback this visit it will be 0.

metric.name: Playbacks.Total
metric.summary: The total number of significant media playbacks on this origin.

metric.name: Player.Audible.Delta
metric.summary: The number of unique audio/video players on a page that was audible (made sound) during a visit.

metric.name: Player.Audible.Total
metric.summary: The delta from above but instead of a single visit, the total of all deltas for all visits on this origin.

metric.name: Player.Significant.Delta
metric.summary: The number of unique audio/video players on a page that was audible (made sound) and considered significant (played for at least 7 seconds) during a visit.

metric.name: Player.Significant.Total
metric.summary: The delta from above but instead of a single visit, the total of all deltas for all visits on this origin.

metric.name: Visits.Total
metric.summary: The total number of visits to this origin.

event.name: Media.Engagement.ShortPlaybackIgnored
event.summary:
The Media Engagement index stores the number of significant media playbacks per origin and the number of audible players. From that we calculate a Media Engagement Score.
Media with a short playback length is ignored so we are logging any time the player is ignored with the length in msec. This will allow us to identify whether sites are being penalized or there is abuse and allow us to tweak the length considered "short".

event.name: Media.Feed.Discover
event.summary: Media Feeds are out of band feeds of media recommendations that are fetched by the browser. This records when we discover a feed that has been placed in a meta tag on a website.

metric.name: HasMediaFeed
metric.summary: Whether the site has a media feed.

event.name: Media.GlobalMediaControls.ActionButtonPressed
event.summary: Records when a user presses a button in the Global Media Controls. Records no more than 100 actions per source per session. Records which button was pressed (e.g. play, pause, next track, picture-in-picture).

metric.name: MediaSessionAction
metric.summary: The action of the button that was pressed (e.g. play, pause, next track, picture-in-picture).

event.name: Media.Learning.PredictionRecord
event.summary:
A record of some predicted value vs. an observation. If the prediction is for a regression-style task (e.g., "predict a number" rather than "predict an enum value"), then the predicted and observed values are the numeric values, scaled by default to be in the integer range 0-100.
The exact scaling used depends on the particular regression problem. Please see the LearningTask structure for the task of interest to find out how it maps values into the [0, 100] output range.
A record is created for every prediction separately.
For example, in the MediaCapabilities experiments, each playback generates a record. The predicted / observed values are the ratio of dropped to decoded frames, expressed as a percentage scaled to 0-100.

metric.name: LearningTask
metric.summary: The learning task to which this record applies. This is a persistent hash of the |name| field in the LearningTask. Presumably, you'll want to include only records of a particular task when analyzing results.

metric.name: ObservedValue
metric.summary:
Observed value for this sample, scaled into the range [0, 100]. The exact scaling factor depends on the particular task.
MediaCapabilities, for example, reports 100 * percentage_of_dropped_frames in this field.

metric.name: PredictedValue
metric.summary:
Predicted value for this sample, scaled into the range [0, 100]. The exact scaling factor depends on the particular task.
MediaCapabilities, for example, reports 100 * percentage_of_dropped_frames in this field.

metric.name: TrainingDataSize
metric.summary: Number of training examples that were used to train this model.

metric.name: TrainingDataTotalWeight
metric.summary: Total weight of all examples that were used to train this model.

event.name: Media.SiteMuted
event.summary: Event recorded when a website tries to play audio but is muted by the sound content setting.

metric.name: MuteReason
metric.summary: Enum value giving the reason the site was muted. Defined as |SoundContentSettingObserver::MuteReason|.

event.name: Media.VideoDecodePerfRecord
event.summary: A record of decoding performance metrics from a video playback with the given stream characteristics (profile, resolution, fps). Also includes what Media Capabilities API would claim for such a stream as a means of assessing the API's accuracy.

metric.name: Perf.ApiWouldClaimIsPowerEfficient
metric.summary: Boolean signaling whether MediaCapabilities would classify streams with these characteristics as power efficient prior to considering this latest record. MediaCapabilities prediction is accurate when this value matches RecordIsPowerEfficient.

metric.name: Perf.ApiWouldClaimIsSmooth
metric.summary: Boolean signaling whether MediaCapabilities would classify streams with these characteristics as smooth prior to considering this latest record. MediaCapabilities prediction is accurate when this value matches RecordIsSmooth.

metric.name: Perf.PastVideoFramesDecoded
metric.summary: Integer count of past video frames decoded for the given video type.

metric.name: Perf.PastVideoFramesDropped
metric.summary: Integer count of past video frames dropped for the given video type.

metric.name: Perf.PastVideoFramesPowerEfficient
metric.summary: Integer count of past video frames power efficient for the given video type.

metric.name: Perf.RecordIsPowerEfficient
metric.summary: Boolean signaling whether MediaCapabilities would classify this isolated playback record as power efficient.

metric.name: Perf.RecordIsSmooth
metric.summary: Boolean signaling whether MediaCapabilities would classify this isolated playback record as smooth.

metric.name: Perf.VideoFramesDecoded
metric.summary: Integer count of the video frames decoded in this record.

metric.name: Perf.VideoFramesDropped
metric.summary: Integer count of the video frames dropped in this record. Should not exceed VideoFramesDecoded.

metric.name: Perf.VideoFramesPowerEfficient
metric.summary: Integer count of the video frames decoded via power efficient means in this record. Should not exceed VideoFramesDecoded.

metric.name: Video.CodecProfile
metric.summary: media::VideoCodecProfile enum value. Can be VIDEO_CODEC_PROFILE_UNKNOWN if we don't know the video codec.

metric.name: Video.EME.KeySystem
metric.summary: Name of the KeySystem used during for an encrypted (EME) playback. Will be unset when EME is not used.

metric.name: Video.EME.UseHwSecureCodecs
metric.summary: Boolean indicating whether content decryption module (CDM) was configured to use hardware secure decoding. May be true or false for EME playbacks. Will be unset for non-EME playbacks.

metric.name: Video.FramesPerSecond
metric.summary: Integer representing video frames per second. This is the cadence of video frames as described by stream timestamps multiplied by HTMLMediaELement.playbackRate.

metric.name: Video.InTopFrame
metric.summary: Flag indicating whether the record comes from the top frame or some inner frame. For privacy, metrics from inner frames are recorded with the top frame's origin, so this flag helps separate top frame vs. embedded playbacks.

metric.name: Video.NaturalHeight
metric.summary: Integer representing height of video natural size.

metric.name: Video.NaturalWidth
metric.summary: Integer representing width of video natural size.

metric.name: Video.PlayerID
metric.summary: ID which corresponds to a given WebMediaPlayerImpl instance. May be linked with Media.WebMediaPlayerState events to understand playback more deeply.

event.name: Media.WatchTime
event.summary:
Watch time is defined as the amount of elapsed media time for audio+video media aggregated per player instance. A minimum of 7 seconds of unmuted, foreground media must be watched to start watch time monitoring. Watch time is checked on a regular basis and reported upon one of the stop events mentioned below or at player destruction if none occur prior.
Any one of paused, hidden, or muted is sufficient to stop watch time metric reports. Each of these has a hysteresis where if the state change is undone within some time, the watch time will be counted as uninterrupted.
Power events (on/off battery power) have a similar hysteresis, but unlike the aforementioned properties, will not stop metric collection.
Native controls events have a similar behavior than power events.
Each seek event will result in a new watch time metric being started and the old metric finalized as accurately as possible.

event.name: Media.WebAudio.AudioContext.AudibleTime
event.summary: Records the AudioContext audible time information.

metric.name: AudibleTime
metric.summary: Audible time in milliseconds for this event.

metric.name: IsMainFrame
metric.summary: Indicates whether the event is fired from main frame.

event.name: Media.WebMediaPlayerState
event.summary: Final state of WebMediaPlayerImpl instance. Records only immutable playback properties. Contains a PlaybackID which links to Media.BasicPlayback events.

metric.name: ContainerName
metric.summary: media::container_names::MediaContainerName enum value. Only recorded for !IsMSE src=URL playbacks, this is the container of the media being played back; E.g., mp4, avi, mp3, etc.

metric.name: FinalPipelineStatus
metric.summary: media::PipelineStatus enum value. Always 0 if the playback succeeded; all other values indicate the playback ended in an error.

metric.name: IsEME
metric.summary: Boolean value indicating if this event is for an EME playback. Note: EME can be attached anytime during the lifecycle of a WebMediaPlayerImpl, but once attached can't be removed.

metric.name: IsMSE
metric.summary: Boolean value indicating if this event is for an MSE playback. If false it means this was a SRC playback.

metric.name: IsTopFrame
metric.summary: Flag indicating whether the report comes from the top frame or some inner frame. For privacy, metrics from inner frames are recorded with the top frame's origin, so this flag helps separate top frame vs. embedded playbacks.

metric.name: PlayerID
metric.summary: ID which corresponds to a given WebMediaPlayerImpl instance. May be linked with Media.BasicPlayback events to understand a playback more deeply.

metric.name: TimeToFirstFrame
metric.summary: Time in milliseconds from when WebMediaPlayerImpl starts loading until the first video frame has been shown.

metric.name: TimeToMetadata
metric.summary: Time in milliseconds from when WebMediaPlayerImpl starts loading until metadata is known.

metric.name: TimeToPlayReady
metric.summary: Time in milliseconds from when WebMediaPlayerImpl starts loading until it has buffered enough to start playback.

metric.name: URLScheme
metric.summary: media::mojom::MediaURLScheme enum value. Only recorded for !IsMSE src=URL playbacks, this is the scheme of that URL; E.g., http, https, filesystem, etc.

event.name: MediaRouter.TabMirroringStarted
event.summary: Recorded whenever user starts a tab mirroring session via Media Router.

metric.name: AudioState
metric.summary: The audio playback state of the WebContents at the start of the tab mirroring session.

event.name: Memory.Experimental
event.summary: Metrics associated with memory consumption, in MB.

metric.name: ArrayBuffer
metric.summary: Measure of memory consumed by Array Buffer.

metric.name: BlinkGC
metric.summary: Measure of memory consumed by Oilpan.

metric.name: BlinkGC.AllocatedObjects
metric.summary: Measure of memory consumed by live allocations made from Oilpan.

metric.name: CommandBuffer
metric.summary: Measure of memory consumed by GL command buffer.

metric.name: Discardable
metric.summary: Measure of memory consumed by Discardable memory service.

metric.name: DownloadService
metric.summary: Measure of memory used by download service.

metric.name: Extensions.ValueStore
metric.summary: Measure of memory consumed by Key Value Store databases of extensions.

metric.name: FontCaches
metric.summary: Measure of memory used by font platform and shape caches in renderer process.

metric.name: GpuMemory
metric.summary: Measure of GPU memory used by Chrome.

metric.name: History
metric.summary: Approximate measure of memory consumed by History service.

metric.name: IsVisible
metric.summary: Indicates whether the tab is visible or not at the time of metric collection.

metric.name: JavaHeap
metric.summary: Measure of memory consumed by java heap on Android.

metric.name: LevelDatabase
metric.summary: Measure of memory consumed by unaccounted level databases.

metric.name: Malloc
metric.summary: Measure of memory allocated by malloc, that is not classified by other metrics.

metric.name: Malloc.AllocatedObjects
metric.summary: Measure of total memory used by objects allocated using malloc.

metric.name: Net
metric.summary: Measure of memory allocated by network sockets and caches.

metric.name: Net.UrlRequestContext
metric.summary: Measure of memory allocated by all network requests.

metric.name: NumberOfAdSubframes
metric.summary: The number of ad subframes that the associated renderer owns.

metric.name: NumberOfArrayBufferContents
metric.summary: The number of arraybuffer contents that the associated renderer owns.

metric.name: NumberOfCallsInDetachedWindowByClosing
metric.summary: The number of function calls in a window detached by closing/removal.

metric.name: NumberOfCallsInDetachedWindowByClosing_After10sSinceDetaching
metric.summary: The number of function calls in a window detached by closing/removal, that happened at least 10 seconds after detaching.

metric.name: NumberOfCallsInDetachedWindowByClosing_After1minSinceDetaching
metric.summary: The number of function calls in a window detached by closing/removal, that happened at least 1 minute after detaching.

metric.name: NumberOfCallsInDetachedWindowByNavigation
metric.summary: The number of function calls in a window detached by navigating away.

metric.name: NumberOfCallsInDetachedWindowByNavigation_After10sSinceDetaching
metric.summary: The number of function calls in a window detached by navigating away, that happened at least 10 seconds after detaching.

metric.name: NumberOfCallsInDetachedWindowByNavigation_After1minSinceDetaching
metric.summary: The number of function calls in a window detached by navigating away, that happened at least 1 minute after detaching.

metric.name: NumberOfCallsInDetachedWindowByOtherReason
metric.summary: The number of function calls in a window detached by another reason.

metric.name: NumberOfCallsInDetachedWindowByOtherReason_After10sSinceDetaching
metric.summary: The number of function calls in a window detached by another reason, that happened at least 10 seconds after detaching.

metric.name: NumberOfCallsInDetachedWindowByOtherReason_After1minSinceDetaching
metric.summary: The number of function calls in a window detached by another reason, that happened at least 1 minute after detaching.

metric.name: NumberOfDetachedScriptStates
metric.summary: The number of detached ScriptState that the associated renderer owns.

metric.name: NumberOfDocuments
metric.summary: The number of documents that the associated renderer owns.

metric.name: NumberOfExtensions
metric.summary: The number of extensions that are served from the associated renderer process.

metric.name: NumberOfFrames
metric.summary: The number of frames that the associated renderer owns.

metric.name: NumberOfLayoutObjects
metric.summary: The number of layout objects that the associated renderer owns.

metric.name: NumberOfMojoHandles
metric.summary: The number of mojo handles stored in HandleTable.

metric.name: NumberOfNodes
metric.summary: The number of nodes that the associated renderer owns.

metric.name: NumberOfWebMediaPlayers
metric.summary: The number of web media players in the associated renderer.

metric.name: OmniboxSuggestions
metric.summary: Measure of memory used due to URL indexing and autocomplete suggestions.

metric.name: PartitionAlloc
metric.summary: Measure of memory allocated by PartitionAlloc allocator.

metric.name: PartitionAlloc.AllocatedObjects
metric.summary: Measure of total memory used by objects allocated using PartitionAlloc.

metric.name: PartitionAlloc.Partitions.ArrayBuffer
metric.summary: Measure of memory used by Array Buffer partition in PartitionAlloc.

metric.name: PartitionAlloc.Partitions.Buffer
metric.summary: Measure of memory used by Buffer partition in PartitionAlloc.

metric.name: PartitionAlloc.Partitions.FastMalloc
metric.summary: Measure of memory used by Fast Malloc partition in PartitionAlloc.

metric.name: PartitionAlloc.Partitions.Layout
metric.summary: Measure of memory used by Layout partition in PartitionAlloc.

metric.name: PrivateMemoryFootprint
metric.summary: Measure of total private memory consumed by process.

metric.name: PrivateSwapFootprint
metric.summary: Measure of private swap memory consumed by a process. Available on Linux and Android.

metric.name: ProcessType
metric.summary: Type of process (e.g. browser, renderer, GPU --- see services/resource_coordinator/public/mojom/memory_instrumentation/memory_instrumentation.mojom) of associated metrics.

metric.name: Resident
metric.summary: Size of process' working set.

metric.name: SharedMemoryFootprint
metric.summary: Measure of total shared memory consumed by process.

metric.name: SiteStorage
metric.summary: Measure of memory used due to web storage APIs in browser process.

metric.name: SiteStorage.BlobStorage
metric.summary: Measure of memory used by in-memory blob file API in browser process.

metric.name: SiteStorage.IndexDB

metric.name: SiteStorage.LocalStorage
metric.summary: Measure of memory used due to Local Storage API in browser process.

metric.name: SiteStorage.SessionStorage
metric.summary: Measure of memory used due to Session Storage API in browser process.

metric.name: Skia
metric.summary: Measure of memory used by Skia.

metric.name: Skia.SkGlyphCache
metric.summary: Measure of memory used by Skia Glyph Cache.

metric.name: Skia.SkResourceCache
metric.summary: Measure of memory used by Skia Resource Cache.

metric.name: Sqlite
metric.summary: Measure of memory used by all sqlite databases.

metric.name: Sync
metric.summary: Measure of memory used by Sync storage.

metric.name: TabRestore
metric.summary: Approximate measure of memory used by Tab restore service.

metric.name: TimeSinceLastNavigation
metric.summary: The time in seconds since the Tab navigated. Only emitted for tabs that are not sharing a process.

metric.name: TimeSinceLastVisibilityChange
metric.summary: The time in seconds since the Tab changed visibility. Only emitted for tabs that are not sharing a process.

metric.name: Total2.PrivateMemoryFootprint
metric.summary: Measure of total private memory consumed by all processes.

metric.name: Total2.SharedMemoryFootprint
metric.summary: Measure of total shared memory consumed by all processes.

metric.name: UI
metric.summary: Measure of memory used by Android UI bitmaps.

metric.name: Uptime
metric.summary: Process uptime.

metric.name: V8
metric.summary: Measure of memory consumed by V8.

metric.name: V8.AllocatedObjects
metric.summary: Measure of memory consumed by live objects in V8.

metric.name: V8.Main.Heap.CodeLargeObjectSpace.AllocatedObjects

metric.name: V8.Main.Heap.CodeSpace.AllocatedObjects
metric.summary: Measure of memory consumed by live objects in the code space of the main heap of V8.

metric.name: V8.Main.Heap.LargeObjectSpace
metric.summary: Measure of memory consumed by the large object space of the main heap of V8.

metric.name: V8.Main.Heap.LargeObjectSpace.AllocatedObjects

metric.name: WebCache.XSLStylesheetResources

event.name: Memory.TabFootprint
event.summary: Measure of memory used by the processes that host an instance of a tab. Intended as a high-level metric for analyzing effective memory use of individual sites.

metric.name: MainFrameProcessPMF
metric.summary: Measure of private memory, in MB, consumed by the render process dedicated to hosting the main frame. Undefined if the main frame is hosted by a render process used by other tabs. If this is undefined, TabPMF will be undefined.

metric.name: SubFrameProcessPMF.Excluded
metric.summary: Number of render processes that were blocked from contributing to SubFrameProcessPMF.Total. A process can have its contribution blocked if the process has responsiblities outside the scope of the relevant tab. If this is non-zero, TabPMF will be undefined.

metric.name: SubFrameProcessPMF.Included
metric.summary: Number of render processes that contributed to SubFrameProcessPMF.Total.

metric.name: SubFrameProcessPMF.Total
metric.summary: Measure of total private memory, in MB, consumed by the render processes dedicated to hosting sub-frames of the tab. Note that, if a render process hosts frames of other tabs, it isn't considered to be 'dedicated' and so it doesn't contribute to this total.

metric.name: TabPMF
metric.summary: Measure of private memory, in MB, consumed by all render processes dedicated to hosting some part of a tab. Undefined if there are processes responsible for hosting parts of this tab while hosting parts of other tabs.

event.name: MixedContentAutoupgrade.ResourceRequest
event.summary: Status and Network error or HTTP response code for a resource request that was autoupgraded to HTTPS as part of the mixed content autoupgrade experiment.

metric.name: Code
metric.summary: The HTTP response or network error code for an autoupgraded request.

metric.name: Status
metric.summary: An enum with 0 representing started, 1 failed, and 2 response received.

event.name: MobileMenu.DirectShare
event.summary: User pressed 'Share' in the app menu. The intent most recently used to share was invoked directly. See also MobileMenu.Share.

metric.name: HasOccurred
metric.summary: A boolean signaling that the event has occurred; only records true values.

event.name: MobileMenu.FindInPage
event.summary: User pressed 'Find in page' in the app menu.

metric.name: HasOccurred
metric.summary: A boolean signaling that the event has occurred (typically only records true values).

event.name: MobileMenu.Share
event.summary: User pressed 'Share' in the app menu. A picker was shown. See also MobileMenu.DirectShare.

metric.name: HasOccurred
metric.summary: A boolean signaling that the event has occurred; only records true values.

event.name: NavigationPredictorAnchorElementMetrics
event.summary: Metrics that describe an anchor element's data. This event is emitted at most 10 times per page load, once for each of the top n URLs on a page, and the order of the events is randomized. If there is no nth anchor element, no value is returned.

metric.name: AnchorIndex
metric.summary: The index of the clicked-on anchor element in NavigationPredictor's |top_urls_|.

metric.name: ContainsImage
metric.summary: 1 if the anchor element contains an image.

metric.name: IsInIframe
metric.summary: 1 if the anchor element is in an iframe.

metric.name: IsURLIncrementedByOne
metric.summary: 1 if the anchor element's target URL and the document's source URL only differ by one number, and the target URL increments that number in the source URL by 1.

metric.name: PercentClickableArea
metric.summary: The percent of the total document area that this anchor element's clickable area occupies.

metric.name: PercentVerticalDistance
metric.summary: How far down the document the top of the anchor element is, expressed as a ratio with the total document height.

metric.name: SameOrigin
metric.summary: 1 if the anchor element's target URL and the document's source URL are the same origin.

event.name: NavigationPredictorPageLinkClick
event.summary: Sent on an in-page link click. An integer from 0-10 (1-indexed), corresponding to the index of that anchor element in the list of top ten anchor elements on that page, sorted by their navigation scores. If an anchor element is clicked that is not on the top ten list, 0 is returned.

event.name: NavigationPredictorPageLinkMetrics
event.summary: Metrics that describe aggregate information about the links within a page. Some anchor elements present on a page may not be represented in these metrics, if they are outside the viewport or if their placement in the page is after the 40th anchor element. This event is emitted at most once per page load. Unless otherwise specified, each of the aggregate metrics is bucketted with exponential buckets of size 1.3.

metric.name: MedianLinkLocation
metric.summary: The median vertical link location in the viewport, as a ratio of the distance from the top of the link to the visible top of the page. Bucketted with a linear bucket size of 10.

metric.name: NumberOfAnchors.ContainsImage
metric.summary: The total number of links in the page that are images.

metric.name: NumberOfAnchors.InIframe
metric.summary: The total number of links in the page in any iframe.

metric.name: NumberOfAnchors.SameHost
metric.summary: The total number of links in the page that point to the same origin as the current page's origin.

metric.name: NumberOfAnchors.Total
metric.summary: The total number of links within a page.

metric.name: NumberOfAnchors.URLIncremented
metric.summary: The total number of links on the page, where each link only differs from the current page's URL by a number, and that number is incremented by 1 in the link.

metric.name: TotalClickableSpace
metric.summary: The total clickable space in the entire page, expressed as a ratio of the visible clickable region to the entire viewport region.

metric.name: Viewport.Height
metric.summary: The height of the viewport, in pixels.

metric.name: Viewport.Width
metric.summary: The width of the viewport, in pixels.

event.name: Net.LegacyTLSVersion
event.summary: Recorded when a resource is loaded using TLS 1.0 or TLS 1.1.

metric.name: IsAdResource
metric.summary: Boolean value representing whether the request is for an ad resource. Only set if IsSubresource is true.

metric.name: IsMainFrame
metric.summary: Boolean value representing whether the request is in the main frame or not (if false, the request is from a subframe).

metric.name: IsSubresource
metric.summary: Boolean value representing whether the request is for a subresource. If false, then the request was a main frame page load.

event.name: NoStatePrefetch
event.summary: Metrics related to NoStatePrefetch that are recorded using the same UKM IDs as PageLoad.

metric.name: PrefetchedRecently.FinalStatus
metric.summary: Final status of the nostate prefetch if one was recently attempted for either the committed URL of this navigation or for any URL in the redirect chain for the main frame resource for this navigation. page. Recorded as enum PrerenderFinalStatus in //tools/metrics/histograms/enums.xml.

metric.name: PrefetchedRecently.Origin
metric.summary: Triggering origin of the nostate prefetch if one was recently attempted for either the committed URL of this navigation or for any URL in the redirect chain for the main frame resource for this navigation. Recorded as enum PrerenderOrigin in //tools/metrics/histograms/enums.xml.

metric.name: PrefetchedRecently.PrefetchAge
metric.summary: Records the time (in milliseconds) from the start of the nostate prefetch to the time of commit of this navigation. Metric is recorded down to the nearest power of 2. Recorded only if a nostate prefetch was recently attempted for either the committed URL of this navigation or for any URL in the redirect chain for the main frame resource for this navigation.

event.name: Notification
event.summary: A notification event corresponds with the entire lifespan of a single notification, and will be logged to UKM when the notification is deleted from the notification database.

metric.name: ClosedReason
metric.summary: Enum for how the notification was closed. {user, developer, unknown}

metric.name: DidReplaceAnotherNotification
metric.summary: Boolean value representing whether a tag is present and a previously shown notification has been replaced. For UKM logging, we treat a replacement notification as a new notification.

metric.name: DidUserOpenSettings
metric.summary: Boolean value indicating whether the user accessed the Chrome provided settings from the notification.

metric.name: HasBadge
metric.summary: Boolean value representing if a badge URL was included.

metric.name: HasIcon
metric.summary: Boolean value representing if an icon URL was included.

metric.name: HasImage
metric.summary: Boolean value representing if an image URL was included.

metric.name: HasRenotify
metric.summary: Boolean value representing whether default notification indicators (sound, vibration, light) should be played again if the notification is replacing an older notification.

metric.name: HasTag
metric.summary: Boolean value representing if a tag is present.

metric.name: IsSilent
metric.summary: Boolean value representing whether default notification indicators (sound, vibration, light) should be suppressed.

metric.name: NumActionButtonClicks
metric.summary: Number of clicks on developer provided action buttons.

metric.name: NumActions
metric.summary: Number of developer specified actions that can be taken.

metric.name: NumClicks
metric.summary: Number of clicks, excluding action buttons. I.e. clicks on the notification itself.

metric.name: RequireInteraction
metric.summary: Boolean value representing whether the notification should remain onscreen indefinitely, rather than being auto-minimized to the notification center (if allowed by platform).

metric.name: TimeUntilClose
metric.summary: The length of time, in ms, between when the notification was triggered and when it was closed.

metric.name: TimeUntilFirstClick
metric.summary: Time, in ms, between when the notification is shown and the first click.

metric.name: TimeUntilLastClick
metric.summary: Time, in ms, between when the notification is shown and the last click.

metric.name: RequestedFromForeground
metric.summary: Metrics that measure which URLs the user is requesting offline page copies of, and whether they were requested from the foreground or background UI. The value is 1 if requested from the foreground, 0 from background.

event.name: OptimizationGuide
event.summary: Optimization guide metrics associated with a page load. It is recorded when the optimization guide was consulted in making a decision for the page load. See //components/optimization_guide/.

metric.name: HintGenerationTimestamp
metric.summary: The timestamp, in seconds from epoch, that the server generated the hint for the optimization applied on the page load.

metric.name: HintSource
metric.summary: The |optimization_guide::proto::HintSource| for the optimization that was applied on the page load.

metric.name: NavigationHintsFetchAttemptStatus
metric.summary: An enum value representing the status of a fetch attempt for the page load and what it contains (i.e. hosts or URLs). Captured at the start of the navigation.

metric.name: NavigationHintsFetchRequestLatency
metric.summary: The duration (in milliseconds) for how long it took from the request to go out to when it was usable on the client. Only recorded if a fetch was initiated for the navigation. Will be recorded as INT64_MAX if the request did not complete successfully.

metric.name: NavigationHostCovered
metric.summary: An enum value representing whether Chrome had a hint cached for the navigation or had attempted to fetch a hint from the remote Optimization Guide Service in the last 7 days. The enum is defined in |optimization_guide::NavigationHostCoveredStatus|.

metric.name: PainfulPageLoadModelPredictionScore
metric.summary: The score output after evaluating the painful page load model. If populated, this is 100x the fractional value output by the model evaluation. This will be a value between 0 and 100.

metric.name: PainfulPageLoadModelVersion
metric.summary: The server-generated version of the painful page load model that was evaluated for the page load.

metric.name: PredictionModelFeatureEffectiveConnectionType
metric.summary: The |net::EffectiveConnectionType| at the time a prediction was requested. Recorded once per page load.

metric.name: PredictionModelFeatureIsSameOriginNavigation
