metric.summary: Whether the current navigatation is the same origin as the previous one at the time a prediction was requested. Recorded once per page load.

metric.name: PredictionModelFeatureNavigationToFCPSessionMean
metric.summary: The average navigation to first contentful paint for the current session at the time a prediction was requested. Recorded once per page load.

metric.name: PredictionModelFeatureNavigationToFCPSessionStdDev
metric.summary: The standard deviation of navigation to first contentful paint for page loads in the current session at the time a prediction was requested. Recorded once per page load.

metric.name: PredictionModelFeaturePageTransition
metric.summary: The |ui::PageTransition| of the current navigation at the time a prediction was requested. Recorded once per page load.

metric.name: PredictionModelFeaturePreviousPageLoadNavigationToFCP
metric.summary: The navigation to to first contentful paint for the previous page load at the time a prediction was requested. Recorded once per page load.

metric.name: PredictionModelFeatureSiteEngagementScore
metric.summary: The site engagement score of the host of the current navigation at the time a prediction was requested. Recorded once per page load.

metric.name: RegisteredOptimizationTargets
metric.summary: A bitmask of the optimization targets that were registered at the start of the page load where each flipped bit corresponds to its int value in |optimization_guide::proto::OptimizationTarget|.

metric.name: RegisteredOptimizationTypes
metric.summary: A bitmask of the optimization types that were registered at the start of the page load where each flipped bit corresponds to its int value in |optimization_guide::proto::OptimizationTarget|.

event.name: PageDomainInfo
event.summary: Metrics that describe the domain of pages that successfully commit. One event is generated per page load that commits. Currently associated with LocalNetworkRequests UKM metric collection.

metric.name: DomainType
metric.summary: An enum value representing the type of domain of the loaded page. The enum is defined in |LocalNetworkRequestsPageLoadMetricsObserver|. Possible values are 0 for unknown (should never be logged), 1 for pages with public domains, 2 for pages with private domains (IP addresses that are part of a reserved IP space not including localhost), or 4 for localhost.

event.name: PageForegroundSession
event.summary: Total time in foreground in milliseconds, recorded each time the page is backgrounded. May be recorded multiple times for a single page visit.

metric.name: ForegroundDuration
metric.summary: Total time in foreground in milliseconds, recorded each time the page is backgrounded.

metric.name: ForegroundNumInputEvents
metric.summary: The number of Input Events, recorded each time the page is backgrounded.

metric.name: ForegroundTotalAdjustedInputDelay
metric.summary: sum(max(Input Delay - 50, 0)), recorded each time the page is backgrounded. The Input Delay refers to the duration between the hardware timestamp and the start of event processing on the main thread for the meaningful input. In ms.

metric.name: ForegroundTotalInputDelay
metric.summary: sum(Input Delay), recorded each time the page is backgrounded. The Input Delay refers to the duration between the hardware timestamp and the start of event processing on the main thread for the meaningful input. In ms.

event.name: PageInfoBubble
event.summary: Recorded when an action on the Page Info Bubble (aka Origin Info Bubble or WebsiteSettings Bubble) is taken. May be recorded multiple times for a single page visit.

metric.name: ActionTaken
metric.summary: Records an enum value representing which action on the Page Info Bubble was taken.

event.name: PageLoad
event.summary: Core metrics associated with web page loads.

metric.name: CpuTime
metric.summary: Amount of CPU wall time over the duration of a page load, while the page is in the foreground. Measured in milliseconds.

metric.name: DocumentTiming.NavigationToDOMContentLoadedEventFired
metric.summary: Measures the time in milliseconds from navigation timing's navigation start to the time the DOMContentLoaded event is fired, for main frame documents.

metric.name: DocumentTiming.NavigationToLoadEventFired
metric.summary: Measures the time in milliseconds from navigation timing's navigation start to the time the load event is fired, for main frame documents.

metric.name: Experimental.InputToNavigationStart
metric.summary: Measures the time in milliseconds from when the OS level input event occurred which triggered a navigation, until the navigation was started. Only set if the code can trace back to the original input event. Some known cases where it is missing: crbug.com/889223 crbug.com/893162 crbug.com/897837 crbug.com/897840

metric.name: Experimental.Navigation.UserInitiated
metric.summary: True if this navigation was initiated by user input. For renderer navigations, only true if the code can trace back to the original input event. Some known cases where it is missing: crbug.com/889223 crbug.com/897837 crbug.com/897840

metric.name: Experimental.NavigationToInteractive
metric.obsolete: Removed 2/2020. Do not use Time to Interactive as a RUM metric.
metric.summary: Measures Time to Interactive, a metric based on main thread and network heuristics to approximate the point in time when the page feels interactive to the user. See https://goo.gl/TFw6xz for detailed explanation. This histogram uses First Meaningful Paint as the lower bound for quiescent windows. The unit of time is ms.

metric.name: Experimental.PaintTiming.NavigationToFirstMeaningfulPaint
metric.summary: Measures the time in milliseconds from navigation timing's navigation start to the first meaningful paint (http://bit.ly/ttfmp-doc), for main frame documents.

metric.name: Experimental.PaintTiming.NavigationToLargestContentPaint
metric.summary: Measures the time in milliseconds from navigation timing's navigation start to the time when the page first paints the largest content (text or image) within viewport. See http://bit.ly/fcp_plus_plus for more details.

metric.name: Experimental.PaintTiming.NavigationToLargestContentPaintAllFrames
metric.summary: Measures the time in milliseconds from navigation timing's navigation start to the time when the page first paints the largest content (text or image) within viewport. Compared with NavigationToLargestContentPaint, this is the aggregate results from all frames, while NavigationToLargestContentPaint is only for main frame. See http://bit.ly/fcp_plus_plus for more details.

metric.name: Experimental.PaintTiming.NavigationToLargestImagePaint
metric.summary: Measures the time in milliseconds from navigation timing's navigation start to the time when the page first paints the largest image within viewport after the image finishes loading. The value is recorded at the end of each page load. See http://bit.ly/fcp_plus_plus for more details.

metric.name: Experimental.PaintTiming.NavigationToLargestImagePaint.BeforeUserInput
metric.summary: Measures the time in milliseconds from navigation timing's navigation start to the time when the page first paints the largest image within viewport after the image finishes loading, before user input. See http://bit.ly/fcp_plus_plus for more details.

metric.name: Experimental.PaintTiming.NavigationToLargestTextPaint
metric.summary: Measures the time in milliseconds from navigation timing's navigation start to the time when the page first paints the largest text within viewport. The value is recorded at the end of each page load. See http://bit.ly/fcp_plus_plus for more details.

metric.name: Experimental.PaintTiming.NavigationToLargestTextPaint.BeforeUserInput
metric.summary: Measures the time in milliseconds from navigation timing's navigation start to the time when the page first paints the largest text within viewport, before user input. See http://bit.ly/fcp_plus_plus for more details.

metric.name: Experimental.PaintTiming.NavigationToLastImagePaint
metric.obsolete: Deprecated on March 2019. This metric as a page load metric hasn't shown a good correlation with user experience.
metric.summary: Measures the time in milliseconds from navigation timing's navigation start to the time when the page first paints the last image within viewport after the image finishes loading. The value is recorded at the end of each page load. See http://bit.ly/fcp_plus_plus for more details.

metric.name: Experimental.PaintTiming.NavigationToLastTextPaint
metric.obsolete: Deprecated on March 2019. This metric as a page load metric hasn't shown a good correlation with user experience.
metric.summary: Measures the time in milliseconds from navigation timing's navigation start to the time when the page first paints the last Text within viewport. The value is recorded at the end of each page load. See http://bit.ly/fcp_plus_plus for more details.

metric.name: InteractiveTiming.FirstInputDelay
metric.obsolete: Deprecated on January 2019 in favor of InteractiveTiming.FirstInputDelay2, which correctly excludes some scrolling cases that were previously not excluded from this metric.
metric.summary: Measures First Input Delay, the duration between the hardware timestamp and the start of event processing on the main thread for the first meaningful input per navigation. See https://goo.gl/tr1oTZ for a detailed explanation. In ms.

metric.name: InteractiveTiming.FirstInputDelay.SkipFilteringComparison
metric.obsolete: Removed in January 2020 as the experiment is launched.
metric.summary: For comparing FirstInputDelay metrics in the SkipTouchEventFilter experiment. Measures First Input Delay, the duration between the hardware timestamp and the start of event processing on the main thread for the first meaningful input per navigation. See https://goo.gl/tr1oTZ for a detailed explanation. In ms.

metric.name: InteractiveTiming.FirstInputDelay2
metric.obsolete: Removed on February 2019 in favor of InteractiveTiming.FirstInputDelay3 which brings the metric more in line with the EventTiming API.
metric.summary: Measures First Input Delay, the duration between the hardware timestamp and the start of event processing on the main thread for the first meaningful input per navigation. See https://goo.gl/tr1oTZ for a detailed explanation. In ms.

metric.name: InteractiveTiming.FirstInputDelay3
metric.obsolete: Removed in July 2019 in favor of InteractiveTiming.FirstInputDelay4 which includes events which were previously filtered.
metric.summary: Measures First Input Delay, the duration between the hardware timestamp and the start of event processing on the main thread for the first meaningful input per navigation. See https://goo.gl/tr1oTZ for a detailed explanation. In ms.

metric.name: InteractiveTiming.FirstInputDelay4
metric.summary: Measures First Input Delay, the duration between the hardware timestamp and the start of event processing on the main thread for the first meaningful input per navigation. See https://goo.gl/tr1oTZ for a detailed explanation. In ms. Log of major changes: http://bit.ly/chrome-speed-metrics-changelog

metric.name: InteractiveTiming.FirstInputTimestamp
metric.obsolete: Deprecated on January 2019 in favor of InteractiveTiming.FirstInputTimestamp2, which correctly excludes some scrolling cases that were previously not excluded from this metric.
metric.summary: The duration between navigation start and the hardware timestamp of the first meaningful input per navigation. See https://goo.gl/tr1oTZ for a detailed explanation. In ms.

metric.name: InteractiveTiming.FirstInputTimestamp.SkipFilteringComparison
metric.obsolete: Removed in Jaunary 2020 as the experiment is launched.
metric.summary:
The duration between navigation start and the hardware timestamp of the first meaningful input per navigation. See https://goo.gl/tr1oTZ for a detailed explanation. In ms.
This metric is used for comparing FirstInputTimestamp metrics in the SkipTouchEventFilter experiment.

metric.name: InteractiveTiming.FirstInputTimestamp2
metric.obsolete: Removed on February 2019 in favor of InteractiveTiming.FirstInputTimestamp3 which brings the metric more in line with the EventTiming API.
metric.summary: The duration between navigation start and the hardware timestamp of the first meaningful input per navigation. See https://goo.gl/tr1oTZ for a detailed explanation. In ms.

metric.name: InteractiveTiming.FirstInputTimestamp3
metric.obsolete: Removed in July 2019 in favor of InteractiveTiming.FirstInputTimestamp4 which includes events which were previously filtered.
metric.summary: The duration between navigation start and the hardware timestamp of the first meaningful input per navigation. See https://goo.gl/tr1oTZ for a detailed explanation. In ms.

metric.name: InteractiveTiming.FirstInputTimestamp4
metric.summary: The duration between navigation start and the hardware timestamp of the first meaningful input per navigation. See https://goo.gl/tr1oTZ for a detailed explanation. In ms.

metric.name: InteractiveTiming.LongestInputDelay
metric.obsolete: Deprecated on January 2019 in favor of InteractiveTiming.LongestInputDelay2, which correctly excludes some scrolling cases that were previously not excluded from this metric.
metric.summary: Measures longest Input Delay, the longest duration between the hardware timestamp and the start of event processing on the main thread for the meaningful input per navigation. In ms.

metric.name: InteractiveTiming.LongestInputDelay2
metric.obsolete: Removed on February 2019 in favor of InteractiveTiming.LongestInputDelay3 which brings the metric more in line with the EventTiming API.
metric.summary: Measures longest Input Delay, the longest duration between the hardware timestamp and the start of event processing on the main thread for the meaningful input per navigation. In ms.

metric.name: InteractiveTiming.LongestInputDelay3
metric.obsolete: Removed on September 2019 in favor of InteractiveTiming.LongestInputDelay4 which includes events which otherwise would have been filtered.
metric.summary: Measures longest Input Delay, the longest duration between the hardware timestamp and the start of event processing on the main thread for the meaningful input per navigation. In ms.

metric.name: InteractiveTiming.LongestInputDelay4
metric.summary: Measures longest Input Delay, the longest duration between the hardware timestamp and the start of event processing on the main thread for the meaningful input per navigation. In ms.

metric.name: InteractiveTiming.LongestInputTimestamp
metric.obsolete: Deprecated on January 2019 in favor of InteractiveTiming.LongestInputTimestamp2, which correctly excludes some scrolling cases that were previously not excluded from this metric.
metric.summary: The duration between navigation start and the hardware timestamp of the meaningful input with longest queuing delay per navigation. In ms.

metric.name: InteractiveTiming.LongestInputTimestamp2
metric.obsolete: Removed on February 2019 in favor of InteractiveTiming.LongestInputTimestamp3 which brings the metric more in line with the EventTiming API.
metric.summary: The duration between navigation start and the hardware timestamp of the meaningful input with longest queuing delay per navigation. In ms.

metric.name: InteractiveTiming.LongestInputTimestamp3
metric.obsolete: Removed on February 2019 in favor of InteractiveTiming.LongestInputTimestamp4 which includes inputs which would have previously been filtered.
metric.summary: The duration between navigation start and the hardware timestamp of the meaningful input with longest queuing delay per navigation. In ms.

metric.name: InteractiveTiming.LongestInputTimestamp4
metric.summary: The duration between navigation start and the hardware timestamp of the meaningful input with longest queuing delay per navigation. In ms.

metric.name: InteractiveTiming.NumInputEvents
metric.summary: The number of Input Events.

metric.name: InteractiveTiming.TotalAdjustedInputDelay
metric.summary: sum(max(Input Delay - 50, 0)). The Input Delay refers to the duration between the hardware timestamp and the start of event processing on the main thread for the meaningful input. In ms.

metric.name: InteractiveTiming.TotalInputDelay
metric.summary: sum(Input Delay). The Input Delay refers to the duration between the hardware timestamp and the start of event processing on the main thread for the meaningful input. In ms.

metric.name: IsCrossProcessNavigation
metric.summary: Whether the navigation resulted in the main frame being hosted in a different renderer process than the current document or not.

metric.name: IsSignedExchangeInnerResponse
metric.obsolete: Migrated to the PageLoad.SignedExchange event. The presence of that event indicates the associated source was served via signed exchange.
metric.summary: Set to 1 if the main resource is an inner response of a signed exchange.

metric.name: LayoutInstability.CumulativeShiftScore
metric.summary: Measures the cumulative layout shift (bit.ly/lsm-explainer) that has occurred on the page (including all subframes) during the session. This metric's integral value is 100x the fractional cumulative layout shift score described in the explainer. Stable since M79; previous versions are expermental and subject to fluctuation between releases. Log of major changes: http://bit.ly/chrome-speed-metrics-changelog

metric.name: LayoutInstability.CumulativeShiftScore.MainFrame
metric.summary: Measures the cumulative layout shift (bit.ly/lsm-explainer) that has occurred in the main frame during the session. This metric's integral value is 100x the fractional cumulative layout shift score described in the explainer.

metric.name: LayoutInstability.CumulativeShiftScore.MainFrame.BeforeInputOrScroll
metric.summary: Measures the cumulative layout shift (bit.ly/lsm-explainer) that has occurred in the main frame during the session, before any user input or document scroll. This metric's integral value is 100x the fractional cumulative layout shift score described in the explainer.

metric.name: LayoutStability.JankScore
metric.obsolete: Removed July 2019 in favor of LayoutInstability.CumulativeShiftScore.
metric.summary: Measures the amount of layout jank (bit.ly/lsm-explainer) that has occurred on the page (including all subframes) during the session. This metric's integral value is 100x the fractional jank score described in the explainer.

metric.name: LayoutStability.JankScore.MainFrame
metric.summary: Measures the amount of layout jank (bit.ly/lsm-explainer) that has occurred in the main frame during the session. This metric's integral value is 100x the fractional jank score described in the explainer.

metric.name: LayoutStability.JankScore.MainFrame.BeforeInputOrScroll
metric.summary: Measures the amount of layout jank (bit.ly/lsm-explainer) that has occurred in the main frame during the session, before any user input or document scroll. This metric's integral value is 100x the fractional jank score described in the explainer.

metric.name: MainDocumentSequenceNumber
metric.summary: An id for the main frame's document associated with the current navigation. It doesn't change for same-document navigations and when navigating back to the same document. Unique during the browsing session.

metric.name: MainFrameResource.ConnectDelay
metric.summary: The duration between the start of the connection establishment to the end of the connection establishment to the origin of the main frame request. In ms.

metric.name: MainFrameResource.DNSDelay
metric.summary: The duration between the start of the DNS resolution to the end for the origin of the main frame request. In ms.

metric.name: MainFrameResource.HttpProtocolScheme
metric.summary: HTTP Protocol scheme of the connection using which the main frame response was fetched. Recorded as HttpProtocolScheme enum in tools/metrics/histograms/enum.xml.

metric.name: MainFrameResource.NavigationStartToReceiveHeadersStart
metric.summary: The duration from the start of the navigation to the start of the response headers being received. In ms.

metric.name: MainFrameResource.NavigationStartToRequestStart
metric.summary: The duration from the start of the navigation to the start of the main frame request. This includes the time to process any redirects on the main frame request. In ms.

metric.name: MainFrameResource.RedirectCount
metric.summary: The number of main frame redirects that occurred before commit. Unset if there were no redirects.

metric.name: MainFrameResource.RequestStartToReceiveHeadersEnd
metric.summary: The duration from when the request was started to the time when its response headers were received. Recorded only for the main frame request. In ms.

metric.name: MainFrameResource.RequestStartToSendStart
metric.summary: The duration from when the request was started to the time when its request headers were sent. Recorded only for the main frame request. In ms.

metric.name: MainFrameResource.SendStartToReceiveHeadersEnd
metric.summary: The duration from when the request headers were sent to when its response headers were received. Recorded only for the main frame request. In ms.

metric.name: MainFrameResource.SocketReused
metric.summary: True if the socket was reused when establishing connection to the origin of the main frame request.

metric.name: Navigation.PageEndReason
metric.summary: The |page_load_metrics::PageEndReason| for the main frame navigation of this page load.

metric.name: Navigation.PageTransition
metric.summary: The |ui::PageTransition| for the main frame navigation of this page load.

metric.name: NavigationEntryOffset
metric.summary: Difference between the last committed navigation entry index before and after the commit of this navigation.

metric.name: Net.CacheBytes
metric.summary: The total number of body bytes loaded from cache for all resources on the page. This is rounded down to the nearest exponential bucket (with a bucket spacing factor of 1.3). TODO(crbug.com/1058065): Should be obsolete. Deprecated 06/2019 in favor of Net.CacheBytes2. (seems to be used in Clang)

metric.name: Net.CacheBytes2
metric.summary: The total number of body bytes loaded from cache for all resources on the page. This includes the http and memory cache. This is rounded down to the nearest exponential bucket (with a bucket spacing factor of 1.3).

metric.name: Net.DownstreamKbpsEstimate.OnNavigationStart
metric.summary: The downstream throughput (in kilobits per second) for this page load, at the time the navigation for this page load was initiated.

metric.name: Net.EffectiveConnectionType.OnNavigationStart
metric.summary: The |net::EffectiveConnectionType| at the time the navigation for this page load was initiated.

metric.name: Net.EffectiveConnectionType2.OnNavigationStart
metric.summary: The |SystemProfileProto::Network::EffectiveConnectionType| at the time the navigation for this page load was initiated.

metric.name: Net.ErrorCode.OnFailedProvisionalLoad
metric.summary: The |net::Error| code for this page load. Only logged for failed provisional navigations.

metric.name: Net.HttpResponseCode
metric.summary: The HTTP response code (e.g., 200, 404, etc.) associated with the main frame page load.

metric.name: Net.HttpRttEstimate.OnNavigationStart
metric.summary: The HTTP round trip time estimate for this page load, at the time the navigation for this page load was initiated.

metric.name: Net.ImageBytes
metric.summary: The total number of bytes loaded from the network for images on the page. This is rounded down to the nearest exponential bucket (with a bucket spacing factor of 1.3). On mobile this only records bytes up until the page/app is backgrounded.

metric.name: Net.ImageSubframeBytes
metric.summary: The total number of bytes loaded from the network for images on the subframes of the page. This is rounded down to the nearest exponential bucket (with a bucket spacing factor of 1.3). On mobile this only records bytes up until the page/app is backgrounded.

metric.name: Net.JavaScriptBytes
metric.summary: The sum of decoded body lengths of all JavaScript resouces that completed loading on the page. This is rounded down to the nearest exponential bucket (with a bucket spacing factor of 10). On mobile this only records bytes up until the page/app is backgrounded.

metric.name: Net.JavaScriptMaxBytes
metric.summary: The max of decoded body lengths of all JavaScript resouces that completed loading on the page. This is rounded down to the nearest exponential bucket (with a bucket spacing factor of 10). On mobile this only records bytes up until the page/app is backgrounded.

metric.name: Net.MediaBytes
metric.summary: The total number of bytes loaded from the network for media (video, audio) on the page. This is rounded down to the nearest exponential bucket (with a bucket spacing factor of 1.3). On mobile this only records bytes up until the page/app is backgrounded.

metric.name: Net.NetworkBytes
metric.summary: The total number of body bytes loaded from the network for all resources on the page. This is rounded down to the nearest exponential bucket (with a bucket spacing factor of 1.3).

metric.name: Net.NetworkBytes2
metric.summary: The total number of bytes loaded from the network for all resources on the page, including incomplete resources and headers. This is rounded down to the nearest exponential bucket (with a bucket spacing factor of 1.3). On mobile this only records bytes up until the page/app is backgrounded.

metric.name: Net.TransportRttEstimate.OnNavigationStart
metric.summary: The transport round trip time estimate for this page load, at the time the navigation for this page load was initiated.

metric.name: PageTiming.ForegroundDuration
metric.summary: For page loads that start in the foreground, measures the duration of time in milliseconds until one of the following events occurs: the load of the main resource fails, the page load is stopped, the tab hosting the page is closed, the render process hosting the page goes away, a new navigation which later commits is initiated in the same tab, or the tab hosting the page is backgrounded. This metric has a very long tail, for pages that spend a long period of time in the foreground. As such, use of the mean or tail values are not recommended.

metric.name: PageTiming.NavigationToFailedProvisionalLoad
metric.summary: Measures the time in milliseconds from navigation timing's navigation start to the time the provisional load failed. Only measures provisional loads that failed in the foreground.

metric.name: PaintTiming.NavigationToFirstContentfulPaint
metric.summary: Measures the time in milliseconds from navigation timing's navigation start to the time when the page first paints content. A contentful paint includes a paint of text, image, SVG, or canvas. Log of major changes: http://bit.ly/chrome-speed-metrics-changelog

metric.name: PaintTiming.NavigationToFirstPaint
metric.summary: Measures the time in milliseconds from navigation timing's navigation start to the time the first paint is performed.

metric.name: PaintTiming.NavigationToLargestContentfulPaint
metric.summary: Measures the time in milliseconds from navigation timing's navigation start to the time when the page first paints the largest content (text or image) within viewport, across all frames. See http://bit.ly/fcp_plus_plus for more details. Stable since M79; previous versions are experimental and subject to fluctuation between releases. Log of major changes: http://bit.ly/chrome-speed-metrics-changelog

metric.name: PaintTiming.NavigationToLargestContentfulPaint.MainFrame
metric.summary: Measures the time in milliseconds from navigation timing's navigation start to the time when the page first paints the largest content (text or image) within viewport, in the main frame. See http://bit.ly/fcp_plus_plus for more details.

metric.name: ParseTiming.NavigationToParseStart
metric.summary: Measures the time in milliseconds from navigation timing's navigation start to the time the parser started, for main frame documents.

metric.name: SiteEngagementScore
metric.summary: Measures the Site Engagement Score for the commited URL rounded to the nearest 10.

metric.name: ThirdPartyCookieBlockingEnabledForSite
metric.summary: Records whether third party cookie blocking was enabled for a site. Only recorded for users who enabled the cookie controls ui.

metric.name: WasCached
metric.summary: Set to 1 if the main resource was served from cache.

event.name: PageLoad.FromGoogleSearch
event.summary: Recorded for page loads that were navigated to via Google Search.

event.name: PageLoad.ServiceWorkerControlled
event.summary: Recorded for page loads controlled by a service worker.

event.name: PageLoad.SignedExchange
event.summary: Recorded for page loads which main resource is an inner response of a signed exchange.

metric.name: ServedFromGoogleCache
metric.summary: Set to 1 if the main resource was served from Google's cache server.

event.name: PageLoadCapping
event.summary: Metrics related to PageLoadCapping that are recorded using the same UKM IDs as PageLoad.

metric.name: FinalState
metric.summary: Set to 1 when the InfoBar was shown, but not acted upon. Set to 2 when the page was paused, but not resumed. Set to 3 when the page was resumed. If the InfoBar was not shown, this metrics is not recorded.

event.name: PageWithPassword
event.summary: Metrics about websites that contain password forms and the user's interactions with them. No events are created for pages that don't contain password forms.

metric.name: FormManagerAvailable
metric.summary: Records whether Chrome was sufficiently aware of forms during various stages of saving a credential on the site, or whether saving was aborted due to absence of the corresponding form manager. Values correspond to the enum PasswordManagerMetricsRecorder::FormManagerAvailable.

metric.name: PageLevelUserAction
metric.summary: Records if the user interacts with the password manager in a way that cannot (reliably) be attributed to a specific PasswordFormManager. Values correspond to the enum PasswordManagerMetricsRecorder::PageLevelUserAction.

metric.name: ProvisionalSaveFailure
metric.summary: Records a provisional save failure in case the password manager cannot offer to save a credential. Recorded values correspond to the enum PasswordManagerMetricsRecorder::ProvisionalSaveFailure.

metric.name: UserModifiedPasswordField
metric.summary: Records a 1 for every page on which a user has modified a password text field - regardless of how many password fields a page contains or the user modifies.

event.name: PaintPreviewCapture
event.summary: Metrics related to the performance of capturing Paint Previews.

metric.name: BlinkCaptureTime
metric.summary: The amount of time spent painting in Blink to record a Paint Preview of the main frame.

metric.name: CompressedOnDiskSize
metric.summary: The compressed on-disk size in KB of the captured artifacts. This is rounded down to the nearest exponential bucket (with a bucket ratio of 1.3).

event.name: PasswordForm
event.summary: Metrics about password forms on websites and the user's interactions with them. A separate event is generated for each password form discovered on a site.

metric.name: Context.FormSignature
metric.summary: Records a low entropy hash of the form signature in order to be able to distinguish two forms on the same site.

metric.name: DynamicFormChanges
metric.summary: Records a bitmask of password form changes after the first time this form is seen by Password Manager. Recorded once per a form when the form is removed from DOM. Bit 0 - changes in number of fields, bit 1 - changes in fields renderer ids, bit 2 - changes in autocomplete attributes, bit 3 - changes in form control types.

metric.name: Fill.FirstFillingResultInRenderer
metric.summary:
Records whether the PasswordAutofillAgent in the renderer manages to fill credentials as instructed by the browser or records a failure reason otherwise. Only the outcome of the first attempt to fill is recorded.
This is replicated as PasswordManager.FirstFillingResultInRenderer in UMA.

metric.name: Fill.FirstWaitForUsernameReason
metric.summary:
This metric records why the browser instructs the renderer not to fill the credentials on page load but to wait for the user to confirm the credential to be filled. Only the value of the first decision to fill is recorded.
This is replicated as PasswordManager.FirstWaitForUsernameReason in UMA.

metric.name: FillOnLoad
metric.summary: Deprecated in November 2018, because the decision this metric supported was made. Records the comparison of the old and new decision about filling a form on load. Should only be logged for fillig with non-PSL matched credentials, in non-Incognito mode. Values are from password_manager::PasswordFormMetricsRecorder::FillOnLoad.

metric.name: Generation.GeneratedPassword
metric.summary: Records '1' if the user has generated a password on this form.

metric.name: Generation.GeneratedPasswordModified
metric.summary: Records '1' if the user has modified a generated a password on this form.

metric.name: Generation.PopupShown
metric.summary: Records a PasswordFormMetricsRecorder::PasswordGenerationPopupShown entry if (and only if) a popup was shown.

metric.name: Generation.SpecPriority
metric.summary: Reports the priority of a PasswordGenerationRequirementsSpec for a generated password. This can be used for debugging as a 0 means that no spec was used, a 10 means that the spec came from autofill and was crowd sourced, a 20 means that it was overridden per domain and a 30 means that is was overridden for the form.

metric.name: ManagerFill.Action
metric.summary: Records for each password form (and HTTP auth), whether the password manager has filled/provided credentials. Recorded values correspond to the enum ManagerAutofillEvent.

metric.name: ManagerFill.Assistance
metric.summary:
Records for each successful submission the degree to which the user has been assisted by the password manager.
This is replicated as PasswordManager.FillingAssistance in UMA.

metric.name: ParsingComparison
metric.summary: Records comparison result of old and new password form parsing algorithms. Metric is recorded on a password form detection. Recorded values correspond to the enum password_manager::PasswordFormMetricsRecorder::ParsingComparisonResult.

metric.name: ParsingOnSavingDifference
metric.summary: Records the comparison of the old and new password form parsing for saving. Multiple values from the password_manager::PasswordFormMetricsRecorder::ParsingOnSavingDifference bitmask can be combined.

metric.name: ReadonlyWhenFilling
metric.summary: Records the readonly status encoded with parsing success after parsing for filling. The |value| is constructed as follows: The least significant bit says whether parsing succeeded (1) or not (0). The rest, shifted by one bit to the right is the FormDataParser::ReadonlyPasswordFields representation of the readonly status.

metric.name: ReadonlyWhenSaving
metric.summary: Records the readonly status encoded with parsing success after parsing for creating pending credentials. The |value| is constructed the same way as for ReadonlyWhenFilling.

metric.name: Saving.Prompt.Interaction
metric.summary: Records how the user interacted with a saving prompt. Recorded values correspond to the enum PasswordFormMetricsRecorder::BubbleDismissalReason.

metric.name: Saving.Prompt.Shown
metric.summary: Records, for each password form seen by the password manager, whether the user was shown a prompt that asked for permission to save new credentials. In case a store() via the Credential Management API, a virtual password form is created, for which this metric is recorded. Recorded values are 0 and 1 for false and true.

metric.name: Saving.Prompt.Trigger
metric.summary: Records the trigger of each password save bubble that was shown to the user to ask for permission to save new credentials. Recorded values correspond to the enum PasswordFormMetricsRecorder::BubbleTrigger.

metric.name: Saving.ShowedManualFallbackForSaving
metric.summary: Records if a manual fallback for saving option was shown to the user (on Android this is recorded, even though the UI does not exist at the moment). This is a bit mask. 1 means a prompt was shown, 2 means the prompt was due to a generated password, 4 means the prompt was due to an update.

metric.name: Submission.Indicator
metric.summary: Records the event that led the password manager to believe the submission was successful. Metrics is recorded only when the password is saved. Recorded values correspond to the enum autofill::mojom::SubmissionIndicatorEvent.

metric.name: Submission.Observed
metric.summary: Records whether a submission of a password form has been observered. The values 0 and 1 correspond to false and true respectively.

metric.name: Submission.SubmissionResult
metric.summary: Records the outcome of a password form submission. The values are numbered according to PasswordFormMetricsRecorder::SubmitResult. Note that no metric is recorded for kSubmitResultNotSubmitted.

metric.name: Submission.SubmittedFormType
metric.summary: Records the classification of a form at submission time. The values correspond to PasswordFormMetricsRecorder::SubmittedFormType. Note that no metric is recorded for kSubmittedFormTypeUnspecified.

metric.name: SuppressedAccount.Generated.HTTPSNotHTTP
metric.summary: Records, for each password form seen by the password manager, whether there were `suppressed` credentials, meaning stored credentials that were not filled, that were suppressed because they were stored for an HTTPS origin while the password form was seen on an HTTP origin. If there were such credentials, the histogram also records whether the username and password of such suppressed credentials matched those submitted. This recording happens only for credentials that were originally auto-generated (as opposed to user typed). Recorded values correspond to the enum SuppressedAccountExistence.

metric.name: SuppressedAccount.Generated.PSLMatching
metric.summary: Records, for each password form seen by the password manager, whether there were `suppressed` credentials, meaning stored credentials that were not filled, that were suppressed because they were for an origin that was only PSL-matching the origin of the observed form (see the suffix description for the possible classes of such near-matches). If there were such credentials, the histogram also records whether the username and password of such suppressed credentials matched those submitted. This recording happens only for credentials that were originally auto-generated (as opposed to user typed). Recorded values correspond to the enum SuppressedAccountExistence.

metric.name: SuppressedAccount.Generated.SameOrganizationName
metric.summary: Records, for each password form seen by the password manager, whether there were `suppressed` credentials, meaning stored credentials that were not filled, that were suppressed because they were for an origin that was only matching the visited origin if the TLD is stripped. If there were such credentials, the histogram also records whether the username and password of such suppressed credentials matched those submitted. This recording happens only for credentials that were originally auto-generated (as opposed to user typed). Recorded values correspond to the enum SuppressedAccountExistence.

metric.name: SuppressedAccount.Manual.HTTPSNotHTTP
metric.summary: Records, for each password form seen by the password manager, whether there were `suppressed` credentials, meaning stored credentials that were not filled, that were suppressed because they were stored for an HTTPS origin while the password form was seen on an HTTP origin. If there were such credentials, the histogram also records whether the username and password of such suppressed credentials matched those submitted. This recording happens only for credentials that were originally entered by the user (as opposed to auto-generated). Recorded values correspond to the enum SuppressedAccountExistence.

metric.name: SuppressedAccount.Manual.PSLMatching
metric.summary: Records, for each password form seen by the password manager, whether there were `suppressed` credentials, meaning stored credentials that were not filled, that were suppressed because they were for an origin that was only PSL-matching the origin of the observed form (see the suffix description for the possible classes of such near-matches). If there were such credentials, the histogram also records whether the username and password of such suppressed credentials matched those submitted. This recording happens only for credentials that were originally entered by the user (as opposed to auto-generated). Recorded values correspond to the enum SuppressedAccountExistence.

metric.name: SuppressedAccount.Manual.SameOrganizationName
metric.summary: Records, for each password form seen by the password manager, whether there were `suppressed` credentials, meaning stored credentials that were not filled, that were suppressed because they were for an origin that was only matching the visited origin if the TLD is stripped. If there were such credentials, the histogram also records whether the username and password of such suppressed credentials matched those submitted. This recording happens only for credentials that were originally entered by the user (as opposed to auto-generated). Recorded values correspond to the enum SuppressedAccountExistence.

metric.name: Updating.Prompt.Interaction
metric.summary: Records how the user interacted with an updating prompt. Recorded values correspond to the enum PasswordFormMetricsRecorder::BubbleDismissalReason.

metric.name: Updating.Prompt.Shown
metric.summary: Records, for each password form seen by the password manager, whether the user was shown a prompt that asked for permission to update existing credentials. Recorded values are 0 and 1 for false and true.

metric.name: Updating.Prompt.Trigger
metric.summary: Records the trigger of each password update bubble that was shown to the user to ask for permission to update existing credentials. Recorded values correspond to the enum PasswordFormMetricsRecorder::BubbleTrigger.

metric.name: User.Action
metric.obsolete: Deprecated. Use new user actions ("User.Action....") instead.
metric.summary: Records what the user does with all UI entry points of the password manager UI, like bubbles, context menus, forms, form fields, etc. in relation to a given form. Recorded values correspond to the enum PasswordFormMetricsRecorder::DetailedUserAction. In contrast to User.ActionSimplified, this metric is intended to be extended over time.

metric.name: User.Action.CorrectedUsernameInForm
metric.summary: Counts how many times the user corrected a username in a password form. This is only populated if events happened.

metric.name: User.Action.EditedUsernameInBubble
metric.summary: Counts how many times the user edited a username in a password save/update bubble. This is only populated if events happened.

metric.name: User.Action.SelectedDifferentPasswordInBubble
metric.summary: Counts how many times the user selected a different password in a save/update bubble. This is only populated if events happened.

metric.name: User.Action.TriggeredManualFallbackForSaving
metric.summary: Counts how many times the user triggered the manual fallback for password saving. This is only populated if events happened.

metric.name: User.Action.TriggeredManualFallbackForUpdating
metric.summary: Counts how many times the user triggered the manual fallback for password updating. This is only populated if events happened.

metric.name: User.ActionSimplified
metric.summary: Records what the user does with a form. Recorded values correspond to the enum password_manager::UserAction.

event.name: PaymentApp.CheckoutEvents
event.summary: Records checkout events as well as completion status for the invoked payment app when its origin is shown inside the payment handler modal window. This metric uses the specific PAYMENT_APP_ID ukm_source_id which is generated from the app's origin.

metric.name: CompletionStatus
metric.summary: How the Payment Request ended. This metric will only get recorded if a non-autofill payment app gets invoked to handle the request.

metric.name: Events
metric.summary: Bitfield representing the events that occurred during the Payment Request. This metric will only get recorded if a non-autofill payment app gets invoked to handle the request. Values defined in the Event enum of components/payments/core/journey_logger.h.

metric.name: CompletionStatus
metric.summary: How the Payment Request ended. Values defined in the CompletionStatus enum of components/payments/core/journey_logger.h.

metric.name: Events
metric.summary: Bitfield representing the events that occurred during the Payment Request. Values defined in the Event enum of components/payments/core/journey_logger.h.

metric.name: Category
metric.summary: Tranaction size can be zero, micro, or regular. Values defined in the TransactionSize enum of components/payments/core/journey_logger.h.

metric.name: CompletionStatus
metric.summary: Whether the transaction has been triggered or completed.

event.name: Pepper.Broker
event.summary: Event recorded when a flash instance connects to the broker, resulting in a channel being opened to the broker process.

event.name: PeriodicBackgroundSyncEventCompleted
event.summary: A website can register to periodically update itself in the background using a service worker. Updates can be done in response to the periodicsync event. Logged when a periodicsync event completes and returns a status. We collect information about retries of this event.

metric.name: MaxAttempts
metric.summary: Integer value of the maximum number of allowed retries.

metric.name: NumAttempts
metric.summary: Integer value of the number of retries / sync events dispatched.

metric.name: Status
metric.summary: The enum value of the completion status, defined in blink::ServiceWorkerStatusCode.

event.name: PeriodicBackgroundSyncRegistered
event.summary: A website can register to periodically update itself in the background using a service worker. Updates can be done in response to the periodicsync event after a periodic Background Sync registration has been created. Logged when a periodic Background Sync registration is created. We collect information about this registration request.

metric.name: IsReregistered
metric.summary: Boolean for whether a registration with this tag has already been created.

metric.name: MinIntervalMs
metric.summary: Integer value of the minimum interval, in milliseconds, of periodicsync events requested by the origin for this registration. This number is exponentially bucketed and uses the UKM GetExponentialBucketMin method with a value of 2.0 for spacing.

event.name: Permission
event.summary: Metrics for a user's permission actions, logged when a permission prompt is resolved or when a permission is revoked. Grouped (microphone+camera) permission prompts are reported separately.

metric.name: Action
metric.summary: An enum of type PermissionAction. One of GRANTED, DENIED, DISMISSED or IGNORED.

metric.name: Gesture
metric.summary: An enum of type PermissionRequestGestureType, whether the prompt was initiated by a user gesture.

metric.name: PermissionType
metric.summary: An enum of type ContentSettingsType.

metric.name: PriorDismissals
metric.summary: The number of dismissed prompts for the given (origin, permission) pair, capped at 10 dismissals.

metric.name: PriorIgnores
metric.summary: The number of ignored prompts for the given (origin, permission) pair, capped at 10 ignores.

metric.name: PromptDisposition
metric.summary: An enum of type PermissionPromptDisposition. The UI used to display a permission prompt, if any.

metric.name: Source
metric.summary: An enum of type PermissionSourceUI. The UI surface for this action.

event.name: Plugins.FlashInstance
event.summary: Recorded when a Flash object instance is created.

event.name: Popup.Closed
event.summary: A popup window was closed.

metric.name: EngagementTime
metric.summary: The time (in ms, rounded down to the nearest power of 2) a popup WebContents is visible / foregrounded, until it is closed. Keyed by the popup opener's URL (not the URL of the popup).

metric.name: NumActivationInteractions
metric.summary: Integer value representing how many mouse down, touch start user, or raw key down interactions the popup had. This is capped at 50.

metric.name: NumGestureScrollBeginInteractions
metric.summary: Integer value representing how many gesture scroll begin user interactions the popup had. This is capped at 50.

metric.name: NumInteractions
metric.summary: Integer value representing how many user interactions the popup had. This is capped at 100. See IsUserInteractionInputType in web_contents_impl for what an interaction is. Currently it is a mouse, scroll begin, touch start, or raw key down event.

metric.name: SafeBrowsingStatus
metric.summary: The site's safe browsing status if the pop-up's navigation commits.

metric.name: Trusted
metric.summary: Boolean value representing whether the popup was opened via some trusted event (e.g. context menu, ctrl-click, etc).

metric.name: UserInitiatedClose
metric.summary: Boolean value to represent whether the popup was closed by user gesture.

metric.name: WindowOpenDisposition
metric.summary: The UI window open disposition used when creating the web contents of the pop-up. Set by the browser process when the pop up tracker is created.

event.name: Popup.Page
event.summary: Page level pop-up statistics.

metric.name: Allowed
metric.summary: Whether a user has, explicitly, allowed all popups on the last committed url of a page. The user's site level popup content setting is queried when a page that opened a popup is destroyed. Only emitted when at least one popup has been opened and the last committed page url is valid.

event.name: PrefetchProxy
event.summary: Metrics related to the privacy-preserving prefetch proxy. Recorded only for Lite mode (AKA Data Saver) users.

metric.name: count_css_js_loaded_cache_before_fcp
metric.summary: The number of CSS or JS files that were loaded from the cache before first contentful paint, with a maximum of 10. Always set when this event is recorded.

metric.name: count_css_js_loaded_network_before_fcp
metric.summary: The number of CSS or JS files that were loaded from the network before FCP, with a maximum of 10. Always set when this event is recorded.

metric.name: days_since_last_visit_to_origin
metric.summary: The number of days since the user has last visited any page on this origin, either during a redirect or a committed page. Records -1 if the origin has never been visited before. Metrics for origins that have been visited before are capped at 180 then exponentially bucketed into 10 buckets with values (1,2,3,5,9,15,25,42,70,119). Only set when a query result was received from the history service before event recording.

metric.name: mainpage_request_had_cookies
metric.summary: A boolean indicating if any mainpage request in the redirect chain or committed request had cookies set on it. Only set when a query result was received from the cookie manager before event recording.

metric.name: ordered_eligible_pages_bitmask
metric.summary: Which links on the Google Search Page were eligible to be prefetched where the Nth-LSB is set if the Nth page is eligible.

metric.name: prefetch_attempted_count
metric.summary: The number of pages on the Google Search Result Page that were attempted to be prefetched.

metric.name: prefetch_eligible_count
metric.summary: The number of pages on the Google Search Result page that were eligible to be prefetched.

metric.name: prefetch_successful_count
metric.summary: The number of pages on the Google Search Result Page that were successfully prefetched.

metric.name: prefetch_usage
metric.summary: This enum records if a cached prefetch page was used, and its probe status, when the user navigates off the Google Search Result Page. Not set if there was no prefetch. Values: Prefetch used, no probe = 0. Prefetch used, successful probe = 1. Prefetch not used, failed probe = 2.

event.name: PrefetchProxy.AfterSRPClick
event.summary: Metrics related to the privacy-preserving prefetch proxy on the page load after the SRP. Recorded only for eligible users on the first mainframe user-initiated page load immediately after a Google Search Result Page (SRP) which Chrome parsed and may have prefetched links.

metric.name: ClickedLinkSRPPosition
metric.summary: When a user clicks on a Google SRP link, this int records which position the clicked link was in. Recorded only when the user navigates to a Google SRP link.

metric.name: ProbeLatencyMs
metric.summary: How long the network probe blocked commit in milliseconds. Recorded only when a probe was required.

metric.name: SRPClickPrefetchStatus
metric.summary: The outcome of the prefetch eligibility check and possible attempt to prefetch the resource. The prefetched url is always the committed URL of the page. See |IsolatedPrerenderTabHelper.PrefetchStatus| for a mapping of enum values and their meanings.

metric.name: SRPPrefetchEligibleCount
metric.summary: The number of links from the SRP page (the previous page load) that were eligible for prefetch. Always set when this event is recorded.

event.name: Previews
event.summary: Previews related metrics associated with a page load. See //components/previews/.

metric.name: client_lofi
metric.summary: Set to 1 when a user is shown a client lo-fi image in a page load.

metric.name: coin_flip_result
metric.obsolete: Replaced by the PreviewsCoinFlip event in M78.
metric.summary: Set to 0 if there was no attempted preview for this page load, or the coin flip holdback is disabled in this session. Set to 1 if a preview was attempted and was allowed to proceed by the coin flip. Set to 2 if a preview would have been attempted but was held back by the coin flip. Note that a non-zero value in this field implies previews_likely.

metric.name: defer_all_script
metric.summary: Set to 1 when a user is shown a DeferAllScript preview on a page load.

metric.name: defer_all_script_eligibility_reason
metric.summary: Set to the value of the last known reason a DeferAllScript preview was not eligible on this page load. The value of this metric corresponds to the PreviewsEligibilityReason enum. This metric is only set when it is non-zero.

metric.name: lite_page
metric.summary: Set to 1 when a user is shown a lite page in page load.

metric.name: lite_page_redirect
metric.summary: Set to 1 when a user is shown a lite page redirect in page load.

metric.name: lite_page_redirect_eligibility_reason
metric.summary: Set to the value of the last known reason a Lite Page Redirect preview was not eligible on this page load. The value of this metric corresponds to the PreviewsEligibilityReason enum. This metric is only set when it is non-zero.

metric.name: navigation_restart_penalty
metric.summary: Set to the number of milliseconds spent restarting navigations when a Lite Page Redirect preview is attempted, whether or not it is committed, during the page load.

metric.name: noscript
metric.summary: Set to 1 when a user is shown a NoScript preview on a page load.

metric.name: noscript_eligibility_reason
metric.summary: Set to the value of the last known reason a NoScript preview was not eligible on this page load. The value of this metric corresponds to the PreviewsEligibilityReason enum. This metric is only set when it is non-zero.

metric.name: offline_eligibility_reason
metric.summary: Set to the value of the last known reason an Offline preview was not eligible on this page load. The value of this metric corresponds to the PreviewsEligibilityReason enum. This metric is only set when it is non-zero.

metric.name: offline_preview
metric.summary: Set to 1 when a user is shown an offline preview page in page load.

metric.name: opt_out
metric.summary: Set to 1 when a user clicks "Show Original" on a preview page load using the infobar. Set to 2 when a user opts out of a Preview using the omnibox.

metric.name: origin_opt_out
metric.summary: Set to 1 when previews were enabled but no preview was attempted because the origin provided a Cache-Control:no-transform header in the main frame response. This is a directive from the origin to not perform any transformation so in the context of the Previews feature, it is an opt-out by the origin site (rather than the user).

metric.name: previews_likely
metric.summary: Set to 1 when a preview will be attempted for this page load. Otherwise this is not set. This does not imply that a preview will be committed, only that one will be attempted. This is set to 1 even if this page load is impacted by the coin flip holdback.

metric.name: proxy_lite_page_eligibility_reason
metric.summary: Set to the value of the last known reason a Data Reduction Proxy Lite Page preview was not eligible on this page load. The value of this metric corresponds to the PreviewsEligibilityReason enum. This metric is only set when it is non-zero.

metric.name: resource_loading_hints
metric.summary: Set to 1 when a user is shown a resource loading hints based preview on a page load.

metric.name: resource_loading_hints_eligibility_reason
metric.summary: Set to the value of the last known reason a Resource Loading Hints preview was not eligible on this page load. The value of this metric corresponds to the PreviewsEligibilityReason enum. This metric is only set when it is non-zero.

metric.name: save_data_enabled
metric.summary: Set to 1 if the data saver feature was enabled in Chrome at the time of the page commit.

metric.name: server_lofi
metric.summary: Set to 1 when a user is shown a server lo-fi image in a page load.

event.name: PreviewsCoinFlip

metric.name: coin_flip_result
metric.summary: Set to 0 if there was no attempted preview for this page load, or the coin flip holdback is disabled in this session. Set to 1 if a preview was attempted and was allowed to proceed by the coin flip. Set to 2 if a preview would have been attempted but was held back by the coin flip. Note that a non-zero value in this field implies previews_likely.

event.name: PreviewsDeferAllScript
event.summary: Metrics associated with the intervention of deferring the execution of synchronous script (typically due to a DeferAllScript Preview). This is recorded when the HTML parsing of a mainframe has completed.

metric.name: force_deferred_scripts_mainframe
metric.summary: The total number of mainframe scripts (inline and external) whose execution was force deferred (i.e., that otherwise would have been render blocking).

metric.name: force_deferred_scripts_mainframe_external
metric.summary: The total number of mainframe external scripts whose execution was force deferred (i.e., that otherwise would have been render blocking).

event.name: PreviewsResourceLoadingHints

metric.name: blocked_high_priority
metric.summary: The number of high priority resource requests that were blocked by the resource loading hints based preview while the URL's document was loading.

metric.name: blocked_low_priority
metric.summary: The number of low priority resource requests that were blocked by the resource loading hints based preview while the URL's document was loading.

metric.name: blocked_medium_priority
metric.summary: The number of medium priority resource requests that were blocked by the resource loading hints based preview while the URL's document was loading.

metric.name: blocked_very_high_priority
metric.summary: The number of very high priority resource requests that were blocked by the resource loading hints based preview while the URL's document was loading.

metric.name: blocked_very_low_priority
metric.summary: The number of very low priority resource requests that were blocked by the resource loading hints based preview while the URL's document was loading.

metric.name: patterns_to_block_total
metric.summary: The total number of patterns to block included in the resource loading hints based preview.

metric.name: patterns_to_block_used
metric.summary: The number of patterns that blocked at least one resource request in the resource loading hints based preview while the URL's document was loading.

event.name: PublicImageCompressionDataUse
event.summary: Records coverage metrics for https image compression. The network data use of images is recorded with breakdown of whether the image was compressible by redirecting to optimized version, or if not the reason for its ineligblity is recorded. The bytes are rounded down to the exponential bucket with factor of 1.3.

metric.name: CompressibleImageBytes
metric.summary: Total image bytes that can be compressed, by redirecting to optimized versions to save data.

metric.name: IneligibleImageHintsUnavailableAndMissingInHintsBytes
metric.summary: Total bytes of images that were ineligible to be compressed due to the image hint list was not retrieved in time before the image fetch started, and the image URL was not in the hint list as well, which finished fetching later.

metric.name: IneligibleImageHintsUnavailableButCompressibleBytes
metric.summary: Total bytes of images that were ineligible to be compressed due to the image hint list was not retrieved in time before the image fetch started, but the image URL was found in the hint list, which finished fetching later.

metric.name: IneligibleImageHintsUnavailableBytes
metric.summary: Total bytes of images that were ineligible to be compressed due to the image hint list was not retrieved within within certain time limit of navigation start.

metric.name: IneligibleMissingInImageHintsBytes
metric.summary: Total bytes of images that were ineligible to be compressed due to the image URL not exist in the image hint list.

metric.name: IneligibleOtherImageBytes
metric.summary: Total bytes of images that were ineligible to be compressed due to other reasons not listed here, such as subframe images, non img element, javascript initiated image, etc.

event.name: PWA.Visit
event.summary: PWA usage metrics recorded during a user's interaction with the site.

metric.name: LaunchSource
metric.summary: Launch source of the WebAPK (tap from homescreen, WebShareTarget, deeplink, etc).

metric.name: WebAPKableSiteVisit
metric.summary: Recorded every time a non-installed "WebAPKable" site is visited.

event.name: ReaderModeActivated
event.summary: Recorded after a user activates Reader Mode for a given page.

metric.name: ActivatedViaOmnibox
metric.summary: Whether the user activated Reader Mode via the omnibox badge.

event.name: ReaderModeReceivedDistillability
event.summary: Recorded when the Reader Mode badge receives a result from the distillability service.

metric.name: IsPageDistillable
metric.summary: Whether the distillability service determined the page to be distillable, i.e. likely to render well in Reader Mode.

event.name: RendererSchedulerTask
event.summary: Sampled task from the renderer main thread. Sample rate is controlled dynamically. See blink::scheduler::MainThreadSchedulerImpl::ShouldRecordTaskUkm.

metric.name: FrameStatus
metric.summary: Frame status of the frame associated with the context of this task. See blink::scheduler::FrameStatus for the values of this enum.

metric.name: IsOOPIF
metric.summary: Whether the frame which the task is associated with is an out-of-process iframe. Boolean encoded as an integer (0/1).

metric.name: PageSchedulers
metric.summary: Number of page schedulers in this process. If the value equals one, global per-process tasks can be attributed to the URL.

metric.name: QueueType
metric.summary: Type of the task queue which this task was posted to. See blink::scheduler::MainThreadTaskQueue::TaskType for the values of this enum.

metric.name: RendererAudible
metric.summary: Whether renderer was playing audio when this task was completed. Boolean, encoded as an integer (0/1).

metric.name: RendererBackgrounded
metric.summary: Whether renderer was backgrounded when this task was completed. Boolean, encoded as an integer (0/1).

metric.name: RendererHidden
metric.summary: Whether renderer was hidden when this task was completed. Boolean, encoded as an integer (0/1).

metric.name: SecondsSinceBackgrounded
metric.summary: Seconds since the renderer was backgrounded, recorded when the task was completed. Only set if the renderer is backgrounded.

metric.name: TaskCPUDuration
metric.summary: CPU duration of this task in microseconds.

metric.name: TaskDuration
metric.summary: Duration of this task in microseconds.

metric.name: TaskType
metric.summary: blink::TaskType for the current task.

metric.name: ThreadType
metric.summary: blink::ThreadType for the thread the current task was executed on.

metric.name: UseCase
metric.summary: MainThreadSchedulerImpl's UseCase when this task was completed. See blink::scheduler::UseCase for the values of this enum.

metric.name: Version
metric.summary: The version of this metric, which is used to track the actual set of values present across different builds and channels. Hardcoded into the binary and incremented each time a new field is added or existing is changed. Integer.

event.name: ResponsivenessMeasurement
event.summary: Responsiveness metrics recorded once every 5 seconds.

metric.name: ExpectedTaskQueueingDuration
metric.summary: Duration in MS for expected task queueing duration. The metric reflects the responsiveness of a tab. A lower value means the tab will respond to inputs faster. This metric is equal to RendererScheduler.ExpectedTaskQueueingDuration of the main frame process.

metric.name: SameSiteContextWithSchemes
metric.obsolete: Removed Apr 2020 as this metric doesn't capture the correct information. https://crbug.com/1066231
metric.summary: An enum that records the type of same-site context if a cookie marked with SameSite=Lax or SameSite=Strict is sent across schemes on a request. E.x.: An http site making a request to an https site.

metric.name: SameSiteContextWithSchemes
metric.obsolete: Removed Apr 2020 as this metric doesn't capture the correct information. https://crbug.com/1066231
metric.summary: An enum that records the type of same-site context if a cookie marked with SameSite=Lax or SameSite=Strict is set across schemes on a response. E.x.: An http site returning a response to an https site.

metric.name: RequestPerCookie
metric.summary: An enum which records the type of schemeful same-site downgrade applied to a cookie which is being sent on a request along with the secureness of the origin the cookie is attempting to be sent to. This is recorded once per cookie when the cookie is included in the request or if the cookie excluded due to insufficent same-site context only. Cookies that meet the above conditions but without a downgrade warning are not recorded.

metric.name: ResponsePerCookie
metric.summary: An enum which records the type of schemeful same-site downgrade applied to a cookie which is being set by a response along with the secureness of the origin that is attempting to set the cookie. This is recorded once per cookie when the cookie is allowed to be set or if the cookie is ignored due to insufficent same-site context only. Cookies that meet the above conditions but without a downgrade warning are not recorded.

event.name: ScreenBrightness
event.summary: Collects metrics periodically and on screen brightness change.

metric.name: BatteryPercent
metric.summary: Percentage of battery, rounded down to a multiple of 5%, i.e. [0, 5%) is mapped to 0, [5%, 10%) is mapped to 5 etc.

metric.name: Brightness
metric.summary: Screen percentage brightness. between 0 and 100.

metric.name: DayOfWeek
metric.summary: An enum representing the of the week that the data was logged, defined in |chromeos::power::ml::ScreenBrightness::Features::ActivityData:: DayOfWeek|.

metric.name: DeviceMode
metric.summary: An enum representing the mode of the device, defined in |chromeos::power::ml::ScreenBrightness::Feature::EnvData:DeviceMode|

metric.name: HourOfDay
metric.summary: The hour of the day when the data is logged. Hours since midnight in the local time zone.

metric.name: IsAutoclickEnabled
metric.summary: Boolean value to represent whether the auto click is currently enabled.

metric.name: IsBrailleDisplayConnected
metric.summary: Boolean value to represent whether the braille display is currently enabled.

metric.name: IsCaretHighlightEnabled
metric.summary: Boolean value to represent whether the caret highlight is currently enabled.

metric.name: IsCursorHighlightEnabled
metric.summary: Boolean value to represent whether the cursor highlight is currently enabled.

metric.name: IsFocusHighlightEnabled
metric.summary: Boolean value to represent whether the focus highlight is currently enabled.

metric.name: IsHighContrastEnabled
metric.summary: Boolean value to represent whether the high contrast is currently enabled.

metric.name: IsLargeCursorEnabled
metric.summary: Boolean value to represent whether the large cursor is currently enabled.

metric.name: IsMagnifierEnabled
metric.summary: Boolean value to represent whether the full screen magnifier is currently enabled.

metric.name: IsMonoAudioEnabled
metric.summary: Boolean value to represent whether the mono audio is currently enabled.

metric.name: IsSelectToSpeakEnabled
metric.summary: Boolean value to represent whether select to speak is currently enabled.

metric.name: IsSpokenFeedbackEnabled
metric.summary: Boolean value to represent whether the spoken feedback is currently enabled.

metric.name: IsSwitchAccessEnabled
metric.summary: Boolean value to represent whether Switch Access is currently enabled.

metric.name: IsVideoPlaying
metric.summary: Boolean value to represent whether video is currently playing.

metric.name: IsVirtualKeyboardEnabled
metric.summary: Boolean value to represent whether the virtual keyboard is currently enabled.

metric.name: LastActivityTimeSec
metric.summary: Time between the last activity and when the data was logged. A duration timestamp in seconds.

metric.name: NightLightTemperaturePercent
metric.summary: The temperature percentage of night light screen color adjustment when night light is on. Ranges from 0 to 100.

metric.name: NumRecentKeyEvents
metric.summary: The number of keyboard events in the last hour.

metric.name: NumRecentMouseEvents
metric.summary: The number of mouse events in the last hour.

metric.name: NumRecentStylusEvents
metric.summary: The number of stylus events in the last hour.

metric.name: NumRecentTouchEvents
metric.summary: The number of touch events in the last hour.

metric.name: OnBattery
metric.summary: Boolean value to represent whether the device is currently on battery power.

metric.name: PreviousBrightness
metric.summary: The brightness of the screen prior to the time at which the current event was logged.

metric.name: Reason
metric.summary: The reason that the event is logged. Values are enumerated in |chromeos::power::ml::ScreenBrightness::Event::Reason|.

metric.name: RecentTimeActiveSec
metric.summary: How long the user has been active. A duration timestamp in seconds.

metric.name: SequenceId
metric.summary: The ID of this event in the current session.

metric.name: TimeSinceLastEventSec
metric.summary: Time in seconds since last time an event was logged.

event.name: Security.SafetyTip
event.summary: Collected when any safety tip heuristic triggers, regardless of whether the Safety Tip UI is shown.

metric.name: SafetyTipInteraction
metric.summary: How the user interacted with the UI, if applicable.

metric.name: SafetyTipStatus
metric.summary: The final reported Safety Tip status.

metric.name: TriggeredKeywordsHeuristics
metric.summary: Whether the sensitive keywords heuristic triggered.

metric.name: TriggeredLookalikeHeuristics
metric.summary: Whether the lookalike keywords heuristic triggered.

metric.name: TriggeredServerSideBlocklist
metric.summary: Whether the server-side blocklist heuristic triggered.

metric.name: UserPreviouslyIgnored
metric.summary: Whether the user had already ignored a safety tip warning for this page in the past, meaning no tip was shown.

event.name: Security.SiteEngagement
event.summary: Site engagement score behavior for a page with a given Security Level.

metric.name: FinalSecurityLevel
metric.summary: The final SecurityLevel of the page before it is closed or another navigation occurs. Based on the enum security_state::SecurityLevel.

metric.name: InitialSecurityLevel
metric.summary: The initial SecurityLevel of the page when the navigation commits. Based on the enum security_state::SecurityLevel.

metric.name: SafetyTipStatus
metric.summary: The Safety Tip status of the page when the navigation commits, after the reputation check finishes.

metric.name: ScoreDelta
metric.summary: The change in Site Engagement score for the page before it is closed or another navigation occurs compared to the score from when the navigation committed. Score is between 0.0 and 100.0; delta is between -100.0 and 100.0. Rounded to the nearest integer.

metric.name: ScoreFinal
metric.summary: The final Site Engagement score for the page before it is closed or another navigation occurs. Score is between 0.0 and 100.0; this metric is rounded down to a multiple of 10 to limit granularity.

event.name: Sharing.ClickToCall
event.summary: Collected when a user finishes a Click to Call journey.

metric.name: EntryPoint
metric.summary: Specifies the entry point of the user journey (i.e. left click, right click, text selection).

metric.name: HasApps
metric.summary: Boolean value indicating whether any (>0) apps are available that the call could be sent to.

metric.name: HasDevices
metric.summary: Boolean value indicating whether any (>0) devices are available that the call could be sent to. These belong to the same account and are running Android.

metric.name: Selection
metric.summary: Whether the user selected a device, an app or nothing (i.e. dismissal) in the user interface. For some entry points this might always be the same value (e.g. right clicks always select devices).

event.name: SiteIsolation.XSD.Browser.Blocked
event.obsolete: Removed in June 2019 / M77. Some old data has been saved in a Google-internal doc at go/xsdb-ukm-results (ask owners below for access).
event.summary: Resource request response was blocked by the cross-site document blocking logic in the browser process.

metric.name: CanonicalMimeType
metric.summary: Classification of the Content-Type HTTP response header into one of the blockable document flavours: html, xml, json, plain.

metric.name: ContentLengthWasZero
metric.summary: ContentLengthWasZero=1 if Content-Length was available and equal to 0. ContentLengthWasZero=0 otherwise.

metric.name: ContentResourceType
metric.summary: content::ResourceType of the blocked resource (e.g. image / script / xhr / etc.).

metric.name: HttpResponseCode
metric.summary: The HTTP response code (e.g. 200 or 404) associated with the blocked resource request.

metric.name: NeededSniffing
metric.summary: Whether the HTTP response needed sniffing to confirm its MIME type.

event.name: SmartCharging
event.summary: Records user activities that are related to charging such as battery percentage, time, device type, etc.

metric.name: BatteryPercentage
metric.summary: Percentage of the battery.

metric.name: BatteryPercentageBeforeLastCharge
metric.summary: The percentage of the battery at the beginning of the last charge.

metric.name: BatteryPercentageOfLastCharge
metric.summary: The percentage of the battery that the last charge reached.

metric.name: DayOfMonth
metric.summary: Event's day of the month (e.g. 1-31) in local time zone.

metric.name: DayOfWeek
metric.summary: Event's day of the week in local time zone. Sunday is 0.

metric.name: DeviceMode
metric.summary: Mode of the device (e.g. closed lid, tablet).

metric.name: DeviceType
metric.summary: Type of the device (e.g. laptop, tablet).

metric.name: DurationOfLastCharge
metric.summary: Duratioin of the last time the device was charged in minutes.

metric.name: DurationRecentAudioPlaying
metric.summary: Duration of audio playing in the last 30 minutes (bucketized and in minutes).

metric.name: DurationRecentVideoPlaying
metric.summary: Duration of video playing in the last 30 minutes (bucketized and in minutes).

metric.name: EventId
metric.summary: A unique number that represent order of an event.

metric.name: HaltFromLastCharge
metric.summary: Whether there's any shutdown/suspend actions between the last charge and current event.

metric.name: IsCharging
metric.summary: Whether the device is being charged or not.

metric.name: Month
metric.summary: Event's month (e.g. Jan-Dec) in local time zone. January is 1.

metric.name: NumRecentKeyEvents
metric.summary: Number of key events in past 30 minutes.

metric.name: NumRecentMouseEvents
metric.summary: Number of mouse events in past 30 minutes.

metric.name: NumRecentStylusEvents
metric.summary: Number of stylus events in past 30 minutes.

metric.name: NumRecentTouchEvents
metric.summary: Number of touch events in past 30 minutes.

metric.name: Reason
metric.summary: Reason for the logging of an event.

metric.name: ScreenBrightnessPercent
metric.summary: Brightness of the screen in percent.

metric.name: TimeOfTheDay
metric.summary: Time of the event in minutes since midnight in the local time zone.

metric.name: TimeSinceLastCharge
metric.summary: Time since the last time user unplugged the charger in minutes.

metric.name: TimezoneDifferenceFromLastCharge
metric.summary: Timezone difference from the last charge. It is equal to current_timezone - timezone_from_last_charge. The valid range of time zone value will be -12 (UTC -12:00) to +14 (UTC +14:00).

metric.name: Voltage
metric.summary: Charge voltage in mV.

event.name: SMSReceiver
event.summary: Records performance metrics for SMSReceiver API.

metric.name: Outcome
metric.summary: Records the result of a call to the SmsReceiver API.

event.name: SSL.MixedContentShown
event.summary: Logged when mixed content is displayed on a site.

metric.name: Type
metric.summary: A value of the MixedContentType enum, detailing the type of mixed content included on the site.

event.name: SubframeDownload
event.summary: Measurement for subframe download. It is only recorded for downloads originated from navigations or from HTML anchor download attributes.

metric.name: HasGesture
metric.summary: A boolean denoting whether the download involves a transient user gesture.

metric.name: HasSandbox
metric.summary: A boolean denoting whether the download occurs in a sandboxed browsing context.

metric.name: IsAdFrame
metric.summary: A boolean denoting whether the download occurs in an ad subframe.

metric.name: IsCrossOrigin
metric.summary: A boolean denoting whether the download occurs in a subframe x-origin to the top frame.

event.name: SubresourceFilter
event.summary: Recorded for page loads where subresource filtering policy was evaluated.

metric.name: ActivationDecision
metric.summary: Enum that records the policy decision to activate subresource filtering for a page load. 0 = Unknown, 1 = Activated, 2 = Disabled, 3 = Deprecated value, 4 = URL whitelisted, 5 = Activation conditions not met. 'Activated' indicates that subresource filtering was activated. All other reasons indicate that subresource filtering was not activated.

metric.name: DryRun
