metric.summary: Records '1' if subresource filtering was activated in dry run mode. In dry run mode, subresource filtering policy is evaluated against resources loaded on the page, but subresource filtering is not actually applied.

metric.name: EnforcementRedirectPosition
metric.summary: An enum denoting where in the redirect chain there was a URL that matched one of the subresource_filter activation lists, and wasn't marked as warning. See subresource_filter::RedirectPosition for values.

event.name: Tab.RendererOOM
event.summary: Metrics about renderer OOM, recorded for each detected OOM of renderer process.

metric.name: TimeSinceLastNavigation
metric.summary: Duration in MS from when the main frame navigation was triggered to when the tab crashed with OOM. Recorded only on Windows, Android and Chrome OS. We do not have a way to detect OOMs reliably on Linux and Mac.

event.name: Tab.Screenshot
event.summary: User took one or more screenshots of a page.

metric.name: HasOccurred
metric.summary: A boolean signaling that the event has occurred; only records true values.

event.name: TabManager.Background.FirstAlertFired
event.summary: Collects the duration in MS from when the tab is backgrounded to when a JavaScript alert is fired. Only recorded when the tab is in the background.

metric.name: IsMainFrame
metric.summary: Indicates whether the alert is fired from main frame.

metric.name: TimeFromBackgrounded
metric.summary: Duration in MS from when the tab is backgrounded to when alert is fired.

event.name: TabManager.Background.FirstAudioStarts
event.summary: Collects the duration in MS from when the tab is backgrounded to when audio starts to play. Only recorded when the tab is in the background.

metric.name: IsMainFrame
metric.summary: Indicates whether the audio stream belongs to the main frame.

metric.name: TimeFromBackgrounded
metric.summary: Duration in MS from when the tab is backgrounded to when audio starts to play.

event.name: TabManager.Background.FirstFaviconUpdated
event.summary: Collects the duration in MS from when the tab is backgrounded to when the favicon is updated. Only recorded when the tab is in the background.

metric.name: TimeFromBackgrounded
metric.summary: Duration in MS from when the tab is backgrounded to when the favicon is updated.

metric.name: IsMainFrame
metric.summary: Indicates whether the notification creation is from the main frame.

metric.name: TimeFromBackgrounded
metric.summary: Duration in MS from when the tab is backgrounded to when a non-persistent notification is created.

event.name: TabManager.Background.FirstTitleUpdated
event.summary: Collects the duration in MS from when the tab is backgrounded to when the title is updated. Only recorded when the tab is in the background.

metric.name: TimeFromBackgrounded
metric.summary: Duration in MS from when the tab is backgrounded to when the title is updated.

event.name: TabManager.Background.ForegroundedOrClosed
event.summary: Collects the duration in MS from when the tab is backgrounded to when it is brought to foreground or closed.

metric.name: IsDiscarded
metric.summary: Boolean value indicating whether or not the tab is discarded since it was backgrounded.

metric.name: IsForegrounded
metric.summary: Boolean value indicating whether or not it's triggered because the tab is brought to foreground again.

metric.name: LabelId
metric.summary: An int64 random number generated when TabManager.TabMetric is logged. The same number is also logged here, so that feature label can be paired.

metric.name: MRUIndex
metric.obsolete: Deprecated 10/2019 in favor MRUIndex in TabMetrics.
metric.summary: Index of the tab in most-recently-used order. A value of N means there are N tabs more recently used than the one that is being foregrounded or closed.

metric.name: SequenceId
metric.summary: This metric is obsolete in 11/2018 in favor of LabelId for pairing with Tabmanager.TabMetrics event. The sequence of this event and TabManager.TabMetrics event in the current session. Incremented by 1 each time one of the two events is logged to provide an ordering of events.

metric.name: TimeFromBackgrounded
metric.summary: Duration in MS from when the tab is backgrounded to when it is brought to foreground or closed.

metric.name: TotalTabCount
metric.obsolete: Deprecated 10/2019 in favor TotalTabCount in TabMetrics.
metric.summary: Total number of tabs open across all non-incognito browser windows. Helps contextualize the MRUIndex value.

event.name: TabManager.BackgroundTabOpening.ForegroundTab.ExpectedTaskQueueingDurationInfo
event.summary: Collects the expected queueing duration of tasks and metadata for the foreground tab during a background tab opening session (the duration of time from when the browser starts to open background tabs until the time the browser has finished loading those tabs or otherwise decided to stop loading them). The event is not recorded when the session overlaps with session restore. This event is sampled when there is only one backgrounded loading or pending tab and all events are collected when there are 2 or more backgrounded loading or pending tabs. In this way, we cap the volume while keeping all interesting data. Therefore, aggregated tab counts over multiple events are invalid.

metric.name: BackgroundTabLoadingCount
metric.summary: Number of background tabs that are loading.

metric.name: BackgroundTabOpeningSessionId
metric.summary: The ID of this background tab opening session.

metric.name: BackgroundTabPendingCount
metric.summary: Number of background tabs that are pending.

metric.name: ExpectedTaskQueueingDuration
metric.summary: Duration in MS for expected task queueing duration. The metric reflects the responsiveness of a tab. A lower value means the tab will respond to inputs faster. This metric is equal to RendererScheduler.ExpectedTaskQueueingDuration. It is emitted once for all tasks in each 1000-ms window.

metric.name: SequenceId
metric.summary: The ID of this event's sequence in current background tab opening session.

metric.name: SystemTabCount
metric.summary: Number of all tabs of the system, which includes all browser windows.

event.name: TabManager.Experimental.BackgroundTabOpening.TabSwitchLoadStopped
event.summary: Collects data when a tab is switched to from another tab and then finishes loading in the foreground during a background tab opening session (the duration of time from when the browser starts to open background tabs until the time the browser has finished loading those tabs or otherwise decided to stop loading them). The event is only recorded when a tab is switched to from another tab within the same tabstrip. As a result, the initial foreground tab is not included in this event since it was not switched to from another tab. The event is not recorded when the session overlaps with session restore.

metric.name: BackgroundTabLoadingCount
metric.summary: Number of background tabs that are loading.

metric.name: BackgroundTabOpeningSessionId
metric.summary: The ID of this background tab opening session.

metric.name: BackgroundTabPendingCount
metric.summary: Number of background tabs that are pending.

metric.name: SequenceId
metric.summary: The ID of this event's sequence in current background tab opening session.

metric.name: SystemTabCount
metric.summary: Number of all tabs of the system, which includes all browser windows.

metric.name: TabSwitchLoadTime
metric.summary: Tab switch load time in MS. It is defined as the time between when the user switches to a backround tab, and the time when that tab finishes loading in the foreground. If the user switches away before the tab finishes loading, a metric will not be recorded unless the user switches back, in which case the tab switch load time is measured from that point in time.

event.name: TabManager.Experimental.SessionRestore.ForegroundTab.PageLoad
event.summary: Collects the tab counts for the foreground tab page load during session restore. The event is not recorded when the session overlaps with background tab opening. This event should be combined with PageLoad event for analysis.

metric.name: SessionRestoreTabCount
metric.summary: Number of tabs that are restored.

metric.name: SystemTabCount
metric.summary: Number of all tabs of the system, which includes all browser windows.

event.name: TabManager.Experimental.SessionRestore.TabSwitchLoadStopped
event.summary: Collects data when a tab is switched to from another tab and then finishes loading in the foreground during session restore The event is only recorded when a tab is switched to from another tab within the same tabstrip. As a result, the initial foreground tab is not included in this event since it was not switched to from another tab. The event is not recorded when the session overlaps with background tab opening.

metric.name: SequenceId
metric.summary: The ID of this event's sequence in current session restore session.

metric.name: SessionRestoreSessionId
metric.summary: The ID of this session restore session.

metric.name: SessionRestoreTabCount
metric.summary: Number of tabs that are restored.

metric.name: SystemTabCount
metric.summary: Number of all tabs of the system, which includes all browser windows.

metric.name: TabSwitchLoadTime
metric.summary: Tab switch load time in MS. It is defined as the time between when the user switches to a background tab, and the time when that tab finishes loading in the foreground. If the user switches away before the tab finishes loading, a metric will not be recorded unless the user switches back, in which case the tab switch load time is measured from that point in time.

event.name: TabManager.LifecycleStateChange
event.summary: Collects information about when and why a lifecycle state change was attempted, and information about the outcome of the attempt.

metric.name: FailureGlobalBlacklist
metric.summary: Boolean indicating that the tab was explicitly opted out of the intervention via the global blacklist.

metric.name: FailureHeuristicAudio
metric.summary: Boolean indicating that the intervention was disallowed because the origin has historically been observed emitting audio while in the background.

metric.name: FailureHeuristicFavicon
metric.summary: Boolean indicating that the intervention was disallowed because the origin has historically been observed updating its favicon while in the background.

metric.name: FailureHeuristicInsufficientObservation
metric.summary: Boolean indicating that the site is still being observed locally in order to determine which features are in use. In the meantime, it is protected from this intervention.

metric.name: FailureHeuristicNotifications
metric.summary: Boolean indicating that the intervention was disallowed because the origin has historically been observed making use of notifications while in the background.

metric.name: FailureHeuristicTitle
metric.summary: Boolean indicating that the intervention was disallowed because the origin has historically been observed updating its tab title while in the background.

metric.name: FailureLifecyclesEnterprisePolicyOptOut
metric.summary: Boolean indicating that the browser was explicitly opted out of the intervention via enterprise policy.

metric.name: FailureLifecyclesFeaturePolicyOptOut
metric.summary: Boolean indicating that the tab explicitly opted out of the intervention via feature policy.

metric.name: FailureLiveStateCapturing
metric.summary: Boolean indicating that the intervention was disallowed because the tab is currently capturing user media (making use of webcam or microphone, for example).

metric.name: FailureLiveStateDesktopCapture
metric.summary: Boolean indicating that the intervention was disallowed because the tab is currently capturing a window or screen.

metric.name: FailureLiveStateDevToolsOpen
metric.summary: Boolean indicating that the intervention was disallowed because the tab is currently using DevTools.

metric.name: FailureLiveStateExtensionDisallowed
metric.summary: Boolean indicating that the intervention was disallowed by an extension.

metric.name: FailureLiveStateFormEntry
metric.summary: Boolean indicating that the intervention was disallowed because the tab currently contains text form entry.

metric.name: FailureLiveStateHasNotificationsPermission
metric.summary: Boolean indicating that the intervention was disallowed because the tab has the permission to use notifications.

metric.name: FailureLiveStateIsPDF
metric.summary: Boolean indicating that the intervention was disallowed because the tab is currently hosting a PDF.

metric.name: FailureLiveStateMirroring
metric.summary: Boolean indicating that the intervention was disallowed because the tab is currently being mirrored (casting its contents, for example).

metric.name: FailureLiveStatePlayingAudio
metric.summary: Boolean indicating that the intervention was disallowed because the tab is currently playing audio.

metric.name: FailureLiveStateSharingBrowsingInstance
metric.summary: Boolean indicating that the intervention was disallowed because the tab is sharing its BrowsingInstance with at least one other tab.

metric.name: FailureLiveStateUsingBluetooth
metric.summary: Boolean indicating that the intervention was disallowed because the tab is currently connected to at least one bluetooth device.

metric.name: FailureLiveStateUsingIndexedDBLock
metric.summary: Boolean indicating that the intervention was disallowed because the tab is currently holding at least one IndexedDB lock.

metric.name: FailureLiveStateUsingWebLock
metric.summary: Boolean indicating that the intervention was disallowed because the tab is currently holding at least one WebLock.

metric.name: FailureLiveStateUsingWebSockets
metric.summary: Boolean indicating that the intervention was disallowed because the tab is currently using WebSockets.

metric.name: FailureLiveStateUsingWebUSB
metric.summary: Boolean indicating that the intervention was disallowed because the tab is currently using WebUSB.

metric.name: FailureLiveStateVisible
metric.summary: Boolean indicating that the intervention was disallowed because the tab is currently visible.

metric.name: FailureLiveWebApp
metric.summary: Boolean indicating that the intervention was disallowed because the tab is a web application window.

metric.name: FailureOriginTrialOptOut
metric.summary: Boolean indicating that the tab explicitly opted out of the intervention via origin trial.

metric.name: FailureOriginTrialUnknown
metric.summary: Boolean indicating that the tab did not report its origin trial opt-in/opt-out yet.

metric.name: LifecycleStateChangeReason
metric.summary: The reason the lifecycle state change was attempted. This corresponds to the LifecycleStateChangeReason enumeration in lifecycle_unit_state.mojom.

metric.name: NewLifecycleState
metric.summary: The lifecycle state the tab will be in after the state change. Corresponds to a value from the LifecycleUnitState enum defined in lifecycle_unit_state.mojom.

metric.name: OldLifecycleState
metric.summary: The lifecycle state the tab was in prior to the state change. Corresponds to a value from the LifecycleUnitState enum defined in lifecycle_unit_state.mojom.

metric.name: Outcome
metric.summary: Whether or not the state change was successful. The various Failure and Success booleans encode the actual reasons for this outcome. Note that multiple success and failure reasons may be encoded for a single decision. The presence of any failure bit indicates a negative outcome. If only success bits are present the outcome is positive.

metric.name: SuccessGlobalWhitelist
metric.summary: Boolean indicating that the tab was explicitly opted in to the intervention via the global whitelist.

metric.name: SuccessHeuristic
metric.summary: Boolean indicating that the tab was deemed safe for the intervention via local observations and heuristics.

metric.name: SuccessLifecyclesFeaturePolicyOptIn
metric.summary: Boolean indicating that the tab explicitly opted in to the intervention via feature policy.

metric.name: SuccessOriginTrialOptIn
metric.summary: Boolean indicating that the tab explicitly opted in to the intervention via origin trial.

metric.name: TimeSinceNavigationMs
metric.summary: The time elapsed (in milliseconds) since the top-level navigation was committed that loaded this tab's content.

metric.name: TimeSinceVisibilityStateChangeMs
metric.summary: The amount of time that has passed (in milliseconds) since the last visibility state change.

metric.name: TransitionForced
metric.summary: This is set if the transition to the new lifecycle state was forced by the browser because the content took too long to respond to the lifecycle event.

metric.name: VisibilityState
metric.summary: The current visibility state. This is an integer value corresponding to the enumeration in content/public/browser/visibility.h.

event.name: TabManager.SessionRestore.ForegroundTab.ExpectedTaskQueueingDurationInfo
event.summary: Collects the expected queueing duration of tasks and metadata for the foreground tab during session restore. The event is not recorded when the session overlaps with background tab opening. The event is not recorded when there is only one restored tab, in which case, there is no background restored tab and we are not interested at that. In this way, we cap the volume while keeping all interesting data.

metric.name: ExpectedTaskQueueingDuration
metric.summary: Duration in MS for expected task queueing duration. The metric reflects the responsiveness of a tab. A lower value means the tab will respond to inputs faster. This metric is equal to RendererScheduler.ExpectedTaskQueueingDuration. It is emitted once for all tasks in each 1000-ms window.

metric.name: SequenceId
metric.summary: The ID of this event's sequence in current session restore session.

metric.name: SessionRestoreSessionId
metric.summary: The ID of this session restore session.

metric.name: SessionRestoreTabCount
metric.summary: Number of tabs that are restored.

metric.name: SystemTabCount
metric.summary: Number of all tabs of the system, which includes all browser windows.

event.name: TabManager.TabLifetime
event.summary: Collected when a tab is closed, at most once per source.

metric.name: TimeSinceNavigation
metric.summary: The time when the tab was closed, expressed as the amount of time in MS that has elapsed since the main frame navigation providing the content of the tab.

event.name: TabManager.TabMetrics
event.summary: Collects tab information for a tab after navigations, activations and close events.

metric.name: ContentType
metric.summary: Obsolete. Enumeration for the MIME type of the page. Values are enumerated in metrics::TabMetricsEvent::ContentType.

metric.name: DefaultProtocolHandler
metric.summary: Obsolete. Schemes that a page from this page's origin is the default protocol handler for, meaning the user has chosen to accept (or the handler was preinstalled by Chrome). The metric is repeated, occurring for each such protocol handler, and uses values from metrics::TabMetricsEvent::Scheme.

metric.name: HasBeforeUnloadHandler
metric.summary: Boolean value indicating whether the page has a beforeunload JavaScript event handler.

metric.name: HasFormEntry
metric.summary: Boolean value indicating whether the page has any user-input text.

metric.name: IsExtensionProtected
metric.summary: Obsolete. True if an extension has marked this tab as non-discardable via the chrome.tabs.update() extension API.

metric.name: IsPinned
metric.summary: Boolean value indicating whether the tab is pinned in the tabstrip.

metric.name: KeyEventCount
metric.summary: Number of key events that were sent to the page.

metric.name: LabelId
metric.summary: An int64 random number generated at logging time. The same number will also be logged to the TabManager.Background.ForegroundedOrClosed event, so that feature label can be paired.

metric.name: MouseEventCount
metric.summary: Number of mouse events that were sent to the page.

metric.name: MRUIndex
metric.summary: Index of the tab in most-recently-used order. A value of N means there are N tabs more recently used than the one that is being foregrounded or closed.

metric.name: NavigationEntryCount
metric.summary: Number of navigation entries in the tab's NavigationController. Corresponds to the size of the tab's back/forward list.

metric.name: NumReactivationBefore
metric.summary: Number of reactivations that this tab had till now.

metric.name: PageTransitionCoreType
metric.summary: Type of the page transition for this navigation. Uses the core values from ui::PageTransition.

metric.name: PageTransitionFromAddressBar
metric.summary: True if the page transition came from interacting with the address bar, such as by typing a URL or performing a search.

metric.name: PageTransitionIsRedirect
metric.summary: True if the page transition type is a redirect, in which case the PageTransition type may not be accurate.

metric.name: QueryId
metric.summary: An int64 random number generated at query time of TabManager::GetSortedLifecycleUnitsFromTabRanker. Tabs with the same QueryId will be later on combined in one full list for further analysis.

metric.name: SequenceId
metric.summary: This metric is obsolete in 11/2018 in favor of LabelId for pairing with Tabmanager.ForegroundedOrClosed event. The sequence of this event and TabManager.ForegroundedOrClosed event in the current session. Incremented by 1 each time one of the two events is logged to provide an ordering of events.

metric.name: SiteEngagementScore
metric.summary: Site engagement score in the range [0, 100], rounded down to a multiple of 10 to limit granularity.

metric.name: TimeFromBackgrounded
metric.summary: Duration in MS from when the tab is backgrounded to when it is brought to foreground or closed.

metric.name: TotalTabCount
metric.summary: Total number of tabs open across all non-incognito browser windows. Helps contextualize the MRUIndex value.

metric.name: TouchEventCount
metric.summary: Number of touch events that were sent to the page.

metric.name: WasRecentlyAudible
metric.summary: Boolean value indicating whether the tab has played audio within the last two seconds.

metric.name: WindowId
metric.obsolete: Deprecated 11/2018 in favor of putting window features directly in this event.
metric.summary: WindowId of the WindowMetrics entry corresponding to the browser window containing this tab. This metrics is not populated from 11/2018 because we don't need to join this event with other WindowMetrics any more.

metric.name: WindowIsActive
metric.summary: Boolean value indicating whether the window is the active (frontmost) window.

metric.name: WindowShowState
metric.summary: Enumeration of the window show state, such as fullscreen or minimized. Values are enumerated in metrics::WindowMetricsEvent::ShowState.

metric.name: WindowTabCount
metric.summary: Number of tabs in the tab strip. Rounded down to the nearest exponential bucket (with a bucket spacing factor of 1.5). Will be 1 for windows with only one top-level WebContents, such as app windows.

metric.name: WindowType
metric.summary: Enumeration for the type of the window. Values are enumerated in metrics::WindowMetricsEvent::Type.

event.name: TabManager.WindowMetrics
event.summary: Collects information about a browser or app window to associate with the TabManager.TabMetrics entries for tabs in that window.

metric.name: IsActive
metric.summary: Whether the window is the active (frontmost) window.

metric.name: ShowState
metric.summary: Enumeration of the window show state, such as fullscreen or minimized. Values are enumerated in metrics::WindowMetricsEvent::ShowState.

metric.name: TabCount
metric.summary: Number of tabs in the tab strip. Rounded down to the nearest exponential bucket (with a bucket spacing factor of 1.5). Will be 1 for windows with only one top-level WebContents, such as app windows.

metric.name: Type
metric.summary: Enumeration for the type of the window. Values are enumerated in metrics::WindowMetricsEvent::Type.

metric.name: WindowId
metric.summary: Session ID of the browser or app window this entry represents, unique for the browsing session.

event.name: TouchToFill.Shown
event.summary: Recorded when the Touch To Fill sheet is shown to the user.

metric.name: UserAction
metric.summary: The action a user took when interacting with the Touch To Fill sheet.

event.name: Translate
event.summary: Metrics related to a Translate event. These metrics are described in TranslateEventProto.

event.name: TrustedWebActivity.Open
event.summary: Collected when a page is opened in a Trusted Web Activity.

metric.name: HasOccurred
metric.summary: A boolean signaling that the event has occurred (typically only records true values).

event.name: UserActivity
event.summary: Collects user activity events after staying idle for a short period of time.

metric.name: BatteryPercent
metric.summary: Percentage of battery, bucketed to 5 percents, i.e. [0, 5%) is mapped to 0, [5%, 10%) is mapped to 5 etc.

metric.name: DeviceManagement
metric.summary: An enum representing whether the device is managed, defined in |chromeos::power::ml::UserActivityEvent::Features::ManagementType|.

metric.name: DeviceMode
metric.summary: An enum representing the mode of the device, defined in |chromeos::power::ml::UserActivityEvent::Feature::DeviceMode|

metric.name: DeviceType
metric.summary: An enum representing the type of the device, defined in |chromeos::power::ml::UserActivityEvent::Feature::DeviceType|

metric.name: EventLogDuration
metric.summary: Time taken in seconds from when we start logging the features to the moment when the event type is known and we finish logging the complete event.

metric.name: EventReason
metric.summary: An enum representing the reason of the event, defined in |chromeos::power::ml::UserActivityEvent::Event::Reason|.

metric.name: EventType
metric.summary: An enum representing the type of the event, defined in |chromeos::power::ml::UserActivityEvent::Event::Type|.

metric.name: KeyEventsInLastHour
metric.summary: The number of key events reported as user activity in the last hour. This is bucketized so that it is recorded precisely when it is in [0, 99], rounded to nearest 100 when it is in [100, 999] and rounded to nearest 1000 when it is in [1000, 9999]. It is capped at 10000.

metric.name: LastActivityDay
metric.summary: An enum representing the last activity day of the week, defined in |chromeos::power::ml::UserActivityEvent::Feature::DayOfWeek|.

metric.name: LastActivityTime
metric.summary: Last activity time as hours since midnight in the local time zone.

metric.name: LastUserActivityTime
metric.summary: Last user activity time as hours since midnight in the local time zone.

metric.name: ModelApplied
metric.summary: A boolean value whether model prediction is applied in the screen-dim decision. False means powerd dims the screen regardless of the model prediction.

metric.name: ModelDecisionThreshold
metric.summary: A threhold in the range of [0, 100]. Higher threshold makes screen-dim less likely.

metric.name: ModelInactivityScore
metric.summary: Probability that user will remain inactive as predicted by the model. It is in the range of [0, 100]. If score is less than the decision threshold, dim will be deferred.

metric.name: ModelResponse
metric.summary: Whether the model recommends the screen dim should be deferred (NO_DIM) or allowed (DIM), or encountered an error (MODEL_ERROR).

metric.name: MouseEventsInLastHour
metric.summary: The number of mouse events reported as user activity in the last hour. This is bucketized so that it is recorded precisely when it is in [0, 99], rounded to nearest 100 when it is in [100, 999] and rounded to nearest 1000 when it is in [1000, 9999]. It is capped at 10000.

metric.name: OnBattery
metric.summary: Boolean value to represent whether the device is currently on battery power.

metric.name: PreviousNegativeActionsCount
metric.summary: Number of times user reactivated, not including the current event.

metric.name: PreviousPositiveActionsCount
metric.summary: Number of times user has remained idle, not including the current event.

metric.name: RecentTimeActive
metric.summary: Duration of activity in seconds up to last activity.

metric.name: RecentVideoPlayingTime
metric.summary: Recent video playing time in seconds.

metric.name: ScreenDimDelay
metric.summary: Delay after which the screen will be dimmed in seconds.

metric.name: ScreenDimmedInitially
metric.summary: Whether screen was dimmed at the start of the event.

metric.name: ScreenDimOccurred
metric.summary: Whether screen dim occurred due to inactivity timeout.

metric.name: ScreenDimToOffDelay
metric.summary: Delay after which the screen will be turned off in seconds, as measured from screen is dimmed. If dim is diabled, it is the delay from the start of inactivity.

metric.name: ScreenLockedInitially
metric.summary: Whether screen was locked at the start of the event.

metric.name: ScreenLockOccurred
metric.summary: Whether screen lock occurred.

metric.name: ScreenOffInitially
metric.summary: Whether screen was off at the start of the event.

metric.name: ScreenOffOccurred
metric.summary: Whether screen off occurred due to inactivity timeout.

metric.name: SequenceId
metric.summary: The ID of this event in the current session.

metric.name: TimeSinceLastKey
metric.summary: Time from last key event in seconds.

metric.name: TimeSinceLastMouse
metric.summary: Time from last mouse event in seconds.

metric.name: TimeSinceLastTouch
metric.summary: Time from last touch event in seconds.

metric.name: TimeSinceLastVideoEnded
metric.summary: Time from the end of the last video playing in seconds.

metric.name: TouchEventsInLastHour
metric.summary: The number of touch events reported as user activity in the last hour. This is bucketized so that it is recorded precisely when it is in [0, 99], rounded to nearest 100 when it is in [100, 999] and rounded to nearest 1000 when it is in [1000, 9999]. It is capped at 10000.

event.name: UserActivityId
event.summary: Records an activity that happened while a page was open.

metric.name: ActivityId
metric.summary: The ID of the activity that happened while a page was open.

metric.name: ContentType
metric.summary: Enumeration for the MIME type of the page. Values are enumerated in metrics::TabMetricsEvent::ContentType.

metric.name: HasFormEntry
metric.summary: Boolean value indicating whether the page has any user-input text.

metric.name: IsActive
metric.summary: Boolean value representing whether this tab is selected in its containing browser.

metric.name: IsBrowserFocused
metric.summary: Boolean value representing whether the containing browser is in focus.

metric.name: IsBrowserVisible
metric.summary: Boolean value representing whether the containing browser is visible.

metric.name: IsTopmostBrowser
metric.summary: Boolean value representing whether the containing browser is the topmost one on the screen.

metric.name: SiteEngagementScore
metric.summary: Site engagement score in the range [0, 100], rounded down to a multiple of 10 to limit granularity.

event.name: UserSettingsEvent
event.summary: Contains information about user activities relating to settings changes.

metric.name: AccessibilityId
metric.summary: The accessibility setting that was changed.

metric.name: BatteryPercentage
metric.summary: Battery percentage from 0 to 100.

metric.name: Country
metric.summary: Country ID at install, corresponding to the value used by src/components/country_codes/country_codes.h.

metric.name: CurrentValue
metric.summary: Value of the setting after the change.

metric.name: DayOfWeek
metric.summary: Day of the week of the settings change.

metric.name: DeviceMode
metric.summary: The current device mode, such as clamshell or tablet.

metric.name: DeviceOrientation
metric.summary: The current orientation of the device.

metric.name: EventId
metric.summary: Randomly generated ID that links together settings events that occured at the same time.

metric.name: HasNightLightSchedule
metric.summary: A boolean indicating whether the user has set up a night light schedule.

metric.name: HasWifiSecurity
metric.summary: A boolean indicating whether or not the current wifi network has security. Only populated upon connection to a wifi network.

metric.name: HourOfDay
metric.summary: Time in hours since midnight in the local time zone.

metric.name: IsAfterSunset
metric.summary: A boolean, true if it is after sunset and before sunrise in the local time.

metric.name: IsCharging
metric.summary: A boolean indicating whether the device is charging.

metric.name: IsFromSearch
metric.summary: A boolean indicating whether or not search was used to navigate to the setting.

metric.name: IsPairedBluetoothDevice
metric.summary: A boolean indicating whether or not the current bluetooth device was already paired. Only populated upon connection to a bluetooth device.

metric.name: IsPlayingAudio
metric.summary: A boolean indicating whether the device is playing audio.

metric.name: IsPlayingVideo
metric.summary: A boolean indicating whether the device is playing video.

metric.name: IsRecentlyFullscreen
metric.summary: A boolean indicating whether the device has been in fullscreen mode in the last 5 minutes.

metric.name: IsRecentlyPresenting
metric.summary: A boolean indicating whether the device has been presenting in the last 5 minutes.

metric.name: NetworkStatus
metric.summary: Internet connection status of the device.

metric.name: PreviousValue
metric.summary: Value of the setting before the change.

metric.name: SettingId
metric.summary: The setting that was changed.

metric.name: SettingType
metric.summary: Where the settings event originated from.

metric.name: SignalStrength
metric.summary: The signal strength for the connected network. Only populated upon connection to a wifi or cellular network.

metric.name: TimeSinceLastSettingsChange
metric.summary: Time in minutes since the last settings change.

metric.name: UsedCellularInSession
metric.summary: A boolean indicating whether the user has connected to a cellular network in the current session.

event.name: VirtualKeyboard.Open
event.summary: Collects the used input types with the Virtual Keyboard.

metric.name: TextInputType
metric.summary: Type of a input field which the user is trying to use the Virtual Keyboard on.

event.name: WebAPK.Install
event.summary: WebAPK usage metrics recorded on Install.

metric.name: AppVersion
metric.summary: WebAPK app version that the user is installing.

metric.name: Distributor
metric.summary: Distribution source of the WebAPK (browser, device policy, etc).

metric.name: Install
metric.summary: Recorded when this WebAPK is installed.

event.name: WebAPK.SessionEnd
event.summary: WebAPK usage metrics recorded when the WebAPK is backgrounded.

metric.name: AppVersion
metric.summary: WebAPK app version that the user has installed.

metric.name: Distributor
metric.summary: Distribution source of the WebAPK (browser, device policy, etc).

metric.name: SessionDuration
metric.summary: How long the user spent inside the WebAPK, in milliseconds. This will use exponential bucketing (ie, count in 10s of milliseconds at first, then 100s, then seconds, 10s of seconds, minutes, 10 minutes, hours, 10 hours, days, weeks, years.)

event.name: WebAPK.Uninstall
event.summary: WebAPK usage metrics recorded on Uninstall.

metric.name: AppVersion
metric.summary: WebAPK app version that the user has installed.

metric.name: Distributor
metric.summary: Distribution source of the WebAPK (browser, device policy, etc).

metric.name: InstalledDuration
metric.summary: How long between Install and Uninstall of a particular WebAPK, in seconds. This will use exponential bucketing (ie, count in seconds at first, then 10s of seconds, minutes, 10 minutes, hours, 10 hours, days, weeks, years.)

metric.name: LifetimeLaunches
metric.summary: Records how many times the WebAPK was launched between install and uninstall (in coarse buckets).

metric.name: Uninstall
metric.summary: Recorded when this WebAPK is uninstalled.

event.name: WebAPK.Visit
event.summary: WebAPK usage metrics recorded during a user's interaction with the site.

metric.name: AppVersion
metric.summary: WebAPK app version that the user has installed.

metric.name: Distributor
metric.summary: Distribution source of the WebAPK (browser, device policy, etc).

metric.name: Launch
metric.summary: Recorded every time this WebAPK is launched.

metric.name: LaunchSource
metric.summary: Launch source of the WebAPK.

event.name: WebApp.DailyInteraction
event.summary: Features of a web app recorded at most once per day if a user interacted with the web app. Recorded for both installed and promotable (installable) web apps unless noted otherwise on the metric.

metric.name: BackgroundDuration
metric.summary: Records the total duration (seconds, bucketed) that the app was open in the background in the last calendar day. Summed during the day and emitted if the date changes. Recorded only for installed web apps that open with standalone display mode.

metric.name: DisplayMode
metric.summary: Effective display mode of the web app (may be set by a manifest and manifest may be overridden by the user).

metric.name: ForegroundDuration
metric.summary: Records the total duration (seconds, bucketed) that the app was open in the foreground in the last calendar day. Summed during the day and emitted if the date changes. Recorded only for installed web apps that open with standalone display mode.

metric.name: Installed
metric.summary: Whether the web app is installed.

metric.name: InstallSource
metric.summary: Install source of the web app (omnibox, menu item, policy, etc).

metric.name: NumSessions
metric.summary: Records the total number of times the app was focused in the foreground in the last calendar day. Recorded only for installed web apps that open with standalone display mode.

metric.name: Promotable
metric.summary: Whether the web app is currently considered 'promotable' (passes Chrome checks to be considered an installable web app).

metric.name: Used
metric.summary: Records that the web app was used. Always true (or the event would not have been emitted for this WebApp).

event.name: WebRTC.AddressHarvesting
event.summary: Collects usage patterns that may indicate attempts to gather users' IP addresses. A heuristic in the webrtc library tries to detect usages that may indicate attempts to gather users' IP addresses rather than setting up communication via WebRTC, and reports possible attempts.

metric.name: UsagePattern
metric.summary: The usage pattern detected (an int encoding bit values). The bits are defined in third_party/webrtc/pc/peerconnection.h, in the "PeerConnection::UsageEvent" enum.

event.name: WebRTC.ComplexSdp
event.summary: Logged when an application uses complex SDP in a WebRTC PeerConnection or experiences an error attempting to parse SDP. Such cases will result in errors if the application assumes the wrong default SDP format. This is an important concern during the transition of the default SDP format from Plan B to Unified Plan.

metric.name: Category
metric.summary: A value that represents how complex/unparsable SDP is used. The categories are defined in blink::ComplexSdpCategory.

event.name: XR.PageSession
event.summary: Records properties of page use in XR, including VR browsing and WebXR presentation.

metric.name: Duration
metric.summary: The approximate amount of time the user spends on a page in XR in seconds. Times are reported accurately when low, for example, under a minute, and get rounded to minutes and then hours as they get larger. This is done by SessionTracker::GetRoundedDurationInSeconds.

metric.name: EnteredFullscreen
metric.summary: A boolean that is set to 1 if the user requested fullscreen while in XR on some element on the page.

metric.name: EnteredVROnPageReason
metric.summary: An enum that indicates that the user entered VR on this page and what triggered the entry into VR, where 1 means VR was entered through headset activation, and 2 means that request presentation triggered the entry into VR.

metric.name: TimeOnPage
metric.summary: Deprecated.

metric.name: WasOmniboxNavigation
metric.summary: A boolean that is set to 1 if this page was entered into the omnibox, either manually or using autocomplete.

metric.name: WasVoiceSearchNavigation
metric.summary: A boolean that is set to 1 if this page was specifically requested and recognized by a voice search.

event.name: XR.WebXR
event.summary: Records information about WebXR methods that were used in a single navigation. The event will be recorded as the WebXR functions are called - since the event is singular, the data that will eventualy be sent will contain a union of metrics that were set in an event.

metric.name: DidGetGamepads
metric.summary: Boolean value that indicates that the Gamepad API was used on a WebXR site.

metric.name: DidGetXRInputSources
metric.summary: Boolean value that indicates that the WebXR input API was used.

metric.name: DidRequestAvailableDevices
metric.summary: Boolean value that indicates that the API to enumerate devices was called. This API is only exposed through WebVR.

metric.name: DidRequestPose
metric.summary: Boolean value that indicates that poses were requested.

metric.name: DidRequestPresentation
metric.summary: Boolean value that indicates that presentation was requested.

metric.name: DidUseNavigatorXR
metric.summary: Boolean value that indicates that the WebXR Device API was used.

metric.name: ReturnedDevice
metric.summary: Boolean value that indicates that a device was returned by the API to enumerate devices. This API is only exposed through WebVR.

metric.name: ReturnedPresentationCapableDevice
metric.summary: Boolean value that indicates that a device was returned by the API to enumerate devices, and that the device supports presentation.

event.name: XR.WebXR.PresentationSession
event.summary: Records data for a presentation session, where WebXR is running an exclusive presentation to some device.

metric.name: Duration
metric.summary: The approximate amount of time the user spends in presentation in seconds. Times are reported accurately when low, for example, under a minute, and get rounded to minutes and then hours as they get larger. This is done by SessionTracker::GetRoundedDurationInSeconds.

metric.name: StartAction
metric.summary: An enum value to track specifically how the user got into XR presentation. See `vr::PresentationStartAction` for enum type declaration. 0: Other, catch all. 1: RequestFrom2DBrowsing, the page requested presentation while Chrome was in 2D mode. 2: RequestFromVRBrowsing, the page requested presentation while Chrome was in VR browsing mode. 3: HeadsetActivation, the user activated the VR headset while in 2D browsing on the page, which listens for headset activations to request presentation. 4: DeepLinkedApp (Obsolete), The page was launched in Chrome from the VR system home (e.g., Daydream Home) and requested presentation.

event.name: XR.WebXR.Session
event.summary: When session ends, records data for a WebXR / WebVR session.

metric.name: Duration
metric.summary: The approximate amount of time (in seconds) that elapsed from session creation to session end. Times are reported accurately when low, for example, under a minute, and get rounded to minutes and then hours as they get larger. This is done by SessionTracker::GetRoundedDurationInSeconds. For inline sessions, this might get pretty large.

metric.name: FeatureRequest.BoundedFloor
metric.summary: State of the 'bounded-floor' feature request.

metric.name: FeatureRequest.Local
metric.summary: State of the 'local' feature request.

metric.name: FeatureRequest.LocalFloor
metric.summary: State of the 'local-floor' feature request.

metric.name: FeatureRequest.Unbounded
metric.summary: State of the 'unbounded' feature request.

metric.name: FeatureRequest.Viewer
metric.summary: State of the 'viewer' feature request.

metric.name: FeatureUse.BoundedFloor
metric.summary: Whether the 'bounded-floor' feature was used during this session, regardless of whether it was used successfully.

metric.name: FeatureUse.Local
metric.summary: Whether the 'local' feature was used during this session, regardless of whether it was used successfully.

metric.name: FeatureUse.LocalFloor
metric.summary: Whether the 'local-floor' feature was used during this session, regardless of whether it was used successfully.

metric.name: FeatureUse.Unbounded
metric.summary: Whether the 'unbounded' feature was used during this session, regardless of whether it was used successfully.

metric.name: FeatureUse.Viewer
metric.summary: Whether the 'viewer' feature was used during this session, regardless of whether it was used successfully.

metric.name: IsLegacyWebVR
metric.summary: Boolean value indicating whether a session was created using the legacy WebVR API rather than WebXR.

metric.name: Mode

event.name: XR.WebXR.SessionRequest
event.summary: Recorded when promise returned by `requestSession` gets resolved / rejected.

metric.name: Feature.BoundedFloor
metric.summary: State of the 'bounded-floor' feature request.

metric.name: Feature.Local
metric.summary: State of the 'local' feature request.

metric.name: Feature.LocalFloor
metric.summary: State of the 'local-floor' feature request.

metric.name: Feature.Unbounded
metric.summary: State of the 'unbounded' feature request.

metric.name: Feature.Viewer
metric.summary: State of the 'viewer' feature request.

metric.name: Mode
metric.summary: An enum value that indicates that the `requestSession` API was called to request session with this mode. See `device::SessionMode` for enum type declaration. 0: Unknown, catch all. 1: Inline session was requested. 2: Immersive VR session was requested. 3: Immersive AR session was requested.

metric.name: Status
metric.summary: An enum value that describes the result of the call to `requestSession` method. See `` for enum type declaration. 0: Success. 1: Other failure.
